original: der sbyor ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: der sbyor ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application is the application of those outside this doctrine to that which is not the sense bases.

original: de la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: mi shes pa'am lta ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gis skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa'am lta ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gis skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is the affliction of ignorance or view by which one applies oneself to that which is not the sense bases.

original: sbyor ba de nyid la ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba de nyid la ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: That very application is the obscuration.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin ni thabs te /üîΩgang gi thabs gang yin pa de las gzhan du sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin ni thabs te / gang gi thabs gang yin pa de las gzhan du sbyor ba ni /
translated: Application to what is improper is the application to that which is not the means.üîΩThe means is the method.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application to that which is other than the means is application to what is improper.

original: bstan pa 'di nyid las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di nyid las 'di lta ste /
translated: This very doctrine states:

original: 'dod chags spyod pa la byams pa bsgom pa ni 'dod chags spong ba'i thabs ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang spyod pa la mi sdug pa bsgom pa zhes 'byung ba'o //üîΩ'dir yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa la byams pa bsgom pa ni 'dod chags spong ba'i thabs ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang spyod pa la mi sdug pa bsgom pa zhes 'byung ba'o // 'dir yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúFor one who practices desire, the cultivation of loving kindness is not the means for abandoning desire, and for one who practices hatred, the cultivation of the impurity of the body is not the means for abandoning hatred.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu ni sbyor ba'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni sbyor ba'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Here, the improper mental attention or its cause is the obscuration to application.

original: byang chub kyi sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba /
translated: The three obstructions to enlightenment are:

original: byang chub ni don ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni don ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the understanding of the meaning just as it is.

original: dge ba mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The non-arising of virtue has already been explained.

original: mi skye ba ji ltar sgrib ce na /
analyzed: mi skye ba ji ltar sgrib ce na /
translated: How can non-arising be an obstruction?

original: dge ba med na byang chub tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba med na byang chub tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no virtue, there is no enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir dge ba mi skye ba ni byang chub kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba mi skye ba ni byang chub kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the non-arising of virtue is an obstruction to enlightenment.

original: yang na gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi tshe dge ba la skye ba la sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de nyid byang chub kyi sgrib pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnas skabs kyi bye brag gi tshe dge ba la skye ba la sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de nyid byang chub kyi sgrib pa yang yin te /
translated: Or, the afflictions that obstruct the arising of virtue at a particular stage are also obstructions to enlightenment.

original: gang tshogs gang gis sgrib par nges pa de ni de'i 'bras bu'i sgrib pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gang tshogs gang gis sgrib par nges pa de ni de'i 'bras bu'i sgrib pa yang yin no //
translated: Whatever is ascertained to obstruct a particular collection is also an obstruction to its result.

original: skyes zin pa yang yid la mi byed pa ni mi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: skyes zin pa yang yid la mi byed pa ni mi bsgom pa ste /
translated: Non-cultivation is not bringing to mind what has already arisen.

original: spel bar mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spel bar mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not increasing.

original: le lo la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang gis gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang la dge ba skyes kyang yang dang yang yid la mi byed pa de ni 'dir sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang gis gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang la dge ba skyes kyang yang dang yang yid la mi byed pa de ni 'dir sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscurations here are those afflictions such as laziness that prevent the generation of virtue, even when it has arisen, from being repeatedly brought to mind.

original: tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The incomplete accumulations are

original: tshogs ji snyed kyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi @226b tshogs de snyed ma rdzogs pa dang / gong ma lta bu'i gnas skabs kyi nyon mongs pa'am tshogs chung ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs ji snyed kyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi @226b tshogs de snyed ma rdzogs pa dang / gong ma lta bu'i gnas skabs kyi nyon mongs pa'am tshogs chung ba'o //
translated: the incomplete accumulations of merit and knowledge that would lead to enlightenment, and the afflictions that occur as above, or a small accumulation.

original: gzhan dag na re bye brag tu ma bshad kyang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ni 'dir mi skye ba la bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bye brag tu ma bshad kyang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ni 'dir mi skye ba la bya bar 'dod de /
translated: Others believe that, although not specifically mentioned, the obscurations to the factors conducive to penetrative insight are also obscurations here, since they prevent the latter from arising.

original: gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not obscurations to the others.

original: de dag skyes pa yid la mi byed pa dang / yid la byed kyang tshogs ma bsags pa ni sgrib pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de dag skyes pa yid la mi byed pa dang / yid la byed kyang tshogs ma bsags pa ni sgrib pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The non-bringing to mind of those that have arisen and the non-accumulation of the accumulations, even when one brings them to mind, are called obscurations.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Correct adoption is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa dang / de'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings bla na med par gzhag par bya ba nyid du 'dis yang dag par 'dzin cing yongs su len pas na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa dang / de'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings bla na med par gzhag par bya ba nyid du 'dis yang dag par 'dzin cing yongs su len pas na /
translated: It is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment because it correctly adopts, correctly takes up, the entire collection of merit and knowledge, its result, Buddhahood, and the establishment of all sentient beings in the unsurpassed realm of Nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Correct adoption is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de yang bdag dang gzhan la phan par byed pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bdag dang gzhan la phan par byed pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the intention to benefit oneself and others,

original: sems pa 'dun pa dang bcas pa'o //üîΩde'i sgrib pa gsum la rigs dang mi ldan pa ni rigs med pa'am /
analyzed: sems pa 'dun pa dang bcas pa'o // de'i sgrib pa gsum la rigs dang mi ldan pa ni rigs med pa'am /
translated: the volition together with the aspiration.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs so //
translated: Its three obscurations are: lack of the spiritual gene, the absence of the gene, or the gene of the Sravaka, etc.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rigs yod kyang de gang dag byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de dag dang mi phrad pa ste /üîΩgang la brten nas byang chub las rnam par ldog pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rigs yod kyang de gang dag byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de dag dang mi phrad pa ste / gang la brten nas byang chub las rnam par ldog pa'am /
translated: Lacking a spiritual teacher means that even though one has the potential, one does not meet with those who can cause one to take up the generation of the Thought of enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mi 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mi 'phel ba'o //
translated: One turns away from enlightenment, or does not increase in virtuous qualities, depending on whom.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad du zin kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis sems yongs su skyo ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad du zin kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis sems yongs su skyo ste /
translated: Even though one meets with a spiritual teacher, one's mind is discouraged by the sufferings of cyclic life.

original: sems can log par zhugs pa rnams la sems skyo nas myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar sems so //
analyzed: sems can log par zhugs pa rnams la sems skyo nas myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar sems so //
translated: One's mind is discouraged by the waywardness of sentient beings, and one thinks that one will quickly pass into Nirvana.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /üîΩrgyu dang mi ldan pa dang rkyen dang mi ldan pa dang / sems can rnams la snying mi rje ba dang le lo ste /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na / rgyu dang mi ldan pa dang rkyen dang mi ldan pa dang / sems can rnams la snying mi rje ba dang le lo ste /
translated: What is the obstruction here?üîΩLacking the cause, lacking the conditions, lacking compassion for sentient beings, and laziness.

original: snying rje med pa ni sems can gyi don gyis skyo bar 'gyur ba'am sgyid lug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje med pa ni sems can gyi don gyis skyo bar 'gyur ba'am sgyid lug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Lacking compassion, one becomes discouraged by the work for sentient beings, or one becomes lazy.

original: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The wise one is the bodhisattva himself.

original: rang bzhin gyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnam pas dbang po rno ba dang / shes par bya @227a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnam pas dbang po rno ba dang / shes par bya @227a * //
translated: The wise one is the bodhisattva himself, not others, because he is naturally sharp-facultied in comparison with those of the sravaka vehicle, etc.,üîΩbecause he is in the stage of investigating all the aspects of all that is to be known,

original: ba thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad la nye bar rtog pa'i skabs yin pa dang chos zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' nyid blo ldan yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad la nye bar rtog pa'i skabs yin pa dang chos zab cing rgya che ba la mos pas / byang chub sems dpa' nyid blo ldan yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: and because he is devoted to the profound and extensive Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid ni gzhan gyi don phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid ni gzhan gyi don phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa'o ;
translated: The bodhisattva himself is the one who accomplishes the aims of others without error.

original: / sgrub pa dang mi ldan zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / sgrub pa dang mi ldan zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The one who is not endowed with practice does not engage in the perfections, etc.

original: sgrub pa la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' shes so //
analyzed: sgrub pa la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' shes so //
translated: The one who is endowed with practice is the bodhisattva.

original: skye bo ngan pa ni skye bo blun po'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi rtog pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa ni skye bo blun po'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi rtog pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Evil people are foolish people.

original: skye bo ngan pa ni sgrub pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'de'o zhes mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa ni sgrub pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'de'o zhes mi shes pa'o //
translated: Evil people do not know that the bodhisattva is endowed with accomplishment.

original: skye bo sdang ba ni zhe 'gras pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye bo sdang ba ni zhe 'gras pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Hostile people are those who are hostile.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba rnams te /
translated: They are those who are hostile to the bodhisattva.

original: de dag glags tshol bas byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yang dag pa rnams ni mi mthong la /üîΩnyes pa med pa ni mthong ba'am zhe sdang gis gnod par sems pas yon tan yang dag pa rnams bcas te /
analyzed: de dag glags tshol bas byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yang dag pa rnams ni mi mthong la / nyes pa med pa ni mthong ba'am zhe sdang gis gnod par sems pas yon tan yang dag pa rnams bcas te /
translated: Because they seek an opportunity, they do not see the real virtues of the bodhisattva,üîΩbut they do see his faults, and they proclaim his faults, real and imagined,

original: sgro btags nas med pa'i nyes pa sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgro btags nas med pa'i nyes pa sgrogs pa'o //
translated: with the intention of harming him through their hostility.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi shes pa dang zhe sdang ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi shes pa dang zhe sdang ba'o //
translated: The obscuration to generosity, etc. is its counteragent, ignorance, and hostility.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three obscurations to non-error are:

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'o //
translated: error is due to superimposition and negation.

original: gnyen po ni 'khrul pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po ni 'khrul pa med pa ste /
translated: The antidote is the absence of error,

original: mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: which is the path of insight.

original: kha cig na re phyin ci log gi gnas ngan len ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags brtas pa'o zhe'o //üîΩgzhan dag na re mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal thams cad dam /
analyzed: kha cig na re phyin ci log gi gnas ngan len ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags brtas pa'o zhe'o // gzhan dag na re mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal thams cad dam /
translated: Some believe that the negative reflex action of error is the latent impression of the notional attachment to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro bar khong du chud par bya ba'i gegs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa yongs su gsos pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro bar khong du chud par bya ba'i gegs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa yongs su gsos pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others believe that it is the seed of the non-afflicted nescience which is the obscuration that acts as the counteragent to the understanding of the dharmadhatu in its entirety or to the relinquishment of all that is to be relinquished through insight.

original: gzhan dag na re bdag la sogs pa med par bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ni phyin ci log go zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdag la sogs pa med par bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa ni phyin ci log go zhe'o //
translated: Others believe that the error is the imagination of a self etc. in the absence of a self etc.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa gsum las lhag ma gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa gsum las lhag ma gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The remainder of the three obscurations such as the afflictions.

original: @227b nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni shas che ba dang yun ring po nas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: @227b nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni shas che ba dang yun ring po nas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba ste /
translated: The obscuration that is the affliction is the predominance of the afflictions and the long-term occurrence of attachment, etc.

original: de'i gnyen po la sbyor ba'i skabs mi 'byed pas 'khrul pa med pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po la sbyor ba'i skabs mi 'byed pas 'khrul pa med pa la sgrib po //
translated: It is an obscuration to non-delusion because it does not provide an opportunity to apply the antidotes to those.

original: las kyi sgrib pa ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las ngan song du nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa ni mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las ngan song du nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration that is karma is the bad karma of the heinous crimes, etc., that are certain to lead to miserable realms.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni ngan song la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni ngan song la sogs pa ste /
translated: The obscuration that is the karmic maturation is the miserable realms, etc.

original: der skyes pa la 'phags pa'i chos skye ba'i skal ba med do //
analyzed: der skyes pa la 'phags pa'i chos skye ba'i skal ba med do //
translated: One who is born there has no opportunity to generate the ƒÅrya dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe de dag las lhag ma gang yang rung ba zhig sgrib pa yin gyi zad par ni ma yin no //üîΩrnam par grol ba'i yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su ma smin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe de dag las lhag ma gang yang rung ba zhig sgrib pa yin gyi zad par ni ma yin no // rnam par grol ba'i yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su ma smin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among those afflictions, karma, and life, any one of them is an obscuration, but not all of them.üîΩThe immaturity of the wisdom that brings about the maturity of liberation is

original: rnam par grol ba thob par byed pa'i shes rab las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba thob par byed pa'i shes rab las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: the unserviceability of the wisdom that brings about the attainment of liberation.

original: kha cig na re de ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas ma thob pa'i phyir zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas ma thob pa'i phyir zhe'o //
translated: Some say: Because they have not attained the stage that is conducive to penetration.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par mi rtog pa dang de la sbyor ba can gnyis ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par mi rtog pa dang de la sbyor ba can gnyis ni /
translated: Others say: The two, the non-conceptual and the one who is engaged in that,

original: 'dir rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab po //
translated: are the wisdom that ripens liberation here.

original: de gnyis yongs su ma smin pa ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir de kho na rtogs pa'i 'os ma yin pa dang / de'i rgyu'i dngos po'i 'os ma yin pa ste go rims bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de gnyis yongs su ma smin pa ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir de kho na rtogs pa'i 'os ma yin pa dang / de'i rgyu'i dngos po'i 'os ma yin pa ste go rims bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Because those two are unripened, they are not fit to realize reality because the accumulations are incomplete, and they are not fit to be the entity that is the cause of that, respectively.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags brtas pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa'i lhag ma gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / shes rab yongs su smin pa'i gegs su gyur pa mi shes pa dang tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags brtas pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa'i lhag ma gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / shes rab yongs su smin pa'i gegs su gyur pa mi shes pa dang tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The increase of the latent impressions of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, any other remaining afflictions, and the ignorance that obstructs the full ripening of wisdom and the incompleteness of the accumulations.

original: sgrib pa spangs pa ni sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis sgrib pa spong bar byed pas sgrib pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa ni sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis sgrib pa spong bar byed pas sgrib pa spong ba ste /
translated: The path of meditative development is described as the absence of obscuration because it is the relinquishment of obscuration.

original: sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas sgrib pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas sgrib pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the absence of obscuration because it is the counteragent to obscuration.

original: de'i sgrib pa gsum ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa gsum ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The obscuration pertinent to that is described as the dissonant mental states that are innate.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal lo //
translated: These are the latent forms of the dissonant mental states that are to be relinquished by the path of meditative development.

original: yang na bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings mchog gi don la sogs pa rtogs pa'i gegs byed pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa yongs su gsos @228a * //
analyzed: yang na bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings mchog gi don la sogs pa rtogs pa'i gegs byed pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa yongs su gsos @228a * //
translated: Alternatively, the innate view of self etc. and the seeds of the non-afflicted nescience that obstructs the realization of the supreme significance of the dharmadhƒÅtu etc. are the dissonant mental states that are innate and are the obscurations pertinent to the path of meditative development.

original: pa'o // le lo ni snyom las te gti mug gi char gtogs pas sems mngon par mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o // le lo ni snyom las te gti mug gi char gtogs pas sems mngon par mi spro ba'o //
translated: Laziness is indolence and is a part of delusion; it is the lack of mental exertion.

original: bag med pas ni yul la rnam par chags pa dang / dge ba la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pas ni yul la rnam par chags pa dang / dge ba la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Negligence is the attachment to objects and the non-engagement in virtue.

original: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba ni bag med pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba ni bag med pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the enjoyment of samadhi is negligence.

original: de la gnas ngan len dang le los ni lam mi bsgom mo //
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len dang le los ni lam mi bsgom mo //
translated: By the defilements of bad dispositions and laziness, the path is not cultivated.

original: bag med pas ni mi dge ba las sems mi srung ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pas ni mi dge ba las sems mi srung ba'o //
translated: By negligence, the mind is not guarded against the non-virtuous.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the obscurations here?

original: gsum po de nyid do //üîΩyongs su bsngo ba'i sgrib pa gsum ni gang dag gis sems gzhan du sngo bar byed kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi bsngo zhes bya ba de la bsngo ba de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba rnams sangs
analyzed: gsum po de nyid do // yongs su bsngo ba'i sgrib pa gsum ni gang dag gis sems gzhan du sngo bar byed kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi bsngo zhes bya ba de la bsngo ba de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba rnams sangs
translated: They are precisely those three.üîΩThe three obscurations to dedication are those by which the mind is dedicated elsewhere and not to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rgyas nyid du sems kyis nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas nyid du sems kyis nges par byed pa'o //
translated: In this regard, dedication is the mental determination of the roots of virtue that have arisen and occurred for the sake of Buddhahood.

original: de la sgrib pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three obscurations to that.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: gang dag gis sangs rgyas nyid las gzhan du 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis sangs rgyas nyid las gzhan du 'khor ba'am /
translated: Those by which the mind is dedicated to samsara, other than Buddhahood,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu sems yongs su sngo bar byed kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu sems yongs su sngo bar byed kyi /
translated: They direct their thought to the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi bsngo'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi bsngo'o //
translated: but not to supreme perfect enlightenment.üîΩThey are attached to existence, attached to enjoyments, and their thought is low.

original: de dag kyang srid pa la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pa dang / sems zhum pa dang // srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //üîΩspyad par bya ba na /
analyzed: de dag kyang srid pa la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pa dang / sems zhum pa dang // srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams so // spyad par bya ba na /
translated: Existence is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: longs spyod de gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams so //
analyzed: longs spyod de gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams so //
translated: Enjoyments are the objects, form, etc.

original: de dag la rnam par chags pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par chags pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to them is attachment.

original: sems zhum pa ni sems rgya chung ba ste /
analyzed: sems zhum pa ni sems rgya chung ba ste /
translated: A low thought is a small thought.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du ga la 'grub /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du ga la 'grub /
translated: How can one like me attain buddhahood?

original: bdag lta bus ga la zhig ces bdag la mi srid par sems so //
analyzed: bdag lta bus ga la zhig ces bdag la mi srid par sems so //
translated: Thinking that it is impossible for someone like me, they direct their thought to the lower vehicles.

original: de la srid pa la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pas ni bde 'gror sems sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de la srid pa la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pas ni bde 'gror sems sngo bar byed do //
translated: Among them, those attached to existence and attached to enjoyments direct their thought to good rebirths.

original: sems zhum pas ni nyan thos kyi theg par sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: sems zhum pas ni nyan thos kyi theg par sngo bar byed do //
translated: Those with low thoughts direct their thought to the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: srid pa dang / longs spyod la sred pa dang / le lo dang snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang / longs spyod la sred pa dang / le lo dang snying rje med pa'o //
translated: Craving for existence and for enjoyments, laziness, and lack of compassion.

original: mi skrag pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi skrag pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three obscurations to fearlessness are

original: mi skrag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi skrag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is fearlessness?

original: stong pa nyid dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la mos shing mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la mos shing mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of fear in regard to emptiness, the profound and sublime Dharma of the Buddha and the bodhisattvas.

original: gang zag la mi srid snyam pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul mngon par brjod pa'i gang zag la ma nor par khong du chud cing @228b 'chad pa dang / tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa yon tan la yid mi ches pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la mi srid snyam pa ni theg pa chen po'i tshul mngon par brjod pa'i gang zag la ma nor par khong du chud cing @228b 'chad pa dang / tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa yon tan la yid mi ches pa'o //
translated: Lack of conviction in the person refers to a lack of conviction in the person who expounds the Mahayana scriptures without error and in the qualities of morality, meditative concentration, wisdom, etc.

original: chos la mi mos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la tshul zab cing rgya che ba khong du chud par byed pa dang / don ma log pa'o zhes yid mi ches pa'o //
analyzed: chos la mi mos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la tshul zab cing rgya che ba khong du chud par byed pa dang / don ma log pa'o zhes yid mi ches pa'o //
translated: Lack of conviction in the Dharma refers to a lack of conviction in the scriptures of the Buddha, which are the means to understand the profound and sublime Dharma, and in the unerring meaning.

original: don la sgra bzhin du spyod pa ni ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar rtog par byed cing dgongs pa'i don gyi de kho na khong du mi chud pa ste /
analyzed: don la sgra bzhin du spyod pa ni ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar rtog par byed cing dgongs pa'i don gyi de kho na khong du mi chud pa ste /
translated: In reality, one who practices literally does not understand the reality of the intended meaning, because he thinks that the meaning of ‚Äúunproduced,‚Äù ‚Äúunextinguished,‚Äù ‚Äúprimordially peaceful,‚Äù and so on is just what the words mean.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don la mi mos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don la mi mos so //
translated: Therefore, he does not believe in the meaning of ‚Äúunproduced,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obstruction here?

original: the tshom dang / shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mi shes pa dang / dgongs pa'i don la spyod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang / shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mi shes pa dang / dgongs pa'i don la spyod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance, which is adverse to wisdom and concentration, and it is also adverse to the understanding of the intended meaning.

original: ser sna med pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩser sna med pa ni gang gis dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ser sna med pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la / ser sna med pa ni gang gis dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The three obstructions to non-avarice, etc.

original: gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i phyir chos ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i phyir chos ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Non-avarice is that by which one teaches the Dharma in order to preserve the true Dharma or in order to help others.

original: dam pa'i chos la ched cher mi 'dzin pa ni gces su mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la ched cher mi 'dzin pa ni gces su mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Not valuing the true Dharma is not cherishing it.

original: des gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la go bar mi byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: des gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la go bar mi byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not cause the mental continuum of another to understand, and it does not cause the holy Dharma to remain for a long time.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang mchod pa la ched cher mi 'dzin pa ni gces su mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang mchod pa la ched cher mi 'dzin pa ni gces su mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Not holding to the importance of gain, honor, and offerings is not holding to the importance of gain, etc.

original: dam pa'i chos la ched cher 'dzin kyang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la ched cher 'dzin kyang /
translated: Even though one holds to the importance of the holy Dharma,

original: bdag dang gzhan mtshungs sam lhag gi dogs te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mtshungs sam lhag gi dogs te /
translated: one is afraid that oneself and others are equal or superior.

original: de'i phyir rnyed pa la sogs pa'i bar chad du 'gyur bas 'jigs nas chos mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnyed pa la sogs pa'i bar chad du 'gyur bas 'jigs nas chos mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, fearing that gain, etc. will be an obstacle, one does not expound the Dharma.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen pa med kyang sems can rnams la snying rje med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen pa med kyang sems can rnams la snying rje med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though one does not hold to the importance of gain and honor, one has no compassion for sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje med pas chos mi 'chad de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje med pas chos mi 'chad de /
translated: One does not expound the Dharma because of having no compassion for sentient beings.

original: snying rje med pa ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyi gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje med pa ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyi gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has no compassion does not suffer from the suffering of sentient beings.

original: 'di la sgring  pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgring  pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is stinginess here?

original: ched cher mi 'dzin pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa dang snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: ched cher mi 'dzin pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa dang snying rje med pa'o //
translated: 1) not holding to the importance of the Dharma, 2) attachment to gain and honor, and 3) lack of compassion.

original: dbang gi sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang gi sgrib pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three obscurations to mastery are:

original: dbang ni sems kyi dbang rnam pa thams cad thob pas sangs rgyas nyid dbang ngo //
analyzed: dbang ni sems kyi dbang rnam pa thams cad thob pas sangs rgyas nyid dbang ngo //
translated: Mastery is Buddhahood, which is the attainment of the mastery of mind in all ways.

original: de'i sgrib pa gsum po dag mi shes pas de'i @229a * //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa gsum po dag mi shes pas de'i @229a * //
translated: The three obscurations to that are ignorance,

original: phyir / gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: phyir / gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: therefore, it says, ‚Äúthose by which mastery is not attained.‚Äù

original: dbang byed pa ni sems kyi dbang la rag lus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang byed pa ni sems kyi dbang la rag lus pa'i phyir //
translated: Mastery is the mastery of mind, because it is dependent on the mastery of mind.

original: gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa de nyid dbang gis sgrib pa'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa de nyid dbang gis sgrib pa'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Those by which mastery is not attained are said to be the obscurations to mastery.

original: dbang byed pa ni ye shes dang spong ba dang mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang byed pa ni ye shes dang spong ba dang mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery is the perfection of wisdom, abandonment, and power.

original: yang na gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni dbang gi rnam grangs su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni dbang gi rnam grangs su bstan pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúthose by which mastery is not attained‚Äù is taught as a synonym for mastery.

original: sangs rgyas nyid mi 'thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mi 'thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one does not attain Buddhahood.

original: thos pas phongs pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang gtan du bral ba ste /
analyzed: thos pas phongs pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang gtan du bral ba ste /
translated: Deprived of hearing means being completely deprived of hearing the true Dharma.

original: rtsa lag rnams dang gtan du bral ba la rtsa lag gis phongs pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsa lag rnams dang gtan du bral ba la rtsa lag gis phongs pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Deprived of relatives means being completely deprived of relatives.

original: thos pas phongs pa de yang chos kyis phongs par 'gyur pa'i las skyes pas 'gyur te /
analyzed: thos pas phongs pa de yang chos kyis phongs par 'gyur pa'i las skyes pas 'gyur te /
translated: That deprivation of hearing is due to the karma that leads to deprivation of Dharma.

original: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because one holds one's own view as supreme,

original: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i phyir /üîΩ'gyod pa med pa gang dag gis theg pa chen po'i mdos de la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i phyir / 'gyod pa med pa gang dag gis theg pa chen po'i mdos de la /
translated: or because one relies on a non-virtuous spiritual friend,üîΩone has no regret for that.

original: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa dang / ngan song gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa dang / ngan song gi rgyu ste /
translated: They think, This is spoken by Mara, and is the cause of the lower realms.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes spong ba dang / gzhan dag kyang de la mos pa bzlog pa dang / yi ger bris pa 'phyi ba dang / sreg pa dang chur skyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang mi ldan pa'i las kyi sa bon yongs su gsos pas /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes spong ba dang / gzhan dag kyang de la mos pa bzlog pa dang / yi ger bris pa 'phyi ba dang / sreg pa dang chur skyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang mi ldan pa'i las kyi sa bon yongs su gsos pas /
translated: This is not the word of the Buddha, and one rejects it, and one turns others away from interest in it, and one does not listen to the true Dharma, and one nourishes the seeds of karma that are not conducive to listening to the true Dharma, by such means as erasing the written letters, burning them, throwing them in the water, and so on.

original: dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las rab tu skye'o //
translated: Thus, one generates karma that is conducive to the loss of the true Dharma.

original: thos pas phongs par ma gyur na yang thos pa nyung ste /
analyzed: thos pas phongs par ma gyur na yang thos pa nyung ste /
translated: Even if one does not lose the opportunity to hear the Dharma, one has little learning.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pas sgrib po zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pas sgrib po zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One should add: because the accumulation of wisdom is not complete, it is an obscuration.

original: thos pa nyung ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mi nus so //
analyzed: thos pa nyung ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mi nus so //
translated: One who has little learning is not able to discern the Dharma well.

original: mang du thos par gyur kyang ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pa nyid kyang sgrib po zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: mang du thos par gyur kyang ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pa nyid kyang sgrib po zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Even if one has much learning, the lack of thorough training in meditative concentration is an obscuration.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa las gang yang rung ba zhig med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa las gang yang rung ba zhig med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: One should add: because one of the five, such as aspiration, is absent.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med pas /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med pas /
translated: Because one of the eight formative forces that facilitate relinquishment is missing,

original: bsgom pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: one has not thoroughly purified one's concentration because one's cultivation is incomplete.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu la sogs pa yongs su mi sgrub pa ni yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu la sogs pa yongs su mi sgrub pa ni yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: Or else, one has not thoroughly purified one's concentration because one has not fully accomplished the vajra-like concentration of a Buddha and so on.

original: 'di @229b la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di @229b la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las dang thos pa nyung ste /
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las dang thos pa nyung ste /
translated: It is karma that leads to the loss of the Dharma, little learning,

original: 'chal pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa'i bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa'i bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: and the secondary mental afflictions of dullness, agitation, and so on, which are adverse to wisdom and concentration.üîΩThis obscuration is called

original: sgrib pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩdge ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgrib pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa'o // dge ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the lack of application and so on.üîΩThe ten categories of virtue and so on

original: dbang la thug gi bar du dngos po rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: dbang la thug gi bar du dngos po rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: extend up to mastery.

original: don gang la byed rgyu rnam pa bcur 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: don gang la byed rgyu rnam pa bcur 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúobstruction‚Äù is that which obstructs the arising of virtue, etc.

original: 'thob pa la thug gi bar gyi don gang la sgrib pa de bzlog na /
analyzed: 'thob pa la thug gi bar gyi don gang la sgrib pa de bzlog na /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúremedy‚Äù is that which removes the obstruction.

original: sbyor ba la sogs pa nas ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa la thug pa rnams ni byed rgyu bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs pa nas ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa la thug pa rnams ni byed rgyu bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúcause‚Äù is the tenfold activity, from the activity of application up to the activity of the purification of meditative concentration.

original: 'dir ni so so tha dad kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir bye brag med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni so so tha dad kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir bye brag med par bstan to //
translated: Here, although they are distinct, they are taught without distinction because they are not distinguished with regard to being the cause of arising, etc.

original: don de'i skabs kyis zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i don gyi dbang du byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: don de'i skabs kyis zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i don gyi dbang du byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúin this context‚Äù is ‚Äúin the context of the meaning of arising, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dge ba la sogs pa de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la gegs su gyur pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba la sogs pa de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la gegs su gyur pa'i tshe na /
translated: Thus, when virtue, etc. are obstructed with regard to the cause of arising, etc.

original: skye ba la sogs pa la sgrib po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa la sgrib po zhes bya ste /
translated: they are said to ‚Äúobstruct arising, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na rtsig pa la sogs pas snang ba bsgribs na /
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa la sogs pas snang ba bsgribs na /
translated: For example, when light is obstructed by a wall, etc.,

original: de'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la yang sgrib po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la yang sgrib po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and the result of that is the eye consciousness.

original: de ltar byas na chos bcu po de dag gi sgrib pa sum cu po bzlog na byed rgyu sum cu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na chos bcu po de dag gi sgrib pa sum cu po bzlog na byed rgyu sum cu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the thirty obscurations to these ten dharmas are eliminated, the thirty causal activities are taught.

original: de la dge ba skye ba'i byed rgyu gsum ni sbyor ba dang / skye mched la sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba skye ba'i byed rgyu gsum ni sbyor ba dang / skye mched la sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Among them, the three causal activities for the arising of virtue are: application, application to the sense bases, and proper application.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe ste /
translated: The so-called eyes, etc. are examples here.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i byed rgyu nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i byed rgyu nyid yin gyi //
translated: The eyes, etc. are only the causal activities for the arising of consciousness,

original: gnas pa la sogs pa'i byed rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa'i byed rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the causal activities for abiding, etc.

original: de la sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa sbyor ba la sogs pa la mngon du gegs su gyur pa na gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de dge ba skye ba la yang gegs byed pas de bzhin du skye ba la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sgrib pa
analyzed: de la sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa sbyor ba la sogs pa la mngon du gegs su gyur pa na gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de dge ba skye ba la yang gegs byed pas de bzhin du skye ba la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sgrib pa
translated: Among them, when the absence of application, etc. directly obstruct application, etc., they obstruct the arising of virtue by passing on to each other. Thus, obscuration to arising is obscuration to virtue.

original: ste / de'i phyir de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ste / de'i phyir de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin order to generate that.

original: dge ba la gnas pa la sogs pa mi srid pas skye ba'i sgrib pa nyid yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: dge ba la gnas pa la sogs pa mi srid pas skye ba'i sgrib pa nyid yin no zhes ston to //
translated: ‚Äù Since it is impossible to abide in virtue, etc., it is shown that it is the obscuration to birth.

original: byang chub la ni gnas pa'i byed rgyu yod de /
analyzed: byang chub la ni gnas pa'i byed rgyu yod de /
translated: The cause of abiding in enlightenment is

original: byang chub ni gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: enlightenment is the basis.

original: de bzhin nyid @230a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid @230a * //
translated: Suchness

original: dri ma med pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: is the stainless state of abiding.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned:

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause it is unshakable.

original: 'jig rten ji srid pa de srid du gnas pas mi 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji srid pa de srid du gnas pas mi 'khrugs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù It is unshakable because it abides as long as the world exists.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang rnam par mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang rnam par mi ldog pa'o //
translated: It does not change into something else and does not turn back.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub ni bdag gi rgyu nyid kyi don byas nas rnam par ldog go //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub ni bdag gi rgyu nyid kyi don byas nas rnam par ldog go //
translated: The enlightenment of the sravakas, etc., having fulfilled its purpose of being the cause for oneself, turns back.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas tshogs rnams la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas tshogs rnams la 'jug pa na /
translated: The bodhisattva, with the superior intention to benefit and gladden all sentient beings, engages in the collections.

original: gnas par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub sems ji srid pa de srid du gnas par smon te /
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub sems ji srid pa de srid du gnas par smon te /
translated: One vows to remain for as long as there is existence, i.e., for as long as the reality of the thought of awakening remains.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ltar mi skye ba tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ltar mi skye ba tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of mere non-arising, as in the case of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: gnas pa ni skye ba med par mi 'gyur bas 'dir yang skye ba yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni skye ba med par mi 'gyur bas 'dir yang skye ba yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since remaining is not without arising, here also there is arising.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi gnas pa'i byed rgyu nyid brjod kyi skye ba'i byed rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi gnas pa'i byed rgyu nyid brjod kyi skye ba'i byed rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the abiding of awakening is stated, but not the cause of arising.

original: de ma gtogs par gzhan gnas pa'i byed rgyu med pas de'i phyir de nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par gzhan gnas pa'i byed rgyu med pas de'i phyir de nyid bshad do //
translated: Since there is no other cause of abiding apart from that, therefore that is explained.

original: yang na de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa ni byang chub ste /
translated: Or else, the purification of suchness is awakening.

original: de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pas skye ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pas skye ba med de /
translated: Since suchness is pure by nature, there is no arising.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma med par gyur na byed rgyu de dag gis gtan du gnas pa nyid ces brjod kyi skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma med par gyur na byed rgyu de dag gis gtan du gnas pa nyid ces brjod kyi skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When it becomes free from adventitious defilements, it is said to abide eternally by those causes, but not that it arises.

original: byang chub kyi gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba dang / yid la byed pa dang tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba dang / yid la byed pa dang tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The causal condition of the state of enlightenment is the arising of the roots of virtue, attention, and the completion of the collections.

original: 'dir yang dge ba la mi skye ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang dge ba la mi skye ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Here, the non-arising of virtue, etc.

original: dge ba skye ba la sogs pa'i gegs su gyur pas byang chub kyi gnas pa la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir gnas pa'i sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge ba skye ba la sogs pa'i gegs su gyur pas byang chub kyi gnas pa la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir gnas pa'i sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
translated: is explained as an obscuration to the state because it is an obstruction to the arising of virtue, etc., and thus harms the state of enlightenment.

original: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can rnams kyi zas gzhi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can rnams kyi zas gzhi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The causal condition of the state is like food for sentient beings.

original: 'dir dpe'o // kham gyis za ba'i zas la sogs pa ldan med pa'i sems can skyed par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir dpe'o // kham gyis za ba'i zas la sogs pa ldan med pa'i sems can skyed par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is the example. Food that is eaten by mouthfuls, etc. does not produce sentient beings who do not exist,

original: sngar skyes pa rnams gnas par byed pa nyid do //üîΩrten pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba la rten ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: sngar skyes pa rnams gnas par byed pa nyid do // rten pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba la rten ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: but rather it maintains those that have already arisen.üîΩThe causal condition of the support is the enlightenment mind.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The support is the enlightenment mind because it is the basis of all virtuous dharmas.

original: gang gi gnas su gang gyur pa de ni de'i rten te /
analyzed: gang gi gnas su gang gyur pa de ni de'i rten te /
translated: That which is the basis of something is its support.

original: 'dis 'dzin pas dper na sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi snod kyi 'jig rten lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'dzin pas dper na sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi snod kyi 'jig rten lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe'o //
translated: For example, the world of sentient beings is the support of the world of the inanimate environment.

original: de'i byed rgyu ni @230b rigs dang bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i byed rgyu ni @230b rigs dang bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Its causal activity is the perfection of lineage and spiritual friend, and the non-discouragement of mind.

original: de la rigs dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa ni rten pa'i byed rgyu dang 'gal bas rten la yang sgrib par bshad do //
analyzed: de la rigs dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa ni rten pa'i byed rgyu dang 'gal bas rten la yang sgrib par bshad do //
translated: Here, the causal activity of the support is explained as an obscuration to the support, since it is incompatible with the causal activity of the supported, such as the absence of the perfection of lineage.

original: de'i phyir rten gyi sgrib pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten gyi sgrib pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Therefore, he says: the obscuration to the support is an obscuration to the correct apprehension of the support,

original: byang chub kyi sems rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because it is the cause of the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni blo ldan byang chub sems dpa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni blo ldan byang chub sems dpa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The causal activity of manifestation is an obscuration for the wise bodhisattva,

original: rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be demonstrated.

original: de yang sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / skye bo rung ba dang 'grogs pa dang / skye bo gnod par mi sems pa dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / skye bo rung ba dang 'grogs pa dang / skye bo gnod par mi sems pa dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the perfect practice, the association with suitable people, and the association with people who do not think harm.

original: 'dir sgrub pa dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa ni blo ldan gsal ba'i byed rgyu dang 'gal bas gsal ba'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa ni blo ldan gsal ba'i byed rgyu dang 'gal bas gsal ba'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the lack of practice, etc. is called the obscuration to clarity because it is incompatible with the cause of the clarity of the wise.

original: de'i phyir gsal ba la sgrib pa ni blo dang ldan pa la sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba la sgrib pa ni blo dang ldan pa la sgrib pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the obscuration to clarity is the obscuration to the wise.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:üîΩFor example, like the appearance of form.

original: dper na gzugs kyi snang ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi snang ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe'o //
translated: This is the example.

original: snang ba ni gzugs 'ba' zhig gsal ba'i byed rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: snang ba ni gzugs 'ba' zhig gsal ba'i byed rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: The appearance is the cause of the clarity of form alone,

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i byed rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i byed rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the cause of birth, etc.

original: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni 'khrul ba med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni 'khrul ba med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of change is the cause of non-error.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa 'khul pa ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'khrul pa med pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa 'khul pa ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'khrul pa med pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of insight is the absence of error, since it is the antidote to the error of superimposition and denial.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The absence of error is the transformation of the basis.

original: dper na shing sha ba la sogs pa'i thal ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing sha ba la sogs pa'i thal ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the ashes of a log, etc.

original: de'i byed rgyu gsum ni phyin ci log gi gnas ngan len bcom ba dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa gsum med pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i byed rgyu gsum ni phyin ci log gi gnas ngan len bcom ba dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa gsum med pa dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Its three causal processes are: the destruction of the negative reflex actions of error, the absence of the three obscurations such as the addictions, and the full maturity of the wisdom that brings about the full maturity of liberation.üîΩFor example, it is like fire, etc. that burn, etc.

original: dper na btso ba la sogs pa'i me la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: dper na btso ba la sogs pa'i me la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is not like rice, etc.

original: de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is in the continuum of that.

original: 'bras la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i byed rgyu ni me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i byed rgyu ni me la sogs pa'o //
translated: The causal process of that is fire, etc.

original: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni sgrib pa med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni sgrib pa med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The causal process of separation is the cause of nonobstruction.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las lhag ma dag 'dis spong bas sgrib pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //üîΩde'i byed rgyu gsum ni lhan @231a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las lhag ma dag 'dis spong bas sgrib pa med pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo // de'i byed rgyu gsum ni lhan @231a * //
translated: The path of meditative development is the absence of obscuration, since it eliminates the remaining obscurations that are to be relinquished by the path of vision.üîΩThe three causal attributes of this are: the destruction of innate disquiet,

original: cig skyes pa'i gnas ngan len bcom pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: cig skyes pa'i gnas ngan len bcom pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bag yod pa'o //
translated: and the attributes of vigour and heedfulness.

original: de dag kyang 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ste /
translated: These are the causal attributes of separation.

original: mi 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the counteragents to the causal attributes of non-separation.

original: de'i phyir 'bral ba la sgrib pa ni sgrib pa med pa la sgrib ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bral ba la sgrib pa ni sgrib pa med pa la sgrib ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Hence he says: the obscuration to the absence of obscuration is an obscuration.

original: de yang 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i gnyen po'i dngos por sgrib ste /
analyzed: de yang 'bral ba'i byed rgyu'i gnyen po'i dngos por sgrib ste /
translated: Moreover, this is an obscuration in the nature of the counteragent to the causal attributes of separation.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /üîΩde sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa / de sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of this is stated here:üîΩbecause of the absence of obscuration in regard to that.

original: 'dis 'bral bar byed pas 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'bral bar byed pas 'bral ba'o //
translated: Separation is on account of this, i.e. the absence of obscuration.

original: bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni bsngo ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni bsngo ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The causal attribute of transformation is the cause of dedication.

original: des dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub chen por sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub chen por sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by the dedication of the roots of virtue to great enlightenment.

original: de yang srid pa dang longs spyod las phyir phyogs pa dang sems zhum pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang srid pa dang longs spyod las phyir phyogs pa dang sems zhum pa med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the turning away from existence and enjoyments and the absence of mental dejection.

original: de'i phyir bsgyur ba ni byed rgyu'i gegs ni bsngo ba'i sgrib par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgyur ba ni byed rgyu'i gegs ni bsngo ba'i sgrib par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the hindrance to the cause of dedication should be regarded as an obscuration to dedication.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bsngo ba ni byang chub chen por sems yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bsngo ba ni byang chub chen por sems yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why? Because dedication is characterized by the complete dedication of thought to great enlightenment.

original: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni mi skrag pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni mi skrag pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of confidence is the cause of fearlessness.

original: de yang gang zag la srid do snyam pa dang / chos la mos pa dang / dgongs pa'i don khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zag la srid do snyam pa dang / chos la mos pa dang / dgongs pa'i don khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the belief that such a person exists, the conviction in the Dharma and the comprehension of the meaning of the underlying intention.

original: chos de rnams kyi yid ches par 'gyur bas de'i phyir yid ches pa'i byed rgyu'i gegs yin pas yid ches pa la sgrib pa ni mi skrag pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi yid ches par 'gyur bas de'i phyir yid ches pa'i byed rgyu'i gegs yin pas yid ches pa la sgrib pa ni mi skrag pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Since one has confidence in those dharmas, therefore, the hindrance to the cause of confidence is an obscuration to confidence because it is an obscuration to fearlessness.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned.

original: yid mi ches pas skrag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi ches pas skrag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: because of fear due to lack of confidence.

original: yid mi ches pas ni chos la skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid mi ches pas ni chos la skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is afraid of the Dharma due to lack of confidence.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: The cause of lack of confidence is

original: ser sna med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ser sna med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: the cause of stinginess.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos cher 'dzin pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / mchod pa la mi lta ba dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba'o //üîΩyid ches par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'gal bas yid ches par byed pa la sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos cher 'dzin pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / mchod pa la mi lta ba dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba'o // yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'gal bas yid ches par byed pa la sgrib pa ni /
translated: It is the great retention of the Dharma, the lack of regard for gain, honor, and worship, and compassion for sentient beings.üîΩThe obscuration to lack of confidence is established as the obscuration to the cause of lack of confidence,

original: ser sna med pa la sgrib par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ser sna med pa la sgrib par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: because it is the opposite of the cause of lack of confidence.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa chos la ser sna med pas gzhen yid ches par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa chos la ser sna med pas gzhen yid ches par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned because of the lack of stinginess with regard to the Dharma, since one lacks confidence in the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos ched cher mi 'dzin pa la sogs pas chos la ser sna byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ched cher mi 'dzin pa la sogs pas chos la ser sna byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes stingy with regard to the Dharma due to the lack of great retention of the Dharma, etc.

original: chos la ser sna byed pas kyang gzhan rnams la chos 'chad par mi byed pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed pas kyang gzhan rnams la chos 'chad par mi byed pas de'i phyir /
translated: And, due to stinginess with regard to the Dharma, one does not teach the Dharma to others.

original: yid ches par byed pa la sgrib pas ni ser sna med pa @231b la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa la sgrib pas ni ser sna med pa @231b la sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the cause of attainment is an obscuration to the absence of avarice, since the latter is the cause of the former.

original: 'thob pa'i byed rgyu gsum ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las med pa dang / mang du thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i byed rgyu gsum ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las med pa dang / mang du thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byas pa'o //
translated: The three causes of attainment are: the absence of karma that leads to the loss of the Dharma, much learning, and the purification of meditative concentration.

original: de dang 'gal bas thos pas phongs pa la sogs pa ni dbang gi sgrib par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dang 'gal bas thos pas phongs pa la sogs pa ni dbang gi sgrib par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The obscuration to the cause of attainment is an obscuration to the absence of avarice, since the latter is the cause of the former.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: The cause is mentioned here

original: dbang de la dbang byed pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang de la dbang byed pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the latter is characterized by the attainment of mastery.

original: kha cig na re dge ba la sogs pa'i go rims kyi rgyu ni 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re dge ba la sogs pa'i go rims kyi rgyu ni 'di lta bu ste /
translated: Some believe that the cause of the order of virtue etc. is as follows:

original: dge ba'i chos kyi sems kyi rgyud nye bar bstan pas byang chub 'thob pa'i skal ba yod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi sems kyi rgyud nye bar bstan pas byang chub 'thob pa'i skal ba yod de /
translated: Since the mental continuum is revealed as virtuous, one has the fortune to attain enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir thog mar dge ba bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog mar dge ba bshad do //
translated: Hence, virtue is mentioned first.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub bshad do //
translated: After that, enlightenment is mentioned.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni chos dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pas byang chub kyi sems la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni chos dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pas byang chub kyi sems la brten nas /
translated: Since the Thought of Enlightenment is the basis of all virtuous dharmas, on the basis of the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: byang chub la thug gi bar du de gnyi ga sgrub nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub la thug gi bar du de gnyi ga sgrub nus par 'gyur te /
translated: one is able to accomplish both of them until enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi sems bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi sems bshad do //
translated: Therefore, after that, the Thought of Enlightenment is explained.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu sbyor ba dang / skye bo ngan pa dang skye bo sdang ba yongs su spong ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu sbyor ba dang / skye bo ngan pa dang skye bo sdang ba yongs su spong ste /
translated: Having generated the Thought of Enlightenment, one applies oneself to the six perfections and avoids bad people and hostile people.

original: de ltar 'di'i byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, his Bodhisattva nature is shown.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par 'dzin pa'i 'og tu blo dang ldan pa bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par 'dzin pa'i 'og tu blo dang ldan pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, after the right grasp, the wise one is explained.

original: de ltar rab tu sbyor ba na phyin ci log spong zhing phyin ci log med pa'i ye shes kyang skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu sbyor ba na phyin ci log spong zhing phyin ci log med pa'i ye shes kyang skyed par byed de /
translated: Thus, when one applies oneself, one abandons the errors and also generates the non-erroneous intuition.

original: de'i phyir blo ldan gyi 'og tu 'khrul pa med pa bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ldan gyi 'og tu 'khrul pa med pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, after the wise one, the non-deluded one is explained.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: That is the path of insight.

original: de la goms pas sgrib pa rnams spong bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la goms pas sgrib pa rnams spong bas de'i phyir /
translated: Since one eliminates the obscurations by cultivating that,

original: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa spong ba'i sgrib pa med pa bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa spong ba'i sgrib pa med pa bshad do //
translated: therefore, immediately after that, the absence of obscurations that eliminates the obscurations is explained.

original: sgrib pa med na srid pa dang longs spyod la chags pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrib pa med na srid pa dang longs spyod la chags pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no obscuration, one is not attached to existence and enjoyment.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du yid kyis yongs su sngo bar byed kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du yid kyis yongs su sngo bar byed kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one dedicates to Buddhahood with the mind, not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu bsngo ba bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu bsngo ba bshad do //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, dedication is explained.

original: de lta bur ni sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu zab mo rnams la mchog tu dga' ba skye ste /
analyzed: de lta bur ni sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu zab mo rnams la mchog tu dga' ba skye ste /
translated: In that way, supreme joy arises in the profound, very profound, Buddha Dharmas.

original: mi skrag pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mi skrag pa bshad do //
analyzed: mi skrag pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mi skrag pa bshad do //
translated: Since one is not frightened, therefore, immediately after that, the absence of fear is explained.

original: de ltar chos mngon sum du gyur pa thabs gang dang gang gis sems can 'dul bar mthong ba'i thabs de dang de la brten pas /
analyzed: de ltar chos mngon sum du gyur pa thabs gang dang gang gis sems can 'dul bar mthong ba'i thabs de dang de la brten pas /
translated: In that way, one sees the method by which one should tame sentient beings through the direct perception of the Dharma.

original: de la ser sna 'byung bar ga la 'gyur bas /üîΩmi skrag pa'i @232a * //
analyzed: de la ser sna 'byung bar ga la 'gyur bas / mi skrag pa'i @232a * //
translated: Since one relies on that method, how could one be stingy?

original: 'og tu ser sna med pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'og tu ser sna med pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, immediately after the absence of fear, the absence of stinginess is explained.

original: de ltar sgrib pa spangs pa dang dkar po'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems la dbang bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu dbang bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa spangs pa dang dkar po'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems la dbang bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu dbang bshad de /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has abandoned the obscurations and perfected the virtuous qualities becomes powerful in mind. Therefore, immediately after that, the ten powers are explained.

original: go rims ni 'di'o zhe'o //üîΩle'ur bcad pa 'dir sgrib pa'i skabs yin pas de'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa'i skye ba'i byed rgyu rnams ni /
analyzed: go rims ni 'di'o zhe'o // le'ur bcad pa 'dir sgrib pa'i skabs yin pas de'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa'i skye ba'i byed rgyu rnams ni /
translated: This is the order.

original: sgrib pa bzhin du mdor mdzad pas skabs nas 'byung ba rnams par gyi tshigs su bcad pas sdud par mdzad do //
analyzed: sgrib pa bzhin du mdor mdzad pas skabs nas 'byung ba rnams par gyi tshigs su bcad pas sdud par mdzad do //
translated: Since this chapter is about the obscurations, the ten productive causes of virtue and so on are summarized in a verse from the chapter on obscurations.üîΩThe ten productive causes areüîΩarising, enduring, support,üîΩdisplay, transformation, separation,

original: byed rgyu bcu ni skye ba dang // gnas pa brten dang bstan bya dang // 'gyur dang 'bral dang gzhan du dang // yid ches go byed 'thob rnams la //
analyzed: byed rgyu bcu ni skye ba dang // gnas pa brten dang bstan bya dang // 'gyur dang 'bral dang gzhan du dang // yid ches go byed 'thob rnams la //
translated: other, confidence, understanding, and attainment.

original: de ni dper brjod bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni dper brjod bsdu ba'i phyir //
