translated: In order to summarize the examples,

original: bar gyi tshigs bcad gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: bar gyi tshigs bcad gnyis pa ste //
translated: there is a second intermediate verse.üîΩThe examples of these are

original: mig dang zas sam mar me dang // me la sogs pa de yi dpe //
analyzed: mig dang zas sam mar me dang // me la sogs pa de yi dpe //
translated: the eye, food, a lamp, fire, and so on.

original: zor ba bzo shes du ba dang // rgyu dang lam la sogs pa gzhan //
analyzed: zor ba bzo shes du ba dang // rgyu dang lam la sogs pa gzhan //
translated: The knowledge of how to make a sickle, smoke, cause, path, and so on.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other are the axe, the knowledge of making, the smoke, the cause, the path, etc.

original: phyogs dang pha rol phyin sa la //
analyzed: phyogs dang pha rol phyin sa la //
translated: The obscurations to the side, the perfections, the levels,

original: sgrib pa dag ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa dag ni gzhan yin no //
translated: and the obscurations to the other are explained.

original: sngar ni dge ba dang de'i sgrib pa bye brag tu ma phye bar bshad do //
analyzed: sngar ni dge ba dang de'i sgrib pa bye brag tu ma phye bar bshad do //
translated: Previously, virtue and its obscurations were explained without distinction.

original: da ni phyogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i bye brag gis ni dge ba bshad do //
analyzed: da ni phyogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag dang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i bye brag gis ni dge ba bshad do //
translated: Now, virtue is explained by way of the distinctions of side, etc.

original: gzhi la mi mkhas le lo dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni phyogs la sogs pa'i dge ba la sgrib pa bshad do //
analyzed: gzhi la mi mkhas le lo dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni phyogs la sogs pa'i dge ba la sgrib pa bshad do //
translated: The obscurations to virtue of side, etc. are explained by way of the distinctions of laziness, etc.

original: der gtogs pas nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i bya ba bye brag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der gtogs pas nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i bya ba bye brag med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it belongs to both the Sravakas and Bodhisattvas, it is not distinguished.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs ni thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs ni thun mong ba'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are common.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang sa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The perfections and the stages are the uncommon activities of the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid de la lhag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid de la lhag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the bodhisattvas are engaged in them.

original: sngar ni dge ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la sgrib pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu la sgrib par bshad do //
analyzed: sngar ni dge ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la sgrib pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu la sgrib par bshad do //
translated: Previously, it was explained that the results are obscured by obscuration in terms of the cause of virtue, etc.

original: 'dir ni 'bras bu la dngos su sgrib pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bras bu la dngos su sgrib pa nyid de /
translated: Here, it is the actual obscuration of the results.

original: de bas na snga ma las gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na snga ma las gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be different from the former.

original: yang na sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa las gzhi la mi mkhas pa la sogs pa gzhan nyid de /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa las gzhi la mi mkhas pa la sogs pa gzhan nyid de /
translated: Or, it is different from the lack of application, etc., in terms of the lack of skill in the bases, etc.

original: de gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is different.

original: yang na dge ba dang byang chub ces @232b bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na dge ba dang byang chub ces @232b bya ba ni /
translated: Or, virtue and enlightenment are

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi thabs dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang / 'bras bu la sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa sgrib po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi thabs dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang / 'bras bu la sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa sgrib po zhes bshad do //
translated: explained here as the bodhisattva's conduct with means and the lack of application, etc. to the results are obscurations.

original: 'dir ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam par 'byed pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam par 'byed pas /
translated: Here, the factors of enlightenment and so on are distinguished.üîΩThe obscurations to the common and uncommon virtues should be understood elsewhere,

original: gzhi la mi mkhas pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi la mi mkhas pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: from the lack of skill in the bases and so on,

original: sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa las /üîΩdge ba thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sgrib pa gzhan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa la sogs pa las / dge ba thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sgrib pa gzhan du rig par bya'o //
translated: from the lack of application and so on.

original: de la nyan thos la sogs pa tha dad pas byang chub gsum ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos la sogs pa tha dad pas byang chub gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the three enlightenments are the distinctions of the sravakas and so on.

original: de dag dang mthun pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas lam la thug gi bar dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas lam la thug gi bar dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are called that because they are in conformity with those, from the establishments of mindfulness up to the path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / sa bcu rnams ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / sa bcu rnams ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The ten perfections and the ten levels are as they occur in the sutras.

original: gzhi la mi mkhas pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sgrib po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi la mi mkhas pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sgrib po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lack of skill in the bases is the obscuration to the establishments of mindfulness.

original: de dag ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang bzhi'o //
translated: The establishments of mindfulness are the four: mindfulness of body, of feeling, of mind, and of events.

original: de dag gi gzhi ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams te /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams te /
translated: The bases of these are the body, sensation, mind, and entities.

original: de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the objects of those.

original: de la gnas su mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni lus so //
analyzed: de la gnas su mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni lus so //
translated: The body is the basis of attachment to a location.

original: bdag gi longs spyod du mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod du mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Sensation is the basis of attachment to one‚Äôs own enjoyment.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni sems so //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni sems so //
translated: The mind is the basis of attachment to the self.

original: bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni chos rnams so //
analyzed: bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni chos rnams so //
translated: Entities are the basis of attachment to the self as afflicted or purified.

original: lus la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa gang yin pa de ni de la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa gang yin pa de ni de la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: Lack of skill in regard to the body, etc. is the non-penetration of their own and general characteristics.

original: de la lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mi gtsang ba du ma'i rdzas 'dus pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mi gtsang ba du ma'i rdzas 'dus pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The own characteristic of the body is the collection of many impure substances.

original: tshor ba'i ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The own characteristic of sensation is the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul las so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul las so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The own characteristic of consciousness is the perception of objects.

original: chos rnams kyi ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They are applied to all things in the appropriate manner.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The general characteristics are the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: yang na lus la sogs pa la mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam par ma rtog pa'am /üîΩgtsang ba dag bde ba dang rtag pa dag /
analyzed: yang na lus la sogs pa la mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam par ma rtog pa'am / gtsang ba dag bde ba dang rtag pa dag /
translated: Or else, the non-imagination of the body, etc., as pure, happy, permanent, and having a self is the antidote to the four errors.

original: bdag gi rnam par rtog pa ni gzhi la mi mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi rnam par rtog pa ni gzhi la mi mkhas pa ste /
translated: The imagination of the pure, happy, permanent, and having a self is the lack of skill in the bases.

original: 'di ltar @233a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @233a * //
translated: Thus,

original: mi shes pa'am /
analyzed: mi shes pa'am /
translated: the lack of skill in the bases is the imagination of what is not.

original: lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sgrib pa'o //
translated: The view is the obscuration to the applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni shes rab dang dran pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni shes rab dang dran pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the applications of mindfulness have the nature of wisdom and mindfulness,

original: ci'i phyir gzhi la mi mkhas pa ni sgrib pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhi la mi mkhas pa ni sgrib pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: why is the lack of skill in the bases said to be an obscuration,

original: gzhi mi dran pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi mi dran pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not the lack of mindfulness of the bases?

original: shes rab kyi kha na las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi kha na las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the source of the obscuration of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar shes rab ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Thus, wisdom is the nature of seeing.

original: shes rab kyi rjes las thob pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa la sogs pa rab tu 'jug gi / shes rab bzhin du rang gi rgyud yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rjes las thob pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa la sogs pa rab tu 'jug gi / shes rab bzhin du rang gi rgyud yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In the object of wisdom, mindfulness, etc. are active in the aftermath of wisdom, but they do not exist in the stream of consciousness as does wisdom.

original: de'i phyir mi dran pa ni sgrib pa zhes mi bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dran pa ni sgrib pa zhes mi bshad do //
translated: Therefore, non-mindfulness is not explained as a obscuration.

original: le lo ni yang dag par spong ba rnams la sgrib bo //
analyzed: le lo ni yang dag par spong ba rnams la sgrib bo //
translated: Laziness is an obscuration to the correct exertions.üîΩThe correct exertions are the four: the exertion to prevent the arising of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen; the exertion to abandon the evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen; the exertion to give rise to the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen; and the exertion to remain, not to lose, the wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa dang ma skyes pa spong ba dang / mi skyed pa dang / gnyen po skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / skyed pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni yang dag par spong ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa dang ma skyes pa spong ba dang / mi skyed pa dang / gnyen po skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / skyed pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni yang dag par spong ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: They are called correct exertions because they are applied in order to abandon the arisen and unarisen adverse elements and their resistances, and in order to give rise to the unarisen resistances and to make the arisen ones remain.

original: de ni dbyer med kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhir gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni dbyer med kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhir gzhag go //
translated: They are established as four because they are the antidotes to the four kinds of laziness.

original: de bas na yang dag par spong ba rnams brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid yin pas le lo ni sgrib par bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par spong ba rnams brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid yin pas le lo ni sgrib par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since the right efforts have the nature of vigor, laziness is said to be their obstruction.

original: gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By two, the degeneration of meditative concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la sgrib po//
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la sgrib po//
translated: This is the obstruction to the bases of psychic power.

original: 'dis rdzu 'phrul byed pas rdzu 'phrul te /
analyzed: 'dis rdzu 'phrul byed pas rdzu 'phrul te /
translated: Psychic power is so called because it is the doing of psychic feats.

original: de yang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de yang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is the meditative concentration of aspiration, vigor, mind, and examination.

original: de nyid rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba ste /
translated: That itself is the basis of psychic power.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / sprul pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi gnas su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / sprul pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi gnas su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of psychic power because it is the basis of psychic feats such as traveling through space and creating apparitions.

original: yang na 'gro bas rdzu 'phrul te /
analyzed: yang na 'gro bas rdzu 'phrul te /
translated: Alternatively, psychic power is the going.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the going through space, etc. It is a synonym for mastery.

original: de'i rkang pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rkang pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
translated: The bases of psychic power are the bases of that psychic power.

original: de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the bases of psychic power because they are the bases of psychic power.

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi po de nyid ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi po de nyid ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: These four kinds of meditative concentration, beginning with the meditative concentration of will, are meditative concentration itself.

original: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'dun pa gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'dun pa gtso bo ste /
translated: In the meditative concentration of will, will is the principal factor,

original: de'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains meditative concentration through it.

original: brtson 'grus la sogs pa yang de na med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la sogs pa yang de na med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that effort, etc., are absent there,

original: 'dun pa'i grogs byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i grogs byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because will assists them.

original: de dag ni der gtso bo ma yin pas de dag mi bshad do //
analyzed: de dag ni der gtso bo ma yin pas de dag mi bshad do //
translated: But since they are not principal there, they are not mentioned.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod @233b pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / sems dang dpyod @233b pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meditative concentrations of effort, mind, and examination should be explained in the same way.

original: gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin nyams pa sgrib par bshad pa de mi shes te /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin nyams pa sgrib par bshad pa de mi shes te /
translated: It is not known that the degeneration of meditative concentration is explained as being due to two factors.

original: de'i phyir 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang sems dang / dpyod pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / spong ba'i 'du byed bsgom pa ma tshang bas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang sems dang / dpyod pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / spong ba'i 'du byed bsgom pa ma tshang bas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúif any one of the factors of enlightenment is incomplete, the cultivation of the applications of abandoning is incomplete.‚Äù

original: de la 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang bas yongs su bskal pa nyams te /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang bas yongs su bskal pa nyams te /
translated: Among the factors of enlightenment, which consist of mindfulness, the analysis of phenomena, effort, delight, pliancy, equanimity, and concentration, if any one of them is incomplete, the cultivation of the applications of abandoning is incomplete.

original: de'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of any one of them, the cultivation of concentration is incomplete.

original: sgom pa nyams pa ni spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po dag las ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgom pa nyams pa ni spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po dag las ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cultivation of the applications of abandoning is incomplete because of the absence of any one of the eight applications of abandoning.

original: de dag ni dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The eight applications of abandoning are faith, will, effort, pliancy, mindfulness, full awareness, volition, and equanimity.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed 'di dag bsgoms na ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed 'di dag bsgoms na ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob ste /
translated: If one cultivates these applications of abandoning, one obtains mastery over concentration.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: de bas na de dag ma tshang na sgom pa nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ma tshang na sgom pa nyams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if they are incomplete, it is called a deficiency in cultivation,

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang mi thob bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang mi thob bo //
translated: because one does not obtain mastery over concentration.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obstruction here?

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang spong ba'i 'du byed kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang spong ba'i 'du byed kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is the adverse factors of will-power, etc., and the secondary mental afflictions that are adverse factors to the applications of abandoning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed pa'o //üîΩthar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams mi skyed pa ni dbang po rnams la sgrib po zhes bya ba ni 'khor bas skrag ste /
analyzed: le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed pa'o // thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams mi skyed pa ni dbang po rnams la sgrib po zhes bya ba ni 'khor bas skrag ste /
translated: Laziness, forgetting the instruction, laxity and excitedness, non-application, and application.üîΩThe obstruction to the production of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is the faculties.üîΩThe obstruction to the production of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is the faculties.

original: thar pa'i dbang du byas nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang mngon par 'du byed pa des thar pa rnyed par nges pas /
analyzed: thar pa'i dbang du byas nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang mngon par 'du byed pa des thar pa rnyed par nges pas /
translated: The obstruction to the production of the factors that contribute to liberation is the powers.üîΩThe obstruction to the production of the path is the factors of enlightenment.üîΩThe obstruction to the production of the result is the fruits of the spiritual life.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúconducive to liberation.

original: de bskyed na dad pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bskyed na dad pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äù When it is generated, it obtains the name ‚Äúfaculty‚Äù of faith, etc.

original: gzhan du ma yin pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa mi skyed pa ni dbang po rnams la sgrib par bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa mi skyed pa ni dbang po rnams la sgrib par bshad do //
translated: Since it is not otherwise, the non-generation of that conducive to liberation is said to be an obstruction to the faculties.

original: de la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obstruction there?

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gis thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa mi skyed pa ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang gis thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa mi skyed pa ste /
translated: It is the secondary defilement by which the conducive to liberation is not generated.

original: de ni yang srid pa la chags pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yang srid pa la chags pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to renewed existence and fear of nirvana.

original: dbang po de dag gi nyam chung ba ni stobs rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: dbang po de dag gi nyam chung ba ni stobs rnams la sgrib po //
translated: The weakness of those faculties is an obstruction to the powers.

original: dbang po rnams kyi nyam chung ba ji lta bu @234a * //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi nyam chung ba ji lta bu @234a * //
translated: What is the weakness of the faculties?

original: zhe na / de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhe na / de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says: because of the mixing with adverse elements.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjed ngas pa dang / g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis zil gyis mi gnon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjed ngas pa dang / g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis zil gyis mi gnon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot overcome‚Äù is that it is not overcome by its opposing factors, which are lack of faith, laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and poor understanding.

original: do par gyur pa dang / rtse mos rab tu phye ba dag ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: do par gyur pa dang / rtse mos rab tu phye ba dag ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The faculties are the two roots of virtue, faith, and so on, which are dominant in the stage of heat and the summit.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa la sogs pas zil gyis non pa'i phyir nyam chung ba ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa la sogs pas zil gyis non pa'i phyir nyam chung ba ste /
translated: These two aspects of the factors conducive to penetrative insight are weak because they are overcome by their opposing factors, such as lack of faith.

original: de'i phyir 'di las yongs su nyams pa srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di las yongs su nyams pa srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is possible to retrogress from them.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thul bas bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus na dad pa la sogs pa stobs kyis ming 'thob po //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thul bas bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus na dad pa la sogs pa stobs kyis ming 'thob po //
translated: At the stage of the highest mundane experience, faith and so on are called powers because they overcome their opposing factors.

original: de'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo'i dus na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis non nas nyam chung ba gang yin pa de ni stobs rnams la sgrib ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo'i dus na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis non nas nyam chung ba gang yin pa de ni stobs rnams la sgrib ste /
translated: Therefore, those very faith, etc., when they are weak, being overwhelmed by their resistant tendencies at the time of heat and summits, are obscurations to the powers.

original: de yod na stobs kyi bye brag mi srid do //
analyzed: de yod na stobs kyi bye brag mi srid do //
translated: If they exist, the specific powers are impossible.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs de nyid do //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs de nyid do //
translated: Those very resistant tendencies, such as lack of faith, etc.

original: lta ba'i nyes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la sgrib po //
translated: The fault of views is an obscuration to the limbs of enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni 'dir mthong ba'i lam la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni 'dir mthong ba'i lam la dgongs pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is intended here as the path of seeing.

original: de'i dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin du sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i dus na 'byung bas yan lag rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin du sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i dus na 'byung bas yan lag rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The seven limbs of enlightenment are the limbs of enlightenment because they occur at the time of abandoning the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gal te byang chub dang mthun pas yan lag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub dang mthun pas yan lag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are limbs because they are conducive to enlightenment,

original: de lta na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang byang chub kyi yan lag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang byang chub kyi yan lag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the four establishments of mindfulness would also be limbs of enlightenment.

original: lta ba'i nyes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la sgrib po zhes bya ba de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la sgrib po zhes bya ba de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it that the fault of view obscures the limbs of enlightenment?

original: de'i phyir de dag mthong ba'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag mthong ba'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are called limbs because they are distinguished by the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they are established as the path of insight.

original: lta ba'i nyes pa 'di gang zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa 'di gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of view?

original: kun brtags pa'i lta ba rnam pa lnga dang / the tshom dang ma rig pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs @234b pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i lta ba rnam pa lnga dang / the tshom dang ma rig pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs @234b pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: It is the five kinds of false views, doubt, ignorance, and the defilements and secondary defilements such as passion that are associated with them.

original: the tshom la sogs pa yang 'dir sgrib pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom la sogs pa yang 'dir sgrib pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are doubt, etc. not obscurations here?

original: sgrib pa yin du zin kyang 'dir gtso bor brjod par bzhed pas lta ba'i skyon smos pa'i phyir de dag ma smos kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: sgrib pa yin du zin kyang 'dir gtso bor brjod par bzhed pas lta ba'i skyon smos pa'i phyir de dag ma smos kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Although they are obscurations, they are not mentioned here because it is the fault of view that is being discussed, and so there is no contradiction in not mentioning them.

original: lta ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa nyid mthong ba'i lam gyis spong ba'i phyir de'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa nyid mthong ba'i lam gyis spong ba'i phyir de'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The seeds of those views, etc. are located in the store consciousness, and they are eliminated by the path of insight.

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa ni lam gyi yan lag yang dag par lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang ; rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la sgrib ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa ni lam gyi yan lag yang dag par lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang ; rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la sgrib ste /
translated: The fault of negative reflex action obscures the branches of the path: right view, thought, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness and concentration.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned:

original: lam gyi yan lag de dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag de dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because those branches of the path are distinguished by the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established on the path of cultivation.

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that fault of negative reflex action?

original: rgyas par bya ba na ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba lhan cig skyes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dang de la yang dmigs pa yul la yang dmigs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mtshungsüîΩpar ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams te /
analyzed: rgyas par bya ba na ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba lhan cig skyes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dang de la yang dmigs pa yul la yang dmigs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mtshungsüîΩpar ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams te /
translated: If it is to be elaborated, it is the innate afflicted view of the self and the extreme, together with its concomitant states, and also the concomitant states of attachment and so on that focus on that, which focus on the object.

original: de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The seeds of those in the foundation consciousness are the negative reflex.

original: mdor bsdu na mthong bas spang bar bya ba las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na mthong bas spang bar bya ba las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: In brief, it is the other contaminated states that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de'i nus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa ni gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: de'i nus pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa ni gnas ngan len to //
translated: The power of those in the foundation consciousness is the negative reflex.

original: de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin pas lam gyi yan lag gi sgrib par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin pas lam gyi yan lag gi sgrib par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since it is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, it is posited as the obscuration to the branches of the path.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la sgrib pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la sgrib pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The obscurations to the factors of enlightenment have already been explained.

original: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi bshad dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi bshad dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: After that, it is necessary to explain the perfections, so he says,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa ni /
translated: The obscurations to the perfectionsüîΩare the obscurations of not being wealthy,üîΩnot going to happy realms, not giving up on sentient beings,

original: phyug po dang ni bde 'gro dang // sems can mi gtong sgrib pa dang // zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: phyug po dang ni bde 'gro dang // sems can mi gtong sgrib pa dang // zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de la sgrib pas de'i sgrib pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gi pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de la sgrib pas de'i sgrib pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the obscurations to the result of whichever perfection among the ten perfections is called the obscuration to that perfection.

original: 'di la ser sna la sogs pa sbyin pa la sogs pa la dngos su gegs byed pa bzhin du @235a * //
analyzed: 'di la ser sna la sogs pa sbyin pa la sogs pa la dngos su gegs byed pa bzhin du @235a * //
translated: Here, stinginess and so on directly obstruct generosity and so on.

original: ci'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la sgrub par brjod la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la sgrub par brjod la /
translated: Why are they said to be established as obscurations to the result of those perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib par ni ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib par ni ma bshad ce na /
translated: but not said to be obscurations to the perfections themselves?

original: de'i 'bras bu'i don du sbyin pa la sogs pa la thams cad 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i don du sbyin pa la sogs pa la thams cad 'jug ste /
translated: All are engaged in generosity and so on for the sake of their results.

original: de bas na ser sna la sogs pa spang bar nan tan bskyed pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sgrib par bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na ser sna la sogs pa spang bar nan tan bskyed pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sgrib par bshad de /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate effort to abandon stinginess and so on, they are explained as obscurations to the result,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam la sgrib par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam la sgrib par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as obscurations to the perfections themselves.

original: yang na ser sna la sogs pa sgrib pa phyug po la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dbul po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa na phyug po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la gegs byed pas de'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ser sna la sogs pa sgrib pa phyug po la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dbul po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa na phyug po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la gegs byed pas de'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, stinginess, etc. are obscurations to the result of the 'rich man', etc. because they are adverse to the 'rich man', etc. and generate the result of the 'poor man', etc.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of these?

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni gtso bor ni phyug po dang bdag po'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni gtso bor ni phyug po dang bdag po'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of giving is, in the main, the 'rich man' and 'master'.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni bde 'gro'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni bde 'gro'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of morality is good destiny.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of patience is the non-abandonment of beings.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni nyes pa dang yon tan 'bri ba dang 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni nyes pa dang yon tan 'bri ba dang 'phel ba'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of vigour is the increase of good and the decrease of evil.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni bstan pa la sems can 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni bstan pa la sems can 'dzud pa'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of meditation is the establishment of beings in the teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni btsud pa de rnams rnam par grol bar byed pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni btsud pa de rnams rnam par grol bar byed pa'o /
translated: The result of the perfection of wisdom is the liberation of those who have been introduced.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas dge ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas dge ba mi zad pa'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of skill in regard to the means is the inexhaustibility of the wholesome due to the dedication to enlightenment.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of vows is the continuity of the wholesome.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba'i chos nges par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba'i chos nges par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of the powers is the certainty of the wholesome dharmas.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni chos la longs spyod pa dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni chos la longs spyod pa dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The result of the perfection of direct intuition is the enjoyment of the Dharma and the evolutionary development of living beings.

original: phyug po dang bdag po la sgrib ces bya ba la /
analyzed: phyug po dang bdag po la sgrib ces bya ba la /
translated: The obscuration to affluence and to mastery.

original: de la phyug po ni nor dang yo byad mang ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyug po ni nor dang yo byad mang ba'o //
translated: Affluence is the abundance of wealth and property.

original: bdag po ni longs spyod de la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po ni longs spyod de la dbang ba'o //
translated: Mastery is the control over those enjoyments.

original: de gnyi ga la sgrib pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la sgrib pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The obscuration to both of these is the obscuration to the perfection of generosity.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of that.

original: de gang zhe na ser sna'o //
analyzed: de gang zhe na ser sna'o //
translated: What is that? It is avarice.

original: bde 'gro la sgrib ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bde 'gro la sgrib ces bya ba la /
translated: It is an obscuration to happy rebirth,

original: mdzes par 'gro ba ni bde 'gro ste mi dang lha'o //
analyzed: mdzes par 'gro ba ni bde 'gro ste mi dang lha'o //
translated: Happy rebirth is rebirth as a human or god.

original: de la sgrib pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The obscuration to that is the obscuration to the perfection of morality.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of that.

original: de ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: de ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims te /
translated: That is immorality,

original: lus dang ngag gi las @235b ngan pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las @235b ngan pa'o //
translated: which is evil action of body and speech.

original: sems can yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gnod par byed pa la yang phan 'dogs pa bzhin du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gnod par byed pa la yang phan 'dogs pa bzhin du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Not abandoning sentient beings means holding on to sentient beings who do harm as if they were benefactors.

original: de yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: And that is the result of the perfection of patience.

original: de'i sgrib pa ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa ni khro ba'o //
translated: The obscuration to that is anger.

original: nyes pa dang yon tan 'bri zhing 'phel ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyes pa dang yon tan 'bri zhing 'phel ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Diminishing and increasing faults and virtues,

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa rab tu zhugs pa skyes pa rnams spong ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa ni nyes pa rnams 'bri ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa rab tu zhugs pa skyes pa rnams spong ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa ni nyes pa rnams 'bri ba'o //
translated: The decrease of faults is the abandonment of faults that have arisen and the non-arising of those that have not yet arisen.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan par zhugs pa skyes pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa ni yon tan rnams 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan par zhugs pa skyes pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa ni yon tan rnams 'phel ba'o //
translated: The increase of virtues is the frequent occurrence of virtues that have arisen and the arising of those that have not yet arisen.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na le lo'o //
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na le lo'o //
translated: What is the obscuration here? It is laziness.

original: 'dul ba 'dzud pa la sgrib ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzud pa la sgrib ces bya ba la /
translated: The obscuration to the engagement in the training is the non-engagement in the training.

original: 'dul ba rnams bstan pa la 'dzud pa ni mtho ris dang / byang grol rnyed pa'i rgyur khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams bstan pa la 'dzud pa ni mtho ris dang / byang grol rnyed pa'i rgyur khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The engagement in the training is the cause of attaining heaven and liberation, because it is accepted as such.

original: nye bar zhi bas gus pa skye ste sems can kun brjod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis bsgrib mi dgos par bstan pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bas gus pa skye ste sems can kun brjod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis bsgrib mi dgos par bstan pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: Respect arises from tranquility, and one understands the teaching of the Buddha without the need for further explanation through miracles.

original: 'di la sgrib pa ni g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa ni g-yeng ba'o //
translated: What is the obscuration here? It is distraction.

original: rnam par grol bar byed pa la sgrib ces bya ba la rnam par grol bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed pa la sgrib ces bya ba la rnam par grol bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
translated: It is called an obstruction to the liberator. The liberator is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de yang rjes su bstan pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rjes su bstan pas 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that is accomplished through instruction.

original: rjes su bstan pa ni shes rab kyis te /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa ni shes rab kyis te /
translated: Instruction is through wisdom.

original: gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not through anything else.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the result of the perfection of wisdom is the liberator.

original: de'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab bam /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab bam /
translated: Its obstruction is afflicted wisdom,

original: gti mug gam /
analyzed: gti mug gam /
translated: or delusion,

original: 'chal pa'i shes rab po //üîΩsbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad pa la sgrib ste zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa mi zad pa la sgrib pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i shes rab po // sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad pa la sgrib ste zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa mi zad pa la sgrib pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: or faulty wisdom.üîΩIt is an obstruction to the inexhaustibility of generosity, etc.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obstruction to the inexhaustibility of generosity, morality, etc. is the obstruction to the perfection of skillful means.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa de yang ji ltar mi zad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa de yang ji ltar mi zad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does that generosity, etc. become inexhaustible?

original: de'i phyir / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas de mi zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas de mi zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the inexhaustibility of that through the transformation into enlightenment.‚Äù

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni sangs rgyas nyid bzhin du zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni sangs rgyas nyid bzhin du zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The roots of the wholesome of generosity, etc. which are transformed into universal enlightenment are inexhaustible like Buddhahood itself.

original: kha cig na re de'i sgrib pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs mi shes pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re de'i sgrib pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs mi shes pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Some believe that the obscuration to that is the non-cognizance of the method which has the defining characteristic of transformation into universal enlightenment.

original: gzhan dag na re thabs mi mkhas pa 'khor gsum du 'dzin pa ni de'i sgrib pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thabs mi mkhas pa 'khor gsum du 'dzin pa ni de'i sgrib pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others believe that the obscuration to that is the non-skill in the method which consists in the apprehension of the three spheres.

original: tshe rabs thams cad du dge ba @236a * //
analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du dge ba @236a * //
translated: In all lives, the obscuration to the arising of the wholesome,

original: rgyan mi 'chad par 'byung ba la sgrib ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyan mi 'chad par 'byung ba la sgrib ces bya ba la /
translated: without interruption, is an obscuration to the arising of the wholesome without interruption.

original: dge ba rgyun mi 'chad pa ni nyin re'am skad cig re re la ste /
analyzed: dge ba rgyun mi 'chad pa ni nyin re'am skad cig re re la ste /
translated: The arising of the wholesome without interruption is in every day or every instant.

original: de yang smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de yang smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Moreover, this is the result of the perfection of vows.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause one takes up birth in accordance with that through the power of aspirational prayers.‚Äù

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: One takes up birth in accordance with the occurrence of generosity, etc., without interruption through the power of aspirational prayers.

original: de la sgrib pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mthun par smon lam mi 'debs pa'o //üîΩdge ba de nyid nges par byed pa la sgrib ces bya ba ni nyin re'am skad cig re re la gcig tu byed pa ni nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mthun par smon lam mi 'debs pa'o // dge ba de nyid nges par byed pa la sgrib ces bya ba ni nyin re'am skad cig re re la gcig tu byed pa ni nges par byed pa'o //
translated: Obstruction here means not making aspirational prayers in accordance with generosity, etc.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: The cause of that is stated here:

original: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause one is not overcome by adverse elements through the power of discernment and meditative development.‚Äù

original: de la so sor brtags pa'i stobs ni bstan pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa'i stobs ni bstan pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The power of discernment here refers to the wisdom that is endowed with the teachings.

original: brtan pa ni btags pa'i chos te ;
analyzed: brtan pa ni btags pa'i chos te ;
translated: Stability refers to the imaginary dharmas.

original: brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gsum lhan cig skyes pa la btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gsum lhan cig skyes pa la btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because effort, meditative concentration, and wisdom are designated as being innate.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs ni goms pa dang ldan pas bsgrim mi dgos par sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs ni goms pa dang ldan pas bsgrim mi dgos par sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The power of cultivation is the cause of the non-forgetting of the bodhisattva who is established in the spiritual levels, because he engages in generosity, etc. without the need for effort due to his possession of practice.

original: de'i gnyen po ser sna la sogs pas zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ser sna la sogs pas zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he is not overcome by their opponents, stinginess, etc.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration here?

original: so sor ma brtags pa dang bsgom pa nyam chung ba'o //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa dang bsgom pa nyam chung ba'o //
translated: It is the weakness of the lack of critical consideration and of meditative development.

original: bdag dang gzhan chos la longs spyod pa dang yongs su smin par byed pa la sgrib ces bya ba ni longs spyod pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan chos la longs spyod pa dang yongs su smin par byed pa la sgrib ces bya ba ni longs spyod pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rnam par gnas te /
translated: The obscuration to the enjoyment of the Dharma for oneself and for others consists in the non-establishment of the assembly and retinue in the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi las kyis tshes ston pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi las kyis tshes ston pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the profound and sublime Dharma of the universal vehicle and the maturation of sentient beings through teaching the Dharma by means of various kinds of emanations is the result.

original: de'i sgrib pa ni thos pa'i don la sgra ji bzhin du spyod pa dang / shes rab chung ba ni sgrib po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa ni thos pa'i don la sgra ji bzhin du spyod pa dang / shes rab chung ba ni sgrib po zhes bya'o //
translated: Its obscuration is the literal understanding of the meaning of what is heard, and the smallness of wisdom is called an obscuration.

original: 'di la rdzas su ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di la rdzas su ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: Here, in substance, there are six perfections.

original: ming du ni bcu ste /
analyzed: ming du ni bcu ste /
translated: In name, there are ten,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the four perfections are distinguished from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Among them, the perfection of wisdom is supramundane nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ye shes des sgrib pa thams cad rim gyis spang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes des sgrib pa thams cad rim gyis spang ngo //
translated: By that wisdom, all obscurations are gradually eliminated.

original: thabs dang / @236b smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: thabs dang / @236b smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The perfections of means, vows, power, and knowledge are included in the wisdom attained subsequent to the supramundane path.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog yin na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog yin na ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the perfection of knowledge is supreme, how is it not nonconceptual?

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom that is attained subsequently to the nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ye shes des khong du chud pa yongs su bcad nas bdag nyid kyang chos la longs spyod pa rab tu myong la /
analyzed: ye shes des khong du chud pa yongs su bcad nas bdag nyid kyang chos la longs spyod pa rab tu myong la /
translated: Having ascertained the comprehension by that wisdom, one experiences the enjoyment of the Dharma oneself and

original: gzhan dag kyang yongs su smin par byad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yongs su smin par byad pa yin te /
translated: brings others to maturity.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang rnam par mi rtog pa la med pas de'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang rnam par mi rtog pa la med pas de'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: Since both of these are absent in the nonconceptual, therefore the perfection of wisdom is not nonconceptual.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The obscurations to the perfections have been explained.

original: de'i 'og tu sa rnams kyi brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa rnams kyi brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Next, the levels must be mentioned, so it is said:

original: sa rnams la yang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: sa rnams la yang go rims bzhin te /
translated: The levels are also in order.

original: kun du 'gro don mchog gi don //
analyzed: kun du 'gro don mchog gi don //
translated: Universal, supreme goal,

original: zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: and so on is stated extensively.

original: de la sa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: de la sa ni bcu ste /
translated: There are ten levels.

original: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' dang / mngon du gyur ba dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' dang / mngon du gyur ba dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: the Joyous, the Stainless, the Radiant, the Brilliant, the Very Difficult to Conquer, the Face to Face, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Intelligence,

original: chos kyi sprin no //üîΩde la chos kyi dbyings la kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du khong du chud pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams ni gong nas gong du khong du chud pa'i gnas pa'i tshul dang / de las skyes pa'i yon tan gyi gzhi'i tshul gyi sa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin no // de la chos kyi dbyings la kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du khong du chud pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnams ni gong nas gong du khong du chud pa'i gnas pa'i tshul dang / de las skyes pa'i yon tan gyi gzhi'i tshul gyi sa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: and the Cloud of Dharma.üîΩIn this regard, the stages of the bodhisattva are called stages because they are the modes of the bodhisattva's abiding in the realization of the meaning of the all-pervading dharmadhatu, etc., and because they are the modes of the foundation of the qualities that arise from that realization.

original: gzhan dag na re chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don la gnas pa gang dang gang gis byang chub sems dpa' mang du gnas pa'i gnas pa de dang de la gnas pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don la gnas pa gang dang gang gis byang chub sems dpa' mang du gnas pa'i gnas pa de dang de la gnas pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say that the stages are so called because the bodhisattva abides in the realization of the meaning of the all-pervading dharmadhatu, etc., and because he abides in the various realizations.

original: sa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni rab tu dga' ba la mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chos mngon par rtogs so //
analyzed: sa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni rab tu dga' ba la mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chos mngon par rtogs so //
translated: The classification of the stages is as follows: because the path of insight arises on the stage of the joyous, the bodhisattva realizes the truth of Dharma.

original: chos mngon par rtogs nas dri ma med pa la rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba lhag pa'i tshul khrims bslab pa'i khyad par sgrub ste /
analyzed: chos mngon par rtogs nas dri ma med pa la rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba lhag pa'i tshul khrims bslab pa'i khyad par sgrub ste /
translated: Having realized the truth of Dharma, he accomplishes the special training in superior morality, which is naturally stainless.

original: ltung ba phra mo'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from all the immorality of the subtle transgressions.

original: 'od byed pa la ni tshe rabs gzhan du yang chos las mi nyams pa lhag pa'i sems bslab pa'i khyad par @237a * //
analyzed: 'od byed pa la ni tshe rabs gzhan du yang chos las mi nyams pa lhag pa'i sems bslab pa'i khyad par @237a * //
translated: On the stage of the luminous, he accomplishes the special training in superior mind, which is the nondegeneration of Dharma in other lives.

original: sgrub po // 'od 'phro can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' dang / mngon du gyur la ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa lhag pa'i shes rab bslab pa'i khyad par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub po // 'od 'phro can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' dang / mngon du gyur la ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang bden pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa lhag pa'i shes rab bslab pa'i khyad par sgrub pa'o //
translated: On the stages of the radiant, very hard to conquer, and face to face, he accomplishes the special training in superior wisdom, which is the objective support of the factors of enlightenment, the truths, and dependent origination.

original: sa lhag ma rnams la ni bslab pa de dag nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa lhag ma rnams la ni bslab pa de dag nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The results of those trainings should be understood as the four results on the remaining spiritual levels.

original: de la ring du song ba rnams la ni 'bad pa dang bcas par mtshan ma med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa sgrub po //
analyzed: de la ring du song ba rnams la ni 'bad pa dang bcas par mtshan ma med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa sgrub po //
translated: On the Gone Afar, one accomplishes the meditative realization of signlessness with effort.

original: mi g-yo ba la ni lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa zhing rnam par dag pa dang lhan cig sgrub bo ;üîΩ/ legs pa'i blo gros la ni so so yang dag par rig pa yon tan gyi khyad par gang gis chos smra bar 'gyur ba sgrub po //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la ni lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa'i ye shes la gnas pa zhing rnam par dag pa dang lhan cig sgrub bo ; / legs pa'i blo gros la ni so so yang dag par rig pa yon tan gyi khyad par gang gis chos smra bar 'gyur ba sgrub po //
translated: On the Immovable, one accomplishes the effortless meditative realization of signlessness together with the purification of the buddha land.üîΩOn the Good Discrimination, one accomplishes the special qualities of the analytical knowledges by which one becomes a Dharma teacher.

original: chos kyi sprin la ni ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par sgrub po //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la ni ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par sgrub po //
translated: On the Cloud of Dharma, one accomplishes the special qualities of the concentrations and retentions.

original: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams kyis kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams kyis kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the dharmadhatu, such as the all-pervading, are the ten bodhisattva stages. The ten aspects of the dharmadhatu, such as the all-pervading, are the ten bodhisattva stages. The ten bodhisattva stages are the ten aspects of the dharmadhatu, such as the all-pervading.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la rnam pa bcur go rims bzhin du sgrib ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la rnam pa bcur go rims bzhin du sgrib ste /
translated: That non-afflicted nescience is an obscuration to the ten aspects of the dharmadhatu in the ten bodhisattva stages, respectively.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is adverse to them, i.e. because it is adverse to the stages.

original: sa rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: sa rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The stages are characterized by the states of supramundane meditative concentration, wisdom, etc.

original: de dag skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: Non-afflicted nescience is adverse to them because it acts as an impediment to their arising.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa kho na sgrib par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa kho na sgrib par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only non-defiled nescience is an obscuration,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: but also the defilements and secondary defilements.

original: 'di ltar rab tu dga' ba la ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba thams cad sgrib ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu dga' ba la ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba thams cad sgrib ste /
translated: Thus, on the stage of joy, all that is to be relinquished by the path of vision is an obscuration,

original: 'di ltar kun du 'gro ba'i don khong du chud par byed pa mthong ba'i lam gyi bden pa rnams la log par rtog pa'i bag la nyal ba thams cad spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun du 'gro ba'i don khong du chud par byed pa mthong ba'i lam gyi bden pa rnams la log par rtog pa'i bag la nyal ba thams cad spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the latent propensities for misapprehending the Truths of the path of vision are relinquished, in order to comprehend the meaning of the all-pervading.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni sa lhag ma rnams kyis spong ngo //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni sa lhag ma rnams kyis spong ngo //
translated: Those that are to be relinquished by the path of meditative development are relinquished by the remaining stages.

original: de dag ni ma spangs kyang spangs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ma spangs kyang spangs pa bzhin te /
translated: Even though they have not been relinquished, they are as though they have been,

original: @237b byang chub sems dpa' rnams la kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @237b byang chub sems dpa' rnams la kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because they do not act as the defilement of the Bodhisattvas.

original: don de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: don de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
translated: This very matter is referred to in the verse:

original: thabs chen rnams dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: thabs chen rnams dang ldan pa la //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, endowed with the great means,

original: nyon mongs byang chub lan lag 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs byang chub lan lag 'gyur //
translated: Afflictions are the limbs of enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba'ang zhi ba'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: 'khor ba'ang zhi ba'i bdag nyid de //
translated: Cyclic existence is the nature of peace.

original: de phyir de bzhin gshegs bsam yas //
analyzed: de phyir de bzhin gshegs bsam yas //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata is inconceivable.

original: she'o // sa bcu rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu go rims bzhin du lhag par che ba yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa go rims bzhin du spong bar mngon no //
analyzed: she'o // sa bcu rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu go rims bzhin du lhag par che ba yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa go rims bzhin du spong bar mngon no //
translated: It is evident that the resistances to the transcendences, such as stinginess, are relinquished in sequence on the ten stages, because it is said that the ten transcendences are preeminent on the ten stages in sequence.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa gzhan yang sgrib na ci'i phyir sa rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa kho na sgrib par bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa gzhan yang sgrib na ci'i phyir sa rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa kho na sgrib par bshad ce na /
translated: If other afflictions are obscurations, why is only nonafflictive ignorance said to be an obscuration on the ten stages?

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not common.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i gegs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i gegs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: That is, it is only for the bodhisattvas that it becomes an obstacle to attaining nirvana.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not so for the sravakas, etc.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la de yod kyang grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la de yod kyang grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: For, although sravakas and pratyekabuddhas have it, they are liberated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ma yin pas de'i phyir thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ma yin pas de'i phyir thun mong ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so for bodhisattvas, therefore it is not common.

original: de sa rnams la sgrib par bshad kyang /
analyzed: de sa rnams la sgrib par bshad kyang /
translated: Although it is explained as an obstruction to the stages,

original: sa rnams la sgrib pa de kho nar ma zad de /
analyzed: sa rnams la sgrib pa de kho nar ma zad de /
translated: it is not only an obstruction to the stages.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dra bas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams la de'i sgrib par gzhag pa yang med bkag pa yang med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dra bas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams la de'i sgrib par gzhag pa yang med bkag pa yang med de /
translated: Since afflicted ignorance is similar for sravakas and so on and bodhisattvas, it is not posited as an obstruction to the bodhisattva stages and it is not refuted,

original: de ma bshad kyang sgrib pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma bshad kyang sgrib pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: for it is not explained as an obstruction to the bodhisattva stages, but it is not that it does not stop them.

original: gzhan na re nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dra bas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni sa rnams la sgrib pa khyad par du bshad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan na re nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dra bas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni sa rnams la sgrib pa khyad par du bshad kyi /
translated: Others say: Nonafflicted ignorance is similar for sravakas and so on and bodhisattvas and is explained as an obstruction to the stages,

original: nyon mongs pa ni zhar la yod pas ma smos so zhes zer te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zhar la yod pas ma smos so zhes zer te /
translated: but since affliction is incidental, it is not mentioned.

original: nyon mongs pa yang nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dra ba nyid yin pas de zhar la yod ces bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dra ba nyid yin pas de zhar la yod ces bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Moreover, the afflictions are the same for the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on and for the bodhisattvas, so it is not correct to say that they are incidental.

original: gzhan na res rnams kyi mi shes pa'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yin yang thar pa la gegs mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan na res rnams kyi mi shes pa'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yin yang thar pa la gegs mi byed de /
translated: Others say: The obscurations to omniscience of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are the nonafflicted ignorance of the bodhisattvas, but they do not obstruct liberation.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos dag la sa rnams la mi shes pa yod bzhin du rnam par 'grol lo //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni mya ngan las @238a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos dag la sa rnams la mi shes pa yod bzhin du rnam par 'grol lo // byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni mya ngan las @238a * //
translated: Thus the ≈õrƒÅvakas are liberated despite having ignorance of the levels.

original: 'das pa thob par bya ba la gegs kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'das pa thob par bya ba la gegs kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can no zhe'o //
translated: But for bodhisattvas, it is an affliction because it is the cause that obstructs attaining nirvana.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩnyon mongs can min sgrib pa bcu //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te / nyon mongs can min sgrib pa bcu //
translated: That is not so,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because it is explained that there are ten obscurations that are not afflictions.

original: sa dang po la ni chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i don du rtogs te zhes bya ba de la ;
analyzed: sa dang po la ni chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i don du rtogs te zhes bya ba de la ;
translated: On the first level, the reality of the realm of phenomena is realized as omnipresent.

original: sa dang po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'khor ba dang bcas pa dang po ba ste /
analyzed: sa dang po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'khor ba dang bcas pa dang po ba ste /
translated: The first stage is the first supramundane wisdom together with its retinue.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the path of seeing.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni stong pa nyid de /
