analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is emptiness.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid pas gcig la ji lta bar thams cad la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid pas gcig la ji lta bar thams cad la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Since it is the general characteristic, just as it is in one, so it is in all.

original: thams cad du song bas kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad du song bas kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is omnipresent because it pervades everything.üîΩAs is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ma rtogs par //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ma rtogs par //
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is not realized

original: 'di ltar chos ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos ni yod ma yin //
translated: In this way, the dharma does not exist.

original: zhes 'byung ba ni chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i khungs yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba ni chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i khungs yin no //
translated: This is the source for the omnipresence of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: rtogs zhes bya ba ni mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
analyzed: rtogs zhes bya ba ni mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
translated: ‚ÄúRealized‚Äù means ‚Äúactualized.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa des bdag gang yin pa de gzhan la /
analyzed: rtogs pa des bdag gang yin pa de gzhan la /
translated: The self that is realized by that realization is different from the self that is imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: gzhan gang yin pa de bdag go zhes bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas gzhan dang bdag gis stong pa nyid tha dad par ma mthong bas bdag dang gzhan du bye brag gis rlom sems su med do //
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa de bdag go zhes bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas gzhan dang bdag gis stong pa nyid tha dad par ma mthong bas bdag dang gzhan du bye brag gis rlom sems su med do //
translated: Having attained the sameness of self and other, he does not conceive of self and other as different, since he does not see emptiness as different in self and other.

original: de'i phyir de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of generosity is preeminent in him.

original: de'i phyir 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva engages in the welfare of others as he does in his own welfare.

original: 'di ni rtogs pa dang gnyen po dang gnyen po'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtogs pa dang gnyen po dang gnyen po'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the realization, the antidote, and the result of the antidote.

original: de gsum ni sa gzhan dag tu yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de gsum ni sa gzhan dag tu yang shes par bya'o //
translated: These three should be understood in the other stages as well.

original: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du ste /
translated: In the second, he engages in the welfare of others for the sake of the supreme.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He realizes the dharma-element, because he sees it as naturally luminous.

original: des de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks this:

original: de lta bas na sgrub du mtshungs pa la bdag gis rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyong ba mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o snyam mo zhes lung las bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgrub du mtshungs pa la bdag gis rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyong ba mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o snyam mo zhes lung las bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since the practice is the same, I will strive to accomplish the thorough purification of all aspects.üîΩAnd a sutra also says,

original: mdo las kyang 'di skad ces de bas na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag shes rab kyi rnam par yongs su bsgoms na nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'di skad ces de bas na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag shes rab kyi rnam par yongs su bsgoms na nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if you thoroughly cultivate the path of the ten virtuous actions with wisdom, you will attain the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de bas gong du yongs su sbyangs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas gong du yongs su sbyangs pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you thoroughly cultivate it more than that, you will attain the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bas gong du yongs su sbyangs @238b pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa dang / spyod pa rgyas pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas gong du yongs su sbyangs @238b pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa dang / spyod pa rgyas pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you thoroughly cultivate it more than that, you will attain the purification of the stages of the bodhisattva, the purification of the perfections, and the expansion of your practice.

original: de bas gong du yongs su dag pas stobs bcu'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas gong du yongs su dag pas stobs bcu'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you thoroughly cultivate it more than that, you will attain the ten powers.

original: de lta bas na bsgrub tu mtshungs pa la bdag gis zhes rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsgrub tu mtshungs pa la bdag gis zhes rgya cher bshad do //
translated: Thus, in the same way that one is to be accomplished, I am, etc.

original: gang gis 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: By whom is it thought in this way?

original: sa gnyis pa la de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: On the second stage, it is said, Therefore, etc.

original: de bas na gnyis pa la mchog gi don du rab tu rtogs par mngon no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis pa la mchog gi don du rab tu rtogs par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, on the second stage, the supreme meaning is realized.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa ni 'bad pa'am bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa ni 'bad pa'am bya ba'o //
translated: Accomplishment is effort or action.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang ba ni chos kyi dbyings la nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rmongs pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang ba ni chos kyi dbyings la nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rmongs pa sel ba'o //
translated: Total purification in every way is the removal of defiled and undefiled delusion in the Dharma-element.

original: de bas na sa de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, on that stage, the perfection of morality is especially advanced,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don la smon pas bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa'i snod du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don la smon pas bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa'i snod du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one becomes a very pure vessel by the aspiration for the supreme meaning.

original: gsum pa la ni de'i rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu rtogs te /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni de'i rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu rtogs te /
translated: On the third stage, the supreme meaning is realized as the natural outcome of that.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang gis chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa mdo la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro // 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang gis chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa mdo la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs word is distinguished by its realization of the ultimate realm.üîΩThus, the ultimate realm is called the ‚Äúpurified realm of the Dharma body.‚Äù It is the cause of the Dharma body, because the Dharma, such as the scriptures of the sutras, etc., arises from the power of the ultimate realm.

original: chos kyi dbyings mchog yin pas de'i rgyu mthun pas bstan pa'i chos kyang mchog yin pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag par bya ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mchog yin pas de'i rgyu mthun pas bstan pa'i chos kyang mchog yin pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag par bya ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma that is taught is the supreme cause of the purification of the ultimate realm.

original: des chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa mchog tu rig nas shes pa rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: des chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa mchog tu rig nas shes pa rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Having understood that the hearing of the ultimate realm is supreme, the knowledge of the bodhisattvas increases greatly.

original: des zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the realization of the ultimate realm.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos thos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHearing‚Äù means hearing the Dharma of the sutras, etc.

original: de la mchog tu rig nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin du so sor rang gis shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la mchog tu rig nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin du so sor rang gis shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having understood that to be supreme means that nonconceptual wisdom understands it to be just so, that is, by means of individual knowledge.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung mnyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of listening to the Buddha‚Äôs speech.

original: me'i 'obs stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam du yang bdag nyid mchong zhes bya ba ni mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: me'i 'obs stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam du yang bdag nyid mchong zhes bya ba ni mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: Even if it were a fire pit the size of the great trichiliocosm, I would jump into it means as stated in the sutra:

original: gal te la la zhig de la 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: gal te la la zhig de la 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: If someone were to say to me:

original: gal te khyod me'i 'obs chen po 'bar ba /
analyzed: gal te khyod me'i 'obs chen po 'bar ba /
translated: If you jump into this great blazing fire pit,

original: kun du 'bar ba /üîΩkun @239a * //
analyzed: kun du 'bar ba / kun @239a * //
translated: completely ablaze,

original: du rab tu mched cing 'bar ba /
analyzed: du rab tu mched cing 'bar ba /
translated: completely burning,üîΩa single tongue of flame,üîΩand experience great suffering,üîΩI would say to them:

original: me lce gcig tu gyur pa'i nang du bdag rab tu mchong zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ba rang gi lus kyis nyams su len na ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems
analyzed: me lce gcig tu gyur pa'i nang du bdag rab tu mchong zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ba rang gi lus kyis nyams su len na ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems
translated: I will give you the words of the Dharma taught by the perfect Buddha, the bodhisattva‚Äôs

original: dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba 'di bshad par bya'o zhe na yang de 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩyang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa /
analyzed: dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba 'di bshad par bya'o zhe na yang de 'di snyam du sems te / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa /
translated: If he were to think, ‚ÄúI will explain this purification of the bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life,‚ÄùüîΩhe would think, ‚ÄúFor the sake of a single word of the Dharma that is the teaching of the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mas rab tu gang bar tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag dor bar mos na me'i 'obs tha mal bar bdag
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mas rab tu gang bar tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag dor bar mos na me'i 'obs tha mal bar bdag
translated: which is a purification of the bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life, I would throw myself from the Brahma world into a great trichiliocosm filled with fire,

original: dor ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: dor ba lta ci smos /
translated: let alone into an ordinary pit of fire.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab kyang bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad btsal bar bya na /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab kyang bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad btsal bar bya na /
translated: I would undergo all the sufferings of the hells in order to seek all the qualities of the Buddha,

original: mi'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta ci smos kyi snyam nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta ci smos kyi snyam nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: let alone the sufferings of human beings.‚Äù

original: de bas na sa de la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa de la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, on this ground, the perfection of patience is preeminent.

original: thos pa'i ched du nyon mongs pa thams cad la mi 'byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbzhi pa la ni yongs su gzung ba med pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: thos pa'i ched du nyon mongs pa thams cad la mi 'byed pa'i phyir ro // bzhi pa la ni yongs su gzung ba med pa'i don du ste /
translated: because it is not divided into different kinds of afflictions in order to hear the Dharma.

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: On the fourth, the Dharma-element is fully understood as being without appropriation.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwithout appropriation‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: sa bzhi ba la la ni mnyam pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings bdag gi ba med par rab tu rtogs te /
analyzed: sa bzhi ba la la ni mnyam pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings bdag gi ba med par rab tu rtogs te /
translated: On the fourth stage, the Dharma-element is fully understood as being without appropriation because of its equality.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la bdag gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la bdag gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in the Dharma-element there is no appropriation of anything at all.

original: yang na phyin ci log thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir su'i yongs su bzung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na phyin ci log thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir su'i yongs su bzung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Or, it is not appropriated by anyone because it is not the object of any error.

original: bdag nyid kyis phyin ci log ma yin pas 'di la yongs su bzung ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis phyin ci log ma yin pas 'di la yongs su bzung ba gang yang med de /
translated: Since it is not erroneous by nature, it is not appropriated by anything at all.

original: 'di ltar chos la sred pa yang ldog go zhes lung las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos la sred pa yang ldog go zhes lung las 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, craving for the Dharma is also stopped.

original: de ltar 'od 'phro ba can ni spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings khong du chud pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'od 'phro ba can ni spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings khong du chud pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thob ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, having attained the factors of enlightenment because he has penetrated the realm of nonconceptual intuition,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos la sred pa snga nas yod pa gang yin pa de yang ldog go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos la sred pa snga nas yod pa gang yin pa de yang ldog go //
translated: reverses the former craving for the Dharma of the sutras, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ni chos la sred pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ni chos la sred pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say that the craving for the Dharma is meditative concentration, meditative absorption, and meditative trance.

original: de bas na sa de la brtson 'grus kyi pha @239b rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa de la brtson 'grus kyi pha @239b rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, on this spiritual level the perfection of effort is preeminent,üîΩbecause he constantly abides in the factors of enlightenment, transcending the conduct of body, speech, and mind.üîΩOn the fifth, the bodhisattva reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the continuum of self and others.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa las 'das par rgyun du byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa las 'das par rgyun du byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the sixth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the universal vehicle.üîΩOn the seventh, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the three turnings of the wheel of the Dharma.üîΩOn the eighth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the ten universal virtues.üîΩOn the ninth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the four summaries of the Dharma.üîΩOn the tenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the twelve branches of the scriptures.üîΩOn the eleventh, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the ten powers, etc.üîΩOn the twelfth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the ten universal virtues.üîΩOn the thirteenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the four summaries of the Dharma.üîΩOn the fourteenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
translated: On the fifteenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the ten powers, etc.üîΩOn the sixteenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the ten universal virtues.üîΩOn the seventeenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondifferentiation of the Dharma of the four summaries of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: On the eighteenth, he reverses the craving for the Dharma, because he realizes the nondiffer

original: 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad nang dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud rnams dang bdag tha mi dad cing mtshungs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad nang dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud rnams dang bdag tha mi dad cing mtshungs par mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, and the continuums of the Bodhisattvas, are not different from himself and are the same.

original: sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcus zhes bya ba ni lung gis ston te //
analyzed: sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcus zhes bya ba ni lung gis ston te //
translated: The ten equalities of thought and intention are taught by the scriptures.

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: The equality of intention regarding the purity of the qualities of the Buddhas of the past, the equality of intention regarding the purity of the qualities of the Buddhas of the future, and the equality of intention regarding the purity of the qualities of the Buddhas of the present.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can rnam par dag pas bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang the tshom dang yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa sel bas rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can rnam par dag pas bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang the tshom dang yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa sel bas rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: The sameness of intention in the purity of discipline, the sameness of intention in the purity of beings, the sameness of intention in the purity of dispelling views, doubts, uncertainty, and regret,

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad gong nas gong du rnam par 'jig pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad gong nas gong du rnam par 'jig pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the sameness of intention in the purity of knowing the path and what is not the path, the sameness of intention in the purity of knowing the path, the sameness of intention in the purity of the progressive destruction of all the factors of awakening,

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: and the sameness of intention in the purity of ripening all beings.

original: mnyam pa nyid 'di dag gis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud tha mi dad par rab tu rtogs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid 'di dag gis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud tha mi dad par rab tu rtogs te /
translated: Through these samenesses, all the continuums of all buddhas are realized to be undifferentiated.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma Body, whose characteristic is the transformation of the consciousness that is the storehouse of all the seeds, is not different from it.

original: de bas nas de la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas nas de la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of meditative absorption is preeminent in it.

original: don dam par bden pa'i rnam par bsgoms pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par bden pa'i rnam par bsgoms pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the frequent cultivation of the truth in the ultimate sense.

original: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i don du ste /
translated: In the sixth, it is in the sense of being neither afflicted nor purified.

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is: because the realm of the Dharma is fully understood.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de la glo bur du 'byung ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de la glo bur du 'byung ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
translated: The characteristic of affliction in dependent origination is not naturally afflicted because it occurs adventitiously in it.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par @240a * //üîΩ'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par @240a * //üîΩ'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not purified because it is naturally pure.

original: de ltar rang gis rig pa'i tshul gyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes lung de nyid las ston te /üîΩrten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar rang gis rig pa'i tshul gyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes lung de nyid las ston te / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Thus, by the mode of one's own awareness, the nonconceptual intuition thoroughly realizes the reality realm.üîΩThis is taught in that very scripture.

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i chos de gang yang med par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i chos de gang yang med par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it thoroughly realizes that there is no dharma whatsoever in dependent origination that is defiled orüîΩpurified.

original: sa drug pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par rtogs te /üîΩchos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir de la yang chos gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam par rtogs te / chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir de la yang chos gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: On the sixth stage, the bodhisattva thoroughly realizes dependent origination.

original: rnam par byang ba med par rtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med par rtogs so //
translated: Because the reality realm is naturally radiant, he realizes that there is no dharma there that is defiled orüîΩpurified.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Because the members of dependent origination are merely the defilement aspect.

original: rnam par dag par kun du rtogs pa de la gtogs par bdag gam bdag gi med do //
analyzed: rnam par dag par kun du rtogs pa de la gtogs par bdag gam bdag gi med do //
translated: In that realization of purity, there is no self or possession of a self.

original: de'i phyir sa de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sa de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te ;
translated: Therefore, on that ground, the perfection of wisdom is especially great,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa med pa'i don du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba za ba mo khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa med pa'i don du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba za ba mo khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the understanding of the dependent origination of the meaning of the absence of defilement and purity.

original: bdun pa la ni tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
translated: On the seventh, it is the meaning of non-differentiation,

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: as it is connected with the realization of the realm of phenomena.

original: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma thams cad mi 'byung bas zil gyis non te /
analyzed: sa de la byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma thams cad mi 'byung bas zil gyis non te /
translated: On that ground, the bodhisattva is overwhelmed by the non-arising of all signs,

original: mtshan ma 'byung ba'i sgo nas tha dad pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma 'byung ba'i sgo nas tha dad pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because differentiation arises through the arising of signs.

original: de bas na mtshan ma med pa'i phyir bdun pa la tha dad pa med pa'i don du rab tu rtogs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan ma med pa'i phyir bdun pa la tha dad pa med pa'i don du rab tu rtogs so zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that on the seventh, the meaning of non-differentiation is realized due to the absence of signs.

original: don de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that meaning, he says, because of signlessness, the characteristics of the Dharma such as the s≈´tras do not occur as different.

original: sa drug pa'i bar du ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma gang gis chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa de dag shugs kyis de la 'jug pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pa gnyis kyis tha dad pa nyid du mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa drug pa'i bar du ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma gang gis chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa de dag shugs kyis de la 'jug pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pa gnyis kyis tha dad pa nyid du mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Up to the sixth spiritual level, the signs of the Dharma such as the s≈´tras through which one enters into the dharmadhƒÅtu, manifest as different through the two, namely, the direct intuition that enters into it and the subsequent direct intuition.

original: sa bdun pa la ni mtshan thams cad ro gcig pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings mtshan ma med par rab tu rtogs pa mtshan ma de dag mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bdun pa la ni mtshan thams cad ro gcig pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings mtshan ma med par rab tu rtogs pa mtshan ma de dag mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But on the seventh spiritual level, the signs of the dharmadhƒÅtu do not occur because of the full understanding of the signlessness of the dharmadhƒÅtu through the direct intuition that has the aspect of the sameness of all signs.

original: de'i phyir sa de la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa de la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Consequently, on this spiritual level, the perfection of skill in means is exceedingly great.üîΩThus, he fully understands the signlessness of all signs,

original: 'di ltar mtshan ma thams cad ma med pa nyid du yang rab tu rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan ma thams cad ma med pa nyid du yang rab tu rtogs la /
translated: and yet

original: mtshan mar byas pa'i tha @240b snyad kyang mi 'gog ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar byas pa'i tha @240b snyad kyang mi 'gog ste /
translated: Nor does it refute the conventional designation that is made on the basis of signs,

original: de rab rtogs pas kyang de nyid la dbang byed pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rab rtogs pas kyang de nyid la dbang byed pa rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the one who has fully understood that attains mastery over that suchness.

original: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing 'phel ba med pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing 'phel ba med pa'i don du ste /
translated: In the eighth, it is in the sense of no decrease and no increase,

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and it is to be supplied with ‚Äúfully understands the dharma-element.‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir dri ma dang bcas pa dang ; dri ma med pa'i dus na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir dri ma dang bcas pa dang ; dri ma med pa'i dus na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the dharma-element is pure by nature, it is without distinction whether it is associated with defilement or is stainless.

original: de bas na rtag tu de bzhin kho na bas de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //üîΩmtshan ma dang bral ba na gang la yang bri ba yang med la /
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu de bzhin kho na bas de bzhin nyid ces bya'o // mtshan ma dang bral ba na gang la yang bri ba yang med la /
translated: Therefore, it is always just as it is, and so it is called ‚Äúsuchness.‚ÄùüîΩWhen it is free from signs, there is no decrease of anything whatsoever.

original: mtshan ma yod pa na yang gang la yang 'phel ba yang med do //
analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa na yang gang la yang 'phel ba yang med do //
translated: And when signs are present, there is no increase of anything whatsoever.

original: la lan re 'di ltar mtshan ma nyid mtshan ma med pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: la lan re 'di ltar mtshan ma nyid mtshan ma med pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that in this way, signs themselves are signlessness.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here is the reason:

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because he has attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings la bri ba med pa dang / lhag ma med pa nyid du de ltar rab tu rtogs so //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa ni bri ba med pa'am //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings la bri ba med pa dang / lhag ma med pa nyid du de ltar rab tu rtogs so // kun nas nyon mongs pa ni bri ba med pa'am //
translated: On the eighth stage, the bodhisattva, having attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn, realizes the realm of phenomena to be without decrease and without remainder.üîΩThere is no phenomenon that decreases due to affliction,

original: rnam par byang bas na 'phel ba'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas na 'phel ba'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: or increases due to purification.

original: sngon med pa'i chos mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i chos mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a non-existent phenomenon does not arise.

original: dbang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of mastery:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba'o //
translated: mastery over non-conceptuality, mastery over the pure field, mastery over wisdom, and mastery over karma.

original: de la lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma thams cad mi 'byung bas chos kyi dbyings ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma thams cad mi 'byung bas chos kyi dbyings ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas su rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the realm of phenomena should be known as the basis for mastery over non-conceptual wisdom, because all signs do not arise spontaneously.

original: bdun pa yang mtshan ma mi 'byung ba yod mod kyi //
analyzed: bdun pa yang mtshan ma mi 'byung ba yod mod kyi //
translated: There is indeed no appearance of signs in the seventh stage,

original: mngon par 'du byed pas yin gyi //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas yin gyi //
translated: but that is due to the formation of the will to action.

original: 'dir ni lhun gyi grub pa yin pas bye brag yod do /
analyzed: 'dir ni lhun gyi grub pa yin pas bye brag yod do /
translated: But here it is spontaneous, so there is a difference.

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun du bstan pa'i mthu brnyes pas chos kyi dbyings ni zhing yongs su dag la dbang ba'i gnas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun du bstan pa'i mthu brnyes pas chos kyi dbyings ni zhing yongs su dag la dbang ba'i gnas su rig par bya'o //
translated: The stage of the Dharma Cloud is the basis of power over the pure land, because one obtains the power to manifest the circle of the assembly and the Buddha land as one wishes.

original: de bas na sa de la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa de la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of vows is preeminent in that stage,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang bzhin la dbang ba thob pas dge ba la bar chad med par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang bzhin la dbang ba thob pas dge ba la bar chad med par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is uninterruptedly engaged in virtue by obtaining power over the nonconceptual intuition.

original: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du ste /
analyzed: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du ste /
translated: The ninth stage is the basis of power over intuition.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúrealizes the Dharma realm‚Äù is supplied.

original: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas te /
translated: The ninth stage is the basis of power over intuition.

original: rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir so so yang dag par rig @241a * //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na / de'i phyir so so yang dag par rig @241a * //
translated: How is it known that one realizes it well?

original: pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause one attains the analytical knowledges.üîΩ‚Äù

original: sa 'di la chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gzhan dag gis mi 'jigs pa rab tu thob po //
analyzed: sa 'di la chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gzhan dag gis mi 'jigs pa rab tu thob po //
translated: On this ground, one attains fearlessness through the other analytical knowledges of Dharma, meaning, etymological interpretation, and ready speech.

original: de bas na 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas te /
translated: Therefore, here it is understood that the realm of Dharma is the basis of mastery of wisdom.

original: rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs so zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: It is understood that one realizes it well.

original: de'i phyir sa de la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa de la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, on this ground, the perfection of power is preeminent,

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the special power of wisdom.

original: sa bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du rtogs so //
translated: On the tenth ground, one realizes the basis of mastery of action.

original: de ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is that known?üîΩTherefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause one acts for the welfare of sentient beings through emanations as one wishes.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he acts for the sake of sentient beings by means of emanations, as he wishes.üîΩ

original: 'di ni sa bcu pa la chos kyi dbyings las la dbang ba'i gnas su rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ni sa bcu pa la chos kyi dbyings las la dbang ba'i gnas su rab tu rtogs so //
translated: This is fully understood on the tenth spiritual level, the Cloud of Dharma, as the state of mastery of the realm of the Dharma.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las rnams la dbang byed pa rab tu brnyes te /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las rnams la dbang byed pa rab tu brnyes te /
translated: Thereby, he attains mastery of the activities of the Tathagata.

original: 'di ltar bde bar gshegs pa bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa na gnas pa'i sems can dag la sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gang la ji ltar gang gi tshe gang bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde bar gshegs pa bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa na gnas pa'i sems can dag la sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gang la ji ltar gang gi tshe gang bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, he acts in whatever way is necessary for the sentient beings who are to be trained, by means of emanations in whatever way is appropriate for them, at whatever time is appropriate, just as the Sugata does.

original: de ltar de'i tshe de mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar de'i tshe de mdzad do //
translated: Thus, at that time, he acts in that way.

original: de bas na sa 'di la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa 'di la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, on this spiritual level, the perfection of wisdom is preeminent,

original: chos la longs spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la longs spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the special quality of the enjoyment of Dharma and the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ji skad du bshad pa de dag la chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu rab tu rtogs pa rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang ba la gegs su gyur pa /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ji skad du bshad pa de dag la chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu rab tu rtogs pa rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang ba la gegs su gyur pa /
translated: Thus, the ten bodhisattva stages are presented as antidotes to the ten kinds of obscurations to the realization of the ten aspects of the ultimate realm, which are to be purified in all respects.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pas re re la yang sgrib pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pas re re la yang sgrib pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Each of the ten bodhisattva stages is presented as an antidote to a particular obscuration, an obscuration that is an undefiled nescience that obstructs the purification of the ten aspects of the ultimate realm.

original: sa dgu pa dang sa bcu pa dag gi khyad par ni 'bras bus bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sa dgu pa dang sa bcu pa dag gi khyad par ni 'bras bus bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The difference between the ninth and tenth stages is shown by their fruits,

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa rab tu rtog pa'i khyad par gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa rab tu rtog pa'i khyad par gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by a difference in the realization of the different objective supports,

original: gnas pa cir yang dpyad du med pa'i gnas su phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa cir yang dpyad du med pa'i gnas su phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has arrived at the state in which one cannot analyze anything.

original: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du rtogs pa'i dgongs pa ni sa cu rnams su pha rol tu phyin pa bcu go rims bzhin du khyad par du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du rtogs pa'i dgongs pa ni sa cu rnams su pha rol tu phyin pa bcu go rims bzhin du khyad par du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The intention to realize the meaning of the universal vehicle, etc., is the progress in the ten perfections on the ten stages.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad @241b ces sa la sgrib pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams khyad par du 'gro ba la sgrib pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad @241b ces sa la sgrib pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams khyad par du 'gro ba la sgrib pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThe obscurations to the spiritual levels are the obscurations to the progress of the perfections.‚Äù

original: yang na mdo las ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog rnams kyi ye shes kyi mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu gsung pa nyid kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du rab tu rtogs
analyzed: yang na mdo las ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog rnams kyi ye shes kyi mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu gsung pa nyid kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i don du rab tu rtogs
translated: Alternatively, the ultimate result of the wisdom of the superior ones who are progressively superior through the attainment of a hundred meditative concentrations and so on is proclaimed in the s≈´tras as the universal and so on.

original: pa'i dgongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i dgongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the intention of the s≈´tras.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa du ma gong du ma bshad pa thams cad ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa du ma gong du ma bshad pa thams cad ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mdor bsdu na /
translated: In order to demonstrate that all the many types of obscurations that have not been explained above are included within the two obscurations, it is said:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa nyid du bstan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa nyid du bstan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In brief, the obscurations are taught as being the afflictive and the cognitive.

original: mdor bsdu na gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gnyis kho na ste /
translated: In brief, there are only two,

original: gsum du med do zhes bya ba de ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: gsum du med do zhes bya ba de ci mngon zhe na /
translated: there are not three. What is the evidence for this?

original: de'i phyir / der ni sgrib pa thams cad de //
analyzed: de'i phyir / der ni sgrib pa thams cad de //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: All obscurations are included in those.

original: nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúare included in those‚Äù is a verbal ellipsis.

original: sgrib pa thams cad sgrib pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pas gsum pa gzhan med par mngon no //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad sgrib pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pas gsum pa gzhan med par mngon no //
translated: Since all obscurations are included in the two obscurations, it is clear that there is no third type of obscuration.

original: gang gi phyir sgrib pa thams cad 'di nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa de'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad sdud pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di zad na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrib pa thams cad 'di nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa de'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad sdud pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di zad na /
translated: Since all obscurations are included in these two, it is maintained that when the two types of obscurations‚Äîthe afflictive and the knowledge‚Äîare eliminated,

original: sgrib pa thams cad las grol bar 'dod de /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las grol bar 'dod de /
translated: one is liberated from all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa thams cad spong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúeliminating all obscurations.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa ma bshad par de nyid kyi nang du 'dus par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa ma bshad par de nyid kyi nang du 'dus par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Since the obscurations to the buddha stage are not mentioned, how can they be included in those two?

original: brjod pas de'i nang du gtogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pas de'i nang du gtogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not included by being mentioned,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dus so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dus so //
translated: but they are included by nature.

original: de lta mod kyi khyab pa'i sgrib pa bshad pa'i phyir de nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi khyab pa'i sgrib pa bshad pa'i phyir de nyid bshad zin to //
translated: However, in order to explain the obscuration of the universal, it is explained in that way.

original: gzhan du na ni nyi tshe ba'i sgrib pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni nyi tshe ba'i sgrib pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be a limited obscuration.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa bsdu ba'i don du /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa bsdu ba'i don du /
translated: Or, in order to include the obscurations of the Buddha ground,üîΩit is said:

original: der ni sgrib pa thams cad de //üîΩce zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: der ni sgrib pa thams cad de // ce zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
translated: All obscurations there

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: are said to be liberated upon exhaustion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa ma zad par grol ba med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa ma zad par grol ba med de /
translated: There is no liberation without exhausting the obscurations of the Buddha ground.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa lhag ma ltar de'i sgrib pa yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa lhag ma ltar de'i sgrib pa yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the remaining obscurations, its obscurations are also taught.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa rab tu phra ba'i gnas skabs dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa rab tu phra ba'i gnas skabs dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Non-afflicted ignorance in the subtle stage and the latent tendencies of afflictions are called the obscurations of the Buddha ground.

original: de bas na shin tu phra ba'i phyir gzhan du brtag mi nus pas de skad ces bshad @242a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na shin tu phra ba'i phyir gzhan du brtag mi nus pas de skad ces bshad @242a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is extremely subtle, it cannot be conceived elsewhere, so it is explained in that way.

original: sgrib pa chen po ni khyab pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa chen po ni khyab pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The great obscuration is the all-pervading.

original: sgrib pa chung ngu ni nyi tshe ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib pa chung ngu ni nyi tshe ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
translated: The small obscuration is the limited.

original: sbyor ba'i sgrib pa ni lhag ma gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa de dag nyid kyi ste /üîΩdes sbyor ba nyid mi 'thob po //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgrib pa ni lhag ma gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa de dag nyid kyi ste / des sbyor ba nyid mi 'thob po //
translated: The obscuration to application is the remainder.üîΩThe obscuration to attainment is the equal.

original: 'thob pa la sgrib pa ni mnyam pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni cha mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi ste ;
analyzed: 'thob pa la sgrib pa ni mnyam pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni cha mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi ste ;
translated: The obscuration to special attainment is the taking up and rejection.üîΩThe obscuration to the enjoyment of Dharma is the enjoyment of Dharma.

original: de 'thob pa'i bgegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i bgegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The obscuration to the activity of Dharma is the activity of Dharma.üîΩThe obscuration to the knowledge of all things is the knowledge of all things.üîΩThe great obscuration is the all-pervading.üîΩThe small obscuration is the limited.üîΩThe obscuration to application is the remainder.üîΩThe obscuration to attainment is the equal.

original: thob pa khyad par can la sgrib pa ni len pa dang spong ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thob pa khyad par can la sgrib pa ni len pa dang spong ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The obscuration to special attainment is the taking up and rejection.üîΩThe obscuration to the enjoyment of Dharma is the enjoyment of Dharma.üîΩThe obscuration to the activity of Dharma is the activity of Dharma.üîΩThe obscuration to the knowledge of all things is the knowledge of all things.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi ste /
translated: For those who possess the lineage of the bodhisattva,

original: thob par bya ba khyad par can la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba khyad par can la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an obscuration to the special object that is to be attained.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob par bya ba khyad par can te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni thob par bya ba khyad par can te /
translated: Non-abiding nirvana is the special object that is to be attained.

original: de nyid 'bras bu'i khyad par du yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu'i khyad par du yang rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is also a special result.üîΩThe obscuration to correct application is the nine aspects of the characteristic of affliction.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba la sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba dgu ni sgrib po zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba la sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba dgu ni sgrib po zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nine fetters are obscurations.

original: de dag yang dag par sbyor ba la ji ltar sgrib pa de bzhin du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par sbyor ba la ji ltar sgrib pa de bzhin du bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that they are obscurations to correct application in just the same way.

original: rgyu la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sogs pa rnams pa bcu la sgrib pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sogs pa rnams pa bcu la sgrib pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The obscuration to the cause is that which obscures the ten aspects such as virtue.

original: rgyu'i don gyi skabs kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la gegs byed pa'i sgo nas sgrib par 'gyur bas rgyu la sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i don gyi skabs kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa'i rgyu la gegs byed pa'i sgo nas sgrib par 'gyur bas rgyu la sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is a case of the meaning of cause, it is called an obscuration to the cause.

original: de kho na la 'jug pa la sgrib pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gis de kho na la 'jug par byed do //üîΩdge ba bla na med pa la sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na la 'jug pa la sgrib pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gis de kho na la 'jug par byed do // dge ba bla na med pa la sgrib pa ni /
translated: The obscurations to the entrance into reality are those to the factors of enlightenment.üîΩThe obscurations to the unsurpassed virtue are those to the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i bla na dge ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i bla na dge ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no virtue higher than that.

original: de khyad par du 'gro ba la sgrib pa ni sa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de khyad par du 'gro ba la sgrib pa ni sa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The obscurations to the progress to excellence are those to the spiritual levels.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khyad par gyi gnas su gyur pa ni sa rnams zhes bya'o //üîΩbsdus pa'i sgrib pa ni mdor bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes @242b bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khyad par gyi gnas su gyur pa ni sa rnams zhes bya'o // bsdus pa'i sgrib pa ni mdor bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes @242b bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The perfections themselves are called spiritual levels because they are the bases of the excellence that transcends the mundane.üîΩThe obscurations to the summary are those to the two summaries.

original: de dag gis sgrib pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sgrib pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all obscurations are included in the obscurations that consist in the afflictions and the knowable.

original: des bde blag tu len pa dang / 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir don bsdus pa bshad do //
analyzed: des bde blag tu len pa dang / 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir don bsdus pa bshad do //
translated: The summary is stated in order to easily take up and retain that.

original: bsdu ba byas pas bde blag tu len to //
analyzed: bsdu ba byas pas bde blag tu len to //
translated: One easily takes up and retains by way of the summary.

original: 'dzin to // bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las sgrib pa'i le'ur bcad pa ste gnyis pa'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: 'dzin to // bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las sgrib pa'i le'ur bcad pa ste gnyis pa'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the second chapter, the chapter on obscurations, in the Treatise on Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes.

original: // / sgrib pa bshad pa'i 'og tu de kho na bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: // / sgrib pa bshad pa'i 'og tu de kho na bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: After explaining obscurations, the section on explaining reality follows,

original: de'i 'og tu smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mentioned next.

original: de bas na de kho na'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na de kho na'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is stated with reference to reality.

original: de kho na yang rnam pa du ma yod de /
analyzed: de kho na yang rnam pa du ma yod de /
translated: Reality also has many aspects,

original: de'i phyir de'i dbye ba khong du ma chud par de kho na'i rang gi ngo bo khong du chud par dka' bas de'i phyir de kho na'i dbye ba nyid dang por bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbye ba khong du ma chud par de kho na'i rang gi ngo bo khong du chud par dka' bas de'i phyir de kho na'i dbye ba nyid dang por bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: so, without understanding its divisions, it is difficult to understand the nature of reality itself. Therefore, in order to first teach the divisions of reality,

original: rtsa ba mtshan nyid de kho na //
analyzed: rtsa ba mtshan nyid de kho na //
translated: the root text states: The characteristics of reality

original: zhes de kho na bcu rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes de kho na bcu rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: are extensively taught as the ten realities.

original: kha cig na re rtsa ba'i de kho na de la de kho na gzhan 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re rtsa ba'i de kho na de la de kho na gzhan 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: Some say: The basic reality is explained in order to show that the other realities are included in it.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na la yongs su shes par byed pa dang spong ba dang mngon sum du byed pa la zhugs pa'i nyes pa gzhom pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na la yongs su shes par byed pa dang spong ba dang mngon sum du byed pa la zhugs pa'i nyes pa gzhom pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi de kho na bshad do //
translated: The reality of characteristics is explained in order to overcome the faults of those who have entered the path of thorough understanding, abandonment and realization in basic reality.

original: 'khor ba la skyo bar bya ba'i thabs rab tu bstan pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba la skyo bar bya ba'i thabs rab tu bstan pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The reality of non-error is explained in order to teach the method of becoming disenchanted with samsara.

original: skyo nas nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: skyo nas nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The reality of result and cause is explained in order to teach the renunciation of the sravaka vehicle after becoming disenchanted.

original: nyan thos ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rab tu rtogs pa dang / bsgom pa gnyis kyis nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rab tu rtogs pa dang / bsgom pa gnyis kyis nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: Sravakas are liberated by thoroughly understanding the four noble truths and by meditation.

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa bsgrub pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir rags pa'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa bsgrub pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir rags pa'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The reality of the gross is explained in order to teach the method of accomplishing the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sgrib pa thams cad spang pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir phra ba'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spang pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir phra ba'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The subtle reality is explained in order to show the means of eliminating all obscurations.

original: legs par gnas pa'i chos bstan pa'i thabs bstan pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir grags pa'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: legs par gnas pa'i chos bstan pa'i thabs bstan pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir grags pa'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The well-known reality is explained in order to show the means of teaching the well-established Dharma and the means of overcoming all adversaries.

original: chos kyi dbyings su mtshungs kyang rigs dang dbang po dang bsam pa'i bye brag gis rnam par dag pa tha dad pa bstan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na bshad do //üîΩrnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba @243a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su mtshungs kyang rigs dang dbang po dang bsam pa'i bye brag gis rnam par dag pa tha dad pa bstan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na bshad do // rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba @243a * //
translated: The reality of the domain of purity is explained in order to show the differences in purity due to the differences of lineage, faculties and thoughts, although they are the same in the dharmadhatu.

original: la 'jug pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: la 'jug pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The reality of inclusion is explained in order to show the means of engaging in complete affliction and complete purification in every way.

original: de bzhin nyid las brtsams te som nyi thams cad rnam par ldog pa'i mthu bstan pa'i phyir rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las brtsams te som nyi thams cad rnam par ldog pa'i mthu bstan pa'i phyir rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na bshad do //
translated: The reality of differentiation is explained in order to show the power of reversing all doubts beginning with suchness.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad bzlog ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad bzlog ste /
translated: It is the complete reversal of the belief in a self.

original: bdag med pa rab tu gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir mkhas pa'i de kho na bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa rab tu gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir mkhas pa'i de kho na bshad do zhe'o //
translated: The explanation of the reality of the wise is for the purpose of showing the method of establishing selflessness, having turned away from all forms of grasping at self.

original: gzhan dag na re rtsa ba'i de kho na ni byang chub sems dpa'i ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtsa ba'i de kho na ni byang chub sems dpa'i ste /
translated: Others say that the fundamental reality is for the bodhisattva,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: because it is not shared in common.

original: de kho na gnyis pa ni de nyid la log par sbyor ba'i gnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na gnyis pa ni de nyid la log par sbyor ba'i gnyen pa'o //
translated: The second reality is the antidote to incorrect engagement in that reality.

original: de kho na gsum pa ni yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na gsum pa ni yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The third reality is in accord with correct yoga.

original: de kho na bzhi ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhi ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The fourth reality is in accord with the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de kho na lnga pa ni sgrib pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de kho na lnga pa ni sgrib pa'i thabs so //
translated: The fifth reality is the method of obscuration.

original: de kho na drug pa ni 'jig rten dang thun mong ngo //
analyzed: de kho na drug pa ni 'jig rten dang thun mong ngo //
translated: The sixth reality is shared in common with the world.

original: de kho na bdun pa ni de dang thun mong pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na bdun pa ni de dang thun mong pa yin pa'o //
translated: The seventh reality is shared in common with that.

original: de kho na brgyad pa ni shes bya mdor bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na brgyad pa ni shes bya mdor bsdu ba'o //
translated: The eighth reality is the summary of objects of knowledge.

original: de kho na dgu pa ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na dgu pa ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The ninth reality is the nature.

original: de kho na bcu pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba 'joms pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de kho na bcu pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba 'joms pa'o zhe'o //
translated: The tenth reality is the destruction of the root of the afflictions.

original: mdor bsdus pa de kho na bcu po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa'i gnas su gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa de kho na bcu po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa'i gnas su gyur ba'o //
translated: These ten realities in brief are the bases of the interpretable statements of the Tathagatas.

original: rgyas par bya na de kho na dpag tu med do //
analyzed: rgyas par bya na de kho na dpag tu med do //
translated: If they are to be elaborated, they are limitless.

original: kha cig na re 'di la de kho na dang mthun pas kun rdzob kyang de kho na zhes bstan zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di la de kho na dang mthun pas kun rdzob kyang de kho na zhes bstan zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the conventional is also called reality here because it is consistent with reality.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag thams cad ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis mi bslu ba'i phyir de kho na rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag thams cad ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis mi bslu ba'i phyir de kho na rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Others say that all of these are called realities because they are nondeceptive in the aspects explained above.

original: gang rnam pa gang gis slu bar mi byed pa de ni de bzhin bas de kho na zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gang rnam pa gang gis slu bar mi byed pa de ni de bzhin bas de kho na zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: That which is nondeceptive in a certain aspect is called reality in that aspect.

original: de la rtsa ba'i de kho na ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba de ma grags pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i de kho na ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba de ma grags pas de'i phyir /
translated: The root reality is the three natures.

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Imagined, other-dependent, and real nature.

original: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum la rtsa ba'i de kho na zhes brjod can /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum la rtsa ba'i de kho na zhes brjod can /
translated: Why are the three natures called the basic reality?

original: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de la de kho na gzhan rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de la de kho na gzhan rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, because the other realities are established in relation to them.

original: der mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i de kho na gzhan 'dus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i de kho na gzhan 'dus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The other realities such as the reality of characteristic are included in them.

original: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum nye bar gzung zhe na /üîΩkha cig na re tha snyad dang don dam pa dang de'i gnas rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum nye bar gzung zhe na / kha cig na re tha snyad dang don dam pa dang de'i gnas rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Why are the three natures apprehended?üîΩSome say it is in order to demonstrate the conventional, the ultimate, and the basis of that.

original: gzhan dag na re phyin ci log dang de'i rgyud dang de'i gnyen po'i dmigs @243b pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyin ci log dang de'i rgyud dang de'i gnyen po'i dmigs @243b pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Others say it is in order to demonstrate the object of the error, the continuum of that, and the antidote to that.

original: gzhan dag na re byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir spang ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba dang mngon sum du bya ba'i dngos po rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir spang ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba dang mngon sum du bya ba'i dngos po rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: According to others, the three natures are taught in order to show the object of abandonment, the object of knowledge, and the object of realization, in order to free the bodhisattvas from the obscurations.

original: gzhan dag na re shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rang bzhin gyis zab pa ngo bo nyid gsum gyi sgo nas ma nor bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rang bzhin gyis zab pa ngo bo nyid gsum gyi sgo nas ma nor bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: According to others, the three natures are taught in order to show the profound method of the perfection of wisdom, in order to understand without error the three natures.

original: de skad du chos mngon pa'i mdo'i nang nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis las /üîΩbyung rten sgyu ma la sogs bstan //
analyzed: de skad du chos mngon pa'i mdo'i nang nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis las / byung rten sgyu ma la sogs bstan //
translated: In this way, two verses from the Abhidharma S≈´tra say:üîΩThe imaginary is taught to be like an illusion, etc.

original: rtags la brten nas med pa bstan //üîΩrnam dag rnam pa bzhir brten nas //
analyzed: rtags la brten nas med pa bstan // rnam dag rnam pa bzhir brten nas //
translated: The dependent is taught to be like an illusion, etc.üîΩThe perfected is taught to be like purity,

original: yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin /
translated: based on the four kinds of purity.üîΩThat purity is threefold: natural purity,

original: dag pa de ni rang bzhin dang // dri ma med dang lam dang dmigs //
analyzed: dag pa de ni rang bzhin dang // dri ma med dang lam dang dmigs //
translated: purity from the removal of defilements, and the path.

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi rnams //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi rnams //
translated: The pure dharmas

original: rnam pa bzhi pos bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pos bsdus pa yin //
translated: are included in the four kinds of purity.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: byung ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la ltos nas mdo las sgyu ma la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: byung ba gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la ltos nas mdo las sgyu ma la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: In dependence on the other-dependent reality, the sutra teaches illusion, etc.

original: de ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du log par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du log par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is like an illusion, etc., and appears falsely.

original: med pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la ltos nas med pa bstan to //
analyzed: med pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la ltos nas med pa bstan to //
translated: In dependence on the imagined reality, which is non-existent, the sutra teaches non-existence.

original: rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la ltos nas yongs su grub par bstan to //üîΩrnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i dus kyi de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la ltos nas yongs su grub par bstan to // rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i dus kyi de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: In dependence on the four kinds of purity, the sutra teaches the perfected.üîΩThe four kinds of purity are: purity by nature, such as reality, etc., in the state of impurity;

original: dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa ni de dag nyid dri ma med pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa ni de dag nyid dri ma med pa'i dus na'o //
translated: purity by the removal of stain, such as reality, etc., in the state of stainlessness;

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa 'thob pa'i lam rnam par dag pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa 'thob pa'i lam rnam par dag pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: purity of the path that obtains emptiness, etc., such as the factors of enlightenment;üîΩand

original: lam skyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos mdo'i sde la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam skyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos mdo'i sde la sogs pa ste /
translated: The pure object for the generation of the path is the Dharma of transmission, the Sutras, etc., which are the cause of the Dharma-element.

original: de la brten nas lam skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas lam skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path is generated in dependence on it.

original: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa 'di bzhis rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad bsdus te tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa 'di bzhis rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad bsdus te tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don mdor bsdus pa'o //
