translated: Thus, all the elements of purification are included in these four purities, and the meaning of the two verses is summarized.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ci rigs par ngo bo nyid gsum gzung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ci rigs par ngo bo nyid gsum gzung ngo zhe'o //
translated: Others believe that the three natures are apprehended in their proper order in order to demonstrate that they are the objects of mundane, supramundane, and subsequently attained wisdom.üîΩWhy is it that the three natures are considered here to be reality?

original: ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid gsum la de kho na zhas bya bar 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni de kho na'i don ni ma nor ba'i don @244a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid gsum la de kho na zhas bya bar 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni de kho na'i don ni ma nor ba'i don @244a * //
translated: The meaning of reality is the meaning of non-error.

original: yin na / ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid gsum la ma nor ba zhes bya /
analyzed: yin na / ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid gsum la ma nor ba zhes bya /
translated: Why is it that the three natures are called non-erroneous here?

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid gsum la de kho na zhes bya snyam du dri bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid gsum la de kho na zhes bya snyam du dri bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, the three realities are called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid gsum rtag med ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos pa la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum rtag med ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos pa la /
translated: The three realities are not permanent, etc.

original: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The imagined reality is always non-existent.

original: gang la byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / smra ba dang smra bar bya bar mngon par zhen pa'i rmi lam ltar rab tu 'byung ba de ni rang gi ngo bor med pa'i phyir brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gang la byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / smra ba dang smra bar bya bar mngon par zhen pa'i rmi lam ltar rab tu 'byung ba de ni rang gi ngo bor med pa'i phyir brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That which appears like a dream, in which the childish are attached to the duality of grasped and grasper, the speaker and the spoken to, does not exist in its own nature, and therefore is the imagined reality.

original: de'i phyir med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir med pa nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir med pa nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the imagined reality, since it is non-existent by nature and since it is non-erroneous.

original: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la med pa nyid kyi de kho na zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la med pa nyid kyi de kho na zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the suchness of the non-existence of the imagined reality is stated.üîΩThe other-dependent reality is existent and non-existent.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la phyin ci ma log pa'i don ni 'dor de kho na'i don du ston to //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la phyin ci ma log pa'i don ni 'dor de kho na'i don du ston to //
translated: The meaning of non-erroneous is shown to be the meaning of reality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang yang dag par na ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang yang dag par na ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other-dependent characteristic exists, but not in reality.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de tha snyad kyi gnas yin pas yod do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i mtshan nyid de tha snyad kyi gnas yin pas yod do //
translated: It exists because it is the basis of the conventional, that imagined characteristic consisting of the grasped and the grasper, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du med pas yang dag par na de bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du med pas yang dag par na de bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: It is not in reality as it appears, because it does not exist in the nature of the grasped and the grasper, etc.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, because of error.

original: de ni 'di skad du sgyu ma'i rgyu ltar snang ba gang yin pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sgyu ma'i rgyu ltar snang ba gang yin pa de ni yod do //
translated: This is what is being said: that appearance which is like the cause of an illusion exists.

original: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the appearance as the grasped and the grasper is not as it appears,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the illusory man, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught as error.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la de kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la de kho na ste /
translated: That is reality in the dependent nature.

original: gzhan du yod pa bdag nyid la med pa'i rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du yod pa bdag nyid la med pa'i rnam par snang ngo //
translated: It appears as the nature of existing elsewhere and not existing in itself.

original: skabs yin pas 'dir yang phyin ci ma log go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs yin pas 'dir yang phyin ci ma log go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since this is the topic, the phrase ‚Äúwithout distortion‚Äù should be supplied here.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of the perfected

original: yod dang med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yod dang med pa kho na ste /
translated: is just existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa dang de kho na ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa dang de kho na ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Existence, nonexistence, and reality are the characteristics of the perfected.

original: gnyis pa med pa yod pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yod pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pa yod pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yod pas so //
translated: It is existence because it is the nature of the nonexistence of duality and existence.

original: gnyis po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas med pa'o //
translated: It is nonexistence because it is the nature of the nonexistence of duality.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pas de kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pas de kho na'o //
translated: It is reality because it is the object of purification.

original: 'dir ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la de kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la de kho na ste /
translated: Here, reality is in the perfected nature

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @244b ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @244b ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: because it is without distortion.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum gyi de kho na ni bshad na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum gyi de kho na ni bshad na /
translated: The reality of the three natures having been explained,

original: mtshan nyid ma bshad de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma bshad de /
translated: their characteristics have not been explained.

original: de'i phyir dris pa'am yang na rtsa ba'i de kho na'i 'og tu mtshan nyid kyi de kho na bshad la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dris pa'am yang na rtsa ba'i de kho na'i 'og tu mtshan nyid kyi de kho na bshad la /
translated: Therefore, it is asked, or else, after the reality of the root, the reality of the characteristics is explained.

original: de yang ma grags pas na mtshan nyid kyi de kho na gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: de yang ma grags pas na mtshan nyid kyi de kho na gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: And since that is not well known, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the reality of the characteristics?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / 'di la chos dang gang zag dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la chos dang gang zag dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail, ‚ÄúHere, it is the person and phenomena.‚Äù

original: gang shes nas gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang shes nas gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: When that is known, the view that exaggerates or denigrates persons and phenomena does not occur. That is the reality of the imagined nature.

original: bdag dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par de'i dmigs par gyur pa don dam par yod do zhes mngon par zhen pa ni sgro 'dogs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par de'i dmigs par gyur pa don dam par yod do zhes mngon par zhen pa ni sgro 'dogs par lta ba'o //
translated: The view that exaggerates is the conception that the self, forms, and so on are ultimate existences, apart from the consciousness that appears as those.

original: tha snyad du yang med do zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang med do zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs par lta ba'o //
translated: The view that denigrates is the conception that they do not exist even conventionally.

original: gzhan dag na re gang zag dang chos su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa spong ba ni skur pa 'debs par lta ba'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang zag dang chos su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa spong ba ni skur pa 'debs par lta ba'o zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: The view of deprecation is the abandonment of consciousness appearing as persons and phenomena.

original: 'dzin pa spong ba 'di ni bsam dgos pa'o //üîΩmtshan nyid gang yongs su gcad pas gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'dzin pa spong ba 'di ni bsam dgos pa'o // mtshan nyid gang yongs su gcad pas gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: This abandonment of apprehension should be contemplated.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of thatness of the imagined nature is the view of imputation and deprecation in regard to both persons and phenomena, through the elimination of which one should understand that imputation and deprecation are abandoned.

original: de'ang tha snyad du de kho na yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'ang tha snyad du de kho na yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: That is thatness conventionally, but not in terms of essence.

original: gang gi phyir kun brtags pa khong du chung na gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mi skye'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun brtags pa khong du chung na gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mi skye'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because when the imagined is comprehended, the view of imputation and deprecation in regard to both persons and phenomena does not arise, that is, does not occur.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The extensive passage continues:üîΩThe error of the appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender is the view that is the reification and repudiation of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i 'khrul pa gang la chos dang gang zag tu 'dzin pa de gal te kho na nyid du yod do zhes mngon par zhen na de la bu ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i 'khrul pa gang la chos dang gang zag tu 'dzin pa de gal te kho na nyid du yod do zhes mngon par zhen na de la bu ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: If one is attached to the idea that the error of the appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender exists in reality, then one reifies the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: ji ste gzung ba bzhin du 'dzin pa yang med do zhes mngon par zhen na /
analyzed: ji ste gzung ba bzhin du 'dzin pa yang med do zhes mngon par zhen na /
translated: If one is attached to the idea that the apprehender does not exist like the apprehended,

original: de lta bu ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: then one repudiates the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: mtshan nyid gang shes nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta bar mi 'byung ba de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang shes nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta bar mi 'byung ba de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of the dependent nature is that which, when it is known, the view that is the reification and repudiation of the apprehended and the apprehender does not arise.

original: @245a * // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa spangs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @245a * // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa spangs par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is the abandonment of reification and repudiation.

original: de yang brtags pa ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang brtags pa ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du med pa'o //
translated: It is also imagined, because it does not exist as subject and object.

original: de'i tha snyad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir yod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tha snyad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir yod pa'o //
translated: It exists, because it is the basis of that conventional usage.

original: de ltar yongs su shes na gzhan gyi dbang la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su shes na gzhan gyi dbang la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When one understands it in this way, the views of superimposition and denial in regard to the relative do not occur.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la kha cig na re /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la kha cig na re /
translated: The views of superimposition and denial in regard to existence and nonexistence.

original: gal te stong pa nyid dngos po yod pa nyid do zhes yang dag par rjes su lta na /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid dngos po yod pa nyid do zhes yang dag par rjes su lta na /
translated: Some believe that if one regards emptiness as the existence of an existent thing,

original: de lta ni dngos por sgro 'dogs par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ni dngos por sgro 'dogs par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then one has the view of superimposition in regard to an entity.

original: ji ste med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If one regards it as the nonexistence of a nonexistent thing,

original: de lta bu ni dngos po med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni dngos po med par lta ba'o //
translated: then one has the view of denial in regard to an entity.

original: mtshan nyid gang shes nas dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba de gnyis mi 'byung ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang shes nas dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba de gnyis mi 'byung ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the reality of the perfected is that characteristic through knowledge of which the two views of entity and non-entity do not occur.

original: kha cig na re de yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re de yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Some say that the perfected nature is the reality free from the nature of entity and non-entity.

original: de shes nas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba mi 'byung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: de shes nas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba mi 'byung ngo zhe'o //
translated: And, through knowledge of that, the views of entity and non-entity do not occur in the perfected nature.

original: gzhan na re dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i bdag nyid can la /
analyzed: gzhan na re dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i bdag nyid can la /
translated: Others say that the perfected nature is the reality free from the nature of entity and non-entity,

original: dngos po'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir gnyis po med pa ni rang gi ngo bos stong pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir gnyis po med pa ni rang gi ngo bos stong pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: and the non-existence of the two is emptiness by own nature, because it is the superimposition of the entity of an entity and non-entity.

original: dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be an extreme of superimposition of entity.

original: de dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: de dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du yang med do zhe na /
translated: It is not even the object of the nonconceptual intuition of the reality of nonduality, which is free from both existence and nonexistence.

original: dngos po med par skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par skur ba 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If you say that, you fall into the extreme of nihilism, denying existence.

original: gzhan na re dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis la so sor sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba dang sbyar bas bshad pa 'di gnyis kyang bsam dogs pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan na re dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis la so sor sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba dang sbyar bas bshad pa 'di gnyis kyang bsam dogs pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Another interpretation is that these two explanations are given in terms of the views that impute existence and deny existence to existence and nonexistence respectively.

original: 'dir dngos po ni gnyis po med pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po ni gnyis po med pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: Here, existence is the existence of nonduality.

original: gal te de la dngos po nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni dngos por sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de la dngos po nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni dngos por sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you grasp it as existence, you impute existence to it.

original: ji ste dngos po med pa nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni skur pa 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste dngos po med pa nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni skur pa 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you grasp it as nonexistence, you deny it.

original: 'dir ni dngos po med pa na ni gnyis po'i dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po med pa na ni gnyis po'i dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Here, nonexistence is the nonexistence of duality.

original: gal gte de la chad pa nyid du na de lta na ni dngos po med pa'ang shin tu med @245b pa nyid pas sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal gte de la chad pa nyid du na de lta na ni dngos po med pa'ang shin tu med @245b pa nyid pas sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a non-existent, then it is a superimposition, since a non-existent is utterly non-existent.

original: ji ste gnyis po nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni skur par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste gnyis po nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni skur par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is a duality, then it is a denial,

original: 'di ltar de ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: since it is distinguished by the non-existence of duality.

original: yang na gal te dngos po'i ngo bor 'dzin na de lta na ni sgro btags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gal te dngos po'i ngo bor 'dzin na de lta na ni sgro btags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it is apprehended as an entity, then it is a superimposition.

original: ji ste dngos po med pa nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la yang skur pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste dngos po med pa nyid du 'dzin na de lta na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la yang skur pa 'gyur te /
translated: If it is apprehended as a non-entity, then it is a denial in regard to both the afflictions and purification.

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa 'di ni yongs su grub pa nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa 'di ni yongs su grub pa nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This abandonment of the two extremes is the characteristic of reality as perfected.

original: don phyir yang dag min rtogs phyir //
analyzed: don phyir yang dag min rtogs phyir //
translated: It is explained as being for the sake of the object, for the sake of the non-apprehension of the unreal,

original: gnyis po med pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis po med pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: and for the sake of the non-apprehension of duality.

original: zhes ngo bo nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid sngar yang bshad ma zin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: zhes ngo bo nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid sngar yang bshad ma zin na ma zhe na /
translated: Haven‚Äôt the characteristics of the three natures already been explained?

original: der ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: der ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Here, the characteristic of reality.

original: 'dir ni gang shes nas mi 'byung ba de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang shes nas mi 'byung ba de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Here, that which is not produced by knowing is the characteristic of reality.

original: zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma yin pas zlog pa med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma yin pas zlog pa med do //
translated: Since it is a characteristic of a sign, there is no reversal.

original: gang shes nas gang zag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni rtsa ba'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang shes nas gang zag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni rtsa ba'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which is not produced by knowing the superimposition and denial views of the person, etc. is the root reality.

original: de'i 'og tu bshad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi de kho na'i 'og tu phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bshad pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi de kho na'i 'og tu phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na brjod par bya ste /
translated: After that, because it is explained after the characteristic reality, the reality of non-reversal should be stated.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na ni zhes bya cher smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na ni zhes bya cher smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, The reality of non-reversal is...

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin pas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen po yin pas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness are the antidotes to the distortions of permanence, happiness, purity, and self, and are called the reality of non-reversal.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na'i nang du de kho na gzhan 'dus so zhes sngar dam bcas pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na'i nang du de kho na gzhan 'dus so zhes sngar dam bcas pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it was previously asserted that the other reality is included in the basic reality,

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na der ji ltar zhen zhes rgya cher dris so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na der ji ltar zhen zhes rgya cher dris so //
translated: therefore, it is extensively asked, ‚ÄúHow is the basic reality conceived?‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa de dag mi rtag pa la sgos pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa de dag mi rtag pa la sgos pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe aspects of impermanence, etc.‚Äù refers to the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, which are impermanence, etc.

original: de'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is impermanence, etc.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na'i nang du phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na'i nang du phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the unerring reality is included in the basic reality,

original: mi rtag don ni med don dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: mi rtag don ni med don dang // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: it is extensively stated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of impermanence is the meaning of nonexistence.

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of impermanence is threefold:

original: med pa'i don dang / skye zhing 'jig pa'i don dang / dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa'i don do //
analyzed: med pa'i don dang / skye zhing 'jig pa'i don dang / dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa'i don do //
translated: the meaning of nonexistence, the meaning of arising and ceasing, and the meaning of being defiled and undefiled.

original: gang dus thams cad du de bzhin du yod pa @246a * //
analyzed: gang dus thams cad du de bzhin du yod pa @246a * //
translated: That which exists in that way at all times

original: de ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rtag pa ste /
translated: is permanent.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is impermanent.üîΩThey are in that order.

original: de dag tu go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de la dus thams cad du med pa'i don mi rtag pa'i don gyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag tu go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de la dus thams cad du med pa'i don mi rtag pa'i don gyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The imagined nature is impermanent in the sense of being nonexistent at all times.

original: gzhan dag na re nges pa'i tshig gi tshul du na rtag pa med pa ni mi rtag par rig par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nges pa'i tshig gi tshul du na rtag pa med pa ni mi rtag par rig par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: According to the method of etymological interpretation, the absence of permanence should be understood as impermanence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The other-dependent nature is impermanent in the sense of momentariness, because it has the characteristic of arising and passing away in each moment.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: It is impermanent because it is momentary.

original: de ni rkyen las byung ba dang 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rkyen las byung ba dang 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it arises and passes away due to conditions, and because it does not have a cause for its passing away.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur pa'i chos yin du zin kyang dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa nyid kyi don gyi mtshan nyid glo bur gyi don mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur pa'i chos yin du zin kyang dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa nyid kyi don gyi mtshan nyid glo bur gyi don mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Although the perfected nature is not subject to change, it is the meaning of the reality that is both defiled and undefiled, and the meaning of adventitious is the meaning of impermanent.üîΩThe reality of suffering is threefold:üîΩthe suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal len dang mtshan nyid dang // zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la sdug bsngal ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩnye bar len pas sdug bsngal ba dang / mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / 'brel bas sdug bsngal ba'o //üîΩde la brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nye bar len pas sdug bsngal te /üîΩyongs su ma shes pas 'di'am gzhan na sdug bsngal nye bar len pas sdug bsngal lo //üîΩji ltar na de yongs su ma shes pas sdug bsngal nye bar len pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal len dang mtshan nyid dang // zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la sdug bsngal ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste / nye bar len pas sdug bsngal ba dang / mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / 'brel bas sdug bsngal ba'o // de la brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nye bar len pas sdug bsngal te / yongs su ma shes pas 'di'am gzhan na sdug bsngal nye bar len pas sdug bsngal lo // ji ltar na de yongs su ma shes pas sdug bsngal nye bar len pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The reality of origination is also threefold:

original: gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the origination of moral defilement, the origination of the karma that is the cause of the latter and the origination of the karma that is the cause of the latter and the origination of the karma that is the cause of the latter and the origination of the karma that is the cause of the latter and the origination of the karma that is the cause of the latter and the origination of the
