latter and the origination of the karma that

original: des dngos por 'dzin pa'i sgo nas gang zag dang chos su mngon par zhen pas na gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: des dngos por 'dzin pa'i sgo nas gang zag dang chos su mngon par zhen pas na gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Since it is the manifest clinging to persons and things by way of the apprehension of real things, it is the manifest clinging to persons and things.

original: de yang gnyis su lhung ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de yang gnyis su lhung ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Moreover, it is the imagined reality because it falls into the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun gyi rgyu yin pas de skad bshad kyi /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun gyi rgyu yin pas de skad bshad kyi /
translated: The manifest clinging to the imagined reality is said to be the cause of the continuum of suffering.

original: kun brtags pa nyid ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa nyid ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
translated: But the imagined reality itself is not suffering,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: yang na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen nas dngos po'i ngo bor nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: yang na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen nas dngos po'i ngo bor nye bar len pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the imagined reality is the appropriation of the nature of an entity through the manifest clinging to persons and things.

original: de ltar nye bar len pas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Since it is appropriated in this way, the manifest clinging to the imagined reality is suffering.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The other-dependent reality is to be connected with the phrase ‚Äúthe suffering of the characteristic.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba ni sdug bsngal nyid rnam pa gsum @246b ste ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba ni sdug bsngal nyid rnam pa gsum @246b ste ;
translated: The suffering of the characteristic is the three kinds of suffering itself:

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum po de dag ni gzhan gyi dbang gi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum po de dag ni gzhan gyi dbang gi sdug bsngal te /
translated: These three kinds of suffering are the suffering of the other-dependent,

original: mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: which is the suffering of the characteristic.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'brel pas sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'brel pas sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The reality of the perfected is suffering because it is related to suffering.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of inclusion.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is related.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i phyir bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i phyir bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is mentioned because it is related to suffering.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal te /
translated: The reality of the other-dependent is suffering.

original: de'i chos nyid yongs su grub pa yang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid yongs su grub pa yang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfected, which is its true nature, is also called ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù because it is related to suffering.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid kyi nang du go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid kyi nang du go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba de la /
translated: In the context of reality, they are respectively:

original: nye bar len pas sdug bsngal ni kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pas sdug bsngal ni kun brtags pa'o //
translated: Suffering is imagined due to appropriation.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The dependent is due to its characteristic.

original: 'brel pas ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pas ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The perfected is due to its connection.

original: dngos med de yi dngos ma yin //
analyzed: dngos med de yi dngos ma yin //
translated: Non-entity is not that entity.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni stong par 'dod //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni stong par 'dod //
translated: It is accepted as empty of intrinsic reality.

original: ces bya ba la stong pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la stong pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Emptiness is threefold:

original: dngos po med pas stong pa nyid dang / de ma yin pas stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pas stong pa nyid dang / de ma yin pas stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: emptiness of non-entity, emptiness of non-entity of that, and emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: da la dngos po med pas stong pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: da la dngos po med pas stong pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de //
translated: Here, the emptiness of non-entity is the imagined nature.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gang gis kyang yod par gzung du med de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gang gis kyang yod par gzung du med de /
translated: the imagined characteristic is not apprehended as existent by any kind of direct perception or inference, like the nature of the horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: dngos po med pa nyid pas de'i stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid pas de'i stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is non-existent as an entity, it is the emptiness of that.

original: de ma yin pas stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de ma yin pas stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of what is other is the relative nature.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi bdag nyid du kun brtags pa de ltar med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi bdag nyid du kun brtags pa de ltar med kyi /
translated: the characteristic of the relative is not non-existent, as it is imagined to be by naive people as a duality,

original: ji ltar dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rtog par 'gyur pa lta bu yang ye med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rtog par 'gyur pa lta bu yang ye med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not existent in the way it is imagined by pure mundane wisdom.

original: de bas na de ma yin pas de'i stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na de ma yin pas de'i stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says: since it is not that, it is the emptiness of that.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of nature is the perfect nature.

original: de'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnyis po med pa'i dngos po'i ri bo 'di yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnyis po med pa'i dngos po'i ri bo 'di yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the perfect is the emptiness of the entity that is the absence of the duality, and therefore it is the nature of emptiness.

original: de bas na rang bzhin kho na ste ngo bo nyid kho nas @247a * //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin kho na ste ngo bo nyid kho nas @247a * //
translated: Therefore, it is just the nature, just the essence.

original: de'i stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The emptiness of that is called the emptiness of essential nature.üîΩThe selflessness of the lack of characteristics,üîΩand so on at length.

original: mtshan nyid med pas bdag med dang // zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la bdag med pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas bdag med dang // zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la bdag med pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Selflessness is also threefold:

original: mtshan nyid med pas bdag med pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas bdag med pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
translated: the selflessness of the lack of characteristics, the selflessness of the characteristic of non-entityness, and the selflessness of the intrinsic identity.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis dngos po med pas mtshan nyid med pa nyid bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis dngos po med pas mtshan nyid med pa nyid bdag med pa ste /
translated: Among these, the imagined nature is the selflessness of the lack of characteristics, because it is non-existent by virtue of its own characteristic.

original: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa nyid de'i bdag med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa nyid de'i bdag med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the imagined nature is the selflessness of the lack of characteristics, because it does not exist by virtue of its own characteristic.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin par ston to //
translated: This is what is being taught by this other formulation, and not that it is selfless in another way.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa ste /
translated: The relative is the selflessness of the characteristic of non-entityness.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bor yod kyang des byis pa rnams kyis gnyis su ji ltar kun brtags pa de ltar ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bor yod kyang des byis pa rnams kyis gnyis su ji ltar kun brtags pa de ltar ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the dependent characteristic exists as the entity of a thing, but it does not exist as it is imagined by the childish in two ways.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: The characteristic that is contrary to that is not similar to the imagined characteristic.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de'i bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de'i bdag med pa'o //
translated: The dependent characteristic is the selflessness of that.

original: de ltar na kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis de'i bdag med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis de'i bdag med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the selflessness of that is by way of the imagined self.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The selflessness that is the nature of the perfected is the selflessness that is the nature of the perfected.

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa ni ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid med pas de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid de'i bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i chos la bdag med
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa ni ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid med pas de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid de'i bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i chos la bdag med
translated: Thus, the perfected is the nature of the absence of the entity of apprehendeds and apprehenders. Therefore, it is said that the selflessness of that is the nature of the perfected.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston to //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston to //
translated: He shows that they are the same in essence.

original: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between emptiness and selflessness?

original: kha cig na re gang na gang med pa de ni des stong la /
analyzed: kha cig na re gang na gang med pa de ni des stong la /
translated: Some say: That which is empty of something is empty of that.

original: gang zhig gang gis bdag ste ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bdag ste ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: That which is not the self, not the essence of something, is selfless.

original: 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di yin no zhe'o //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: kha cig na re don du khyad par gang yang med mod kyi rnam par gzhag pa'i bye brag gis tha dad de ;
analyzed: kha cig na re don du khyad par gang yang med mod kyi rnam par gzhag pa'i bye brag gis tha dad de ;
translated: Some say: In fact, there is no difference at all. They are distinguished by their different applications.

original: 'di ltar gang na gang med pa des de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir bdag med pa dang / cig shos ni de la yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang na gang med pa des de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir bdag med pa dang / cig shos ni de la yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Thus, the selflessness of that which is empty of something is because it does not have the essence of that. The other is emptiness because it is not fully established as an essence.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi gnyen po dang glo bur gyi dri ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi gnyen po dang glo bur gyi dri ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two extremes of superimposition and denial are the antidotes to the two.

original: @247b rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum la go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: @247b rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum la go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
translated: The three kinds of impermanence are taught in order, in relation to the three kinds of reality.

original: med pa'i don mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye zhing 'jig pa mi rtag pa nyid dang dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i don mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye zhing 'jig pa mi rtag pa nyid dang dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The impermanence of non-existence, the impermanence of arising and passing away, and the impermanence of being both defiled and undefiled.

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa rnam pa gsum gyi bar du bstan pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa rnam pa gsum gyi bar du bstan pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the three kinds of selflessness are taught. This is the reality of non-error.

original: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na brjod dgos te /
translated: After that, the reality of effect and cause must be stated.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na nyid la zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na nyid la zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail, ‚Äúin the reality of effect and cause.‚Äù

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad de /
translated: Therein, from the perspective of the side of affliction,

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'bras bu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'bras bu'i de kho na'o //
translated: the truth of suffering is the reality of effect.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni rgyu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni rgyu'i de kho na'o //
translated: The truth of origination is the reality of cause.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la yang 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'bras bu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la yang 'gog pa'i bden pa ni 'bras bu'i de kho na'o //
translated: In the context of purification, the truth of cessation is the reality of the result.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni rgyu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni rgyu'i de kho na'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the reality of the cause.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the four truths of suffering and so on are the reality of the result and the reality of the cause.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa rnams so zhes bshad na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa rnams so zhes bshad na /
translated: Since it was explained that the fundamental reality is the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path,

original: de yang ji ltar na rtsa ba'i de kho na sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa mi shes na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar na rtsa ba'i de kho na sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa mi shes na /
translated: one might not know how the fundamental reality is the nature of the truths of suffering and so on.üîΩTherefore, it is asked, how is the fundamental reality called the truths of suffering and so on in the three aspects?

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba dris pa dang ; de'i phyir 'di ltar de mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum la sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba dris pa dang ; de'i phyir 'di ltar de mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis te /
translated: Therefore it is said, because it is characterized by impermanence and so on.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bden par 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bden par 'dod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is asserted as the truth of suffering.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid pas de dag thams cad kun brtags pa la sogs pa re re la yod par rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid pas de dag thams cad kun brtags pa la sogs pa re re la yod par rgyas par bstan te /
translated: The characteristics of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness. All of these are taught extensively in each of the three natures, the imagined and so on.

original: de'i phyir kun brtags pa la sogs pa re re la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun brtags pa la sogs pa re re la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, each of the three natures, the imagined and so on, is asserted to be the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba'i don rnam pa gsum gyis rtsa ba'i de kho nar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i don rnam pa gsum gyis rtsa ba'i de kho nar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i go rims bzhin no //
translated: The truth of origin is in the fundamental reality in the same order as the three meanings of origin.

original: kun 'byung ba'i de nyid mi shes pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i de nyid mi shes pas de'i phyir /
translated: Because the reality of origin is not understood,

original: kun 'byung ba'i don rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i don rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: the three meanings of origin are stated:

original: bag chags dang ni kun nas 'byung //
analyzed: bag chags dang ni kun nas 'byung //
translated: Origination as habitual propensities,üîΩorigination as the origin,

original: ma bral ba yang de bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma bral ba yang de bzhin no // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and origination as nonseparation.

original: rnam pa gsum ni bag chags kyi kun 'byung ba dang / kun nas byung ba'i kun 'byung ba dang / ma bral ba'i kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni bag chags kyi kun 'byung ba dang / kun nas byung ba'i kun 'byung ba dang / ma bral ba'i kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The three meanings of origin are origination as habitual propensities, origination as the origin, and origination as nonseparation.

original: de la @248a * //
analyzed: de la @248a * //
translated: In that regard,

original: bag chags kyi kun 'byung ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi kun 'byung ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: The origination of the latent impressions should be understood as the imagined reality.

original: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe latent impressions of the adherence to the imagined reality.‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par yod do zhes mngon par zhen pa nye bar bzung nas 'jig rten gyi chos rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed kyi /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par yod do zhes mngon par zhen pa nye bar bzung nas 'jig rten gyi chos rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed kyi /
translated: The latent impressions of the conceptualization of worldly dharmas are deposited by the adherence to the non-existence of the imagined reality as existent.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: But not by the supramundane, which is free from adherence.

original: de bas na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la bag chags kyis kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la bag chags kyis kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the origination of the latent impressions in the imagined reality is called the origination of the imagined reality.

original: kun nas byung ba'i kun 'byung ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas byung ba'i kun 'byung ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The origination of the origination is the relative reality.

original: kun nas byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag thob pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas byung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag thob pa ste /
translated: The origination is the attainment of self.

original: de gang las byung ba de ni de las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir kun nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de gang las byung ba de ni de las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir kun nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: That from which it originates is the origination of the origination.

original: de yang rang bzhin ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, if one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is its nature?‚Äù the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is karma and the afflictions.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since they are the nature of entities, they are the dependent nature.

original: ma bral ba'i kun 'byung ba ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /üîΩji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bral ba'i kun 'byung ba ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste / ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The origin that is not free is to be taken as suchness.

original: sgrib pa dang ma bral zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang ma bral zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is not free from obscurations.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de bzhin nyid ji srid du sgrib pa rnams dang ma bral ba de srid du sdug bsngal kun 'byung zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji srid du sgrib pa rnams dang ma bral ba de srid du sdug bsngal kun 'byung zhes bya ba'am /
translated: As long as suchness is not free from obscurations, it is the origin of suffering.

original: sgrib pa rnams dang ma bral ba'i de bzhin nyid ni kun 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pas kun 'byung ba'i ming 'thob po zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams dang ma bral ba'i de bzhin nyid ni kun 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pas kun 'byung ba'i ming 'thob po zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, suchness that is not free from obscurations is the reality of the origin and thus obtains the name origin.

original: 'gog pa rnam pa gsum gyis rtsa ba'i de kho nar 'gog pa'i bden pa yin na de yang mi shes nas de'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gog pa rnam pa gsum gyis rtsa ba'i de kho nar 'gog pa'i bden pa yin na de yang mi shes nas de'i phyir //
translated: If the reality of cessation is the truth of cessation in the context of the three types of cessation, then since that is not understood, the root text states,üîΩ‚ÄúThe cessation that is not free from the seeds of the afflictions is the truth of suffering.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa rnam pa gsum ni ;
analyzed: 'gog pa rnam pa gsum ni ;
translated: The three kinds of cessation are:üîΩnon-production by intrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid dang gnyis mi skye //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gnyis mi skye //
translated: non-production of the duality,

original: dri ma zhi ba gnyis su 'dod //üîΩces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dri ma zhi ba gnyis su 'dod // ces bya ba smos so //
translated: and the pacification of the soiling defilements.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba ni kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: Non-production by intrinsic reality is the imagined,

original: de ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pas gtan du mi skye ste /
analyzed: de ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pas gtan du mi skye ste /
translated: because it is like the son of a barren woman, it is essentially non-existent and is never produced.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi skye ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi skye ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The non-production of the duality, i.e., the apprehended object and apprehending subject, is the relative,

original: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin dang gtan bral ba'i phyir 'khrul pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid du mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin dang gtan bral ba'i phyir 'khrul pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid du mi skye ba'o //
translated: because it is essentially free from the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, it is never produced as the identity of the duality of error.

original: dri ma zhim pa gnyis ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma zhim pa gnyis ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The pacification of the soiling defilements is the perfect,üîΩbecause it is essentially free from the soiling defilements.

original: kyang zhes bya ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of including other categories.üîΩSince that is not known, he says:üîΩthe cessation that is a non-appropriation,

original: de yang mi shes nas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin @248b nyid ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang mi shes nas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / de bzhin @248b nyid ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and thusness.

original: dri ma ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dri ma ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The soiling defilements are twofold:

original: 'dod tshags la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod tshags la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang kun brtags pa'o //
translated: The obscurations of desire, etc. are the imagined.

original: de la zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sa bon gnas nas bton te /üîΩ'dod chags la sog pa'i dri ma rnams gtan mi skye ba'i bdag nyid kyis zhi ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi sa bon gnas nas bton te / 'dod chags la sog pa'i dri ma rnams gtan mi skye ba'i bdag nyid kyis zhi ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The seed of uncontaminated wisdom is extracted from the realm of the container consciousness and,üîΩby the nature of never arising again, the defilements of desire, etc. are pacified, which is the analytical cessation.

original: de bzhin nyid du spyod yul pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis kun brtags pa'i dri ma mi skye ba'i bdag nyid kyis zhi ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du spyod yul pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis kun brtags pa'i dri ma mi skye ba'i bdag nyid kyis zhi ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: By the nature of never arising again, the defilements of the imagined are pacified, which is reality.

original: 'di gnyis ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: These two are the perfected nature.

original: 'gog pa rnam pa 'di gsum ni brtags pa la sogs pa rtsa ba'i de kho nar go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa rnam pa 'di gsum ni brtags pa la sogs pa rtsa ba'i de kho nar go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: These three kinds of cessation should be understood respectively in the fundamental reality of the imagined, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs pas nyon mongs pa dang kun brtags pa'i dri ma gnyis zhi ba ni de bzhin nyid ces brjod do /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs pas nyon mongs pa dang kun brtags pa'i dri ma gnyis zhi ba ni de bzhin nyid ces brjod do /
translated: Others say that the pacification of the two defilements and the imagined defilements by the realization of reality is called reality.

original: gnyis 'gog pa dang rang bzhin 'gog pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis 'gog pa dang rang bzhin 'gog pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the cessation of the two and the cessation of intrinsic reality are to be refuted.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid la bya'o //
translated: Intrinsic reality refers to suchness, because the mind is intrinsically clear light.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid la dmigs pas 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid la dmigs pas 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that cessation which is the object of observation of suchness is called the cessation of intrinsic reality.

original: 'gag pa tsam la so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa tsam la so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Cessation that is mere cessation is called analytical cessation.

original: kha cig na re 'dir 'gags pas 'gog pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dir 'gags pas 'gog pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Some say: Here, cessation is suchness because of cessation.

original: 'gog pa ni mi skye ba'i bdag nyid pas ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba la sogs pa thams cad bsdus te 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mi skye ba'i bdag nyid pas ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba la sogs pa thams cad bsdus te 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since cessation is the nature of non-production, all that is intrinsically non-produced and so on is included in it and is called the truth of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa rtsa ba'i de kho nar bsdus pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa rtsa ba'i de kho nar bsdus pa bshad zin to //
translated: The inclusion of the truth of cessation in the reality of the root has been explained.

original: de'i 'og tu lam gyi bden pa bsdu bar bya ste ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam gyi bden pa bsdu bar bya ste ;
translated: Next, the truth of the path should be included.

original: de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa rtsa ba'i de kho nar rnam pa gsum du ji ltar rab tu gzhag ce na zhes dris pa dang de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa rtsa ba'i de kho nar rnam pa gsum du ji ltar rab tu gzhag ce na zhes dris pa dang de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, how are the three aspects of the path reality established as the basic reality?

original: yongs su shes par bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the three aspects of the path reality are stated as the objects of thorough knowledge, abandonment, and realization.

original: kun brtags pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The imagined is the object of thorough knowledge.

original: kun brtags pa ni gtan med pa nyid pas de ni yongs su shes par bya bar zad kyi spang du med de med pa ni spang bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gtan med pa nyid pas de ni yongs su shes par bya bar zad kyi spang du med de med pa ni spang bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The imagined is utterly nonexistent, so it is only the object of thorough knowledge, not the object of abandonment, because it is not suitable to abandon what does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The dependent is the object of thorough knowledge and abandonment.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni ji ltar snang ba de ltar med par shes par bya'i /üîΩbrtags pa bzhin du thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis @249a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni ji ltar snang ba de ltar med par shes par bya'i / brtags pa bzhin du thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis @249a * //
translated: The dependent should be known as not existing as it appears,

original: med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as nonexistent in all ways, as it is imagined.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa ni dngos po'i bdag nyid yin pas spang bar bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa ni dngos po'i bdag nyid yin pas spang bar bya ba yang yin no //
translated: Karma and affliction are the nature of things, so they are also the objects of abandonment.

original: yongs su grub pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba dang thob par mngon sum du bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba dang thob par mngon sum du bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfected is to be fully understood and to be actualized as attainment.

original: yongs su grub pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid dang gnas gyur pa nyid du yongs su shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid dang gnas gyur pa nyid du yongs su shes par bya zhing /
translated: The perfected is to be fully understood as the characteristic of being liberated from entity and nonentity and as the very state of transformation.

original: gnas par gyur pa nyid rnam par grol ba chos kyi skur mngon sum du bya ba yin pas stong pa nyid ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa nyid rnam par grol ba chos kyi skur mngon sum du bya ba yin pas stong pa nyid ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: Since the state of transformation is to be actualized as the Dharma body of liberation, emptiness is to be fully understood.

original: 'gog pa ni thob par mngon sum du byas pas mngon sum du bya ba'o //üîΩkha cig na re gnyis la rnam pa gnyis gnyis te yongs su shes pa rnam gnyis ni shes pa'i yongs su shes pa'i dang / spong ba'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni thob par mngon sum du byas pas mngon sum du bya ba'o // kha cig na re gnyis la rnam pa gnyis gnyis te yongs su shes pa rnam gnyis ni shes pa'i yongs su shes pa'i dang / spong ba'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Since cessation is to be actualized as attainment, it is to be actualized.üîΩSome say that each has two aspects: the two aspects of full understanding are the full understanding of knowledge and the full understanding of abandonment.

original: de la dngos po dang gsum pa ni shes pa'i yongs su shes pas yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po dang gsum pa ni shes pa'i yongs su shes pas yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, the first two are to be fully understood by the full understanding of knowledge.

original: gnyis pa ni gnyis kas yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gnyis kas yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The second is to be fully understood by both.

original: mngon sum du bya ba rnam pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba rnam pa gnyis ni /
translated: The two kinds of realization are:

original: shes par mngon sum du bya ba dang / thob par mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: shes par mngon sum du bya ba dang / thob par mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: realization through knowledge and realization through attainment.

original: de la shes par mngon sum du bya bas ni gsum char yang mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: de la shes par mngon sum du bya bas ni gsum char yang mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: Among them, the third is realized through both.

original: thob par mngon sum du bya bas ni gsum pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: thob par mngon sum du bya bas ni gsum pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: The third is realized through attainment.

original: de ltar rtsa ba'i de kho na 'dir yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba rnams kyis lam gyi bden pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa ba'i de kho na 'dir yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba rnams kyis lam gyi bden pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'i /
translated: Thus, the truth of the path should be understood as being established by those things that are to be fully understood, abandoned, and realized in this basic reality.

original: de'i khongs su gtogs par bsdu ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i khongs su gtogs par bsdu ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not included in the categories of those things.

original: de la bden pa bzhis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang ; gang las byung ba dang / de gnyis rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang gang las 'gyur pa de rnams yongs su brjod do //
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang ; gang las byung ba dang / de gnyis rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang gang las 'gyur pa de rnams yongs su brjod do //
translated: In this way, the four truths completely explain what the afflictions are, what they arise from, what the purification of those two is, and what they arise from.

original: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa bzhin du'o //üîΩrags pa dang phra ba'i de kho na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa bzhin du'o // rags pa dang phra ba'i de kho na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their order is that in which they are realized.üîΩThe coarse and subtle reality.

original: rags pa'i de kho na ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o ;
analyzed: rags pa'i de kho na ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o ;
translated: The coarse reality is the conventional truth.

original: / phra ba'i de kho na ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: / phra ba'i de kho na ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The subtle reality is the ultimate truth.

original: 'di ltar dang por rags pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dang por rags pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Thus, first, by the coarse, one brings beings to maturity.

original: yongs su smin par gyur nas phra bas rnam par grol bar byed de /
analyzed: yongs su smin par gyur nas phra bas rnam par grol bar byed de /
translated: Having become mature, by the subtle, one liberates them.

original: de'i phyir dang por ni rags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por ni rags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, first, the coarse;

original: phyis ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: phyis ni phra ba'o //
translated: later, the subtle.

original: tshig le'ur @249b byas pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir bzlog se gsungs so //üîΩde la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni rags pa'i da kho na'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur @249b byas pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir bzlog se gsungs so // de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni rags pa'i da kho na'o //
translated: In order to conform to the metrical arrangement, the order is reversed.üîΩTherein, the conventional truth is the coarse reality because it is the object of non-concentrated cognition.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa ni phra ba'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa ni phra ba'i de kho na'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is the subtle reality because it is the object of concentrated cognition.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pas na rags pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pas na rags pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is gross because it is the object of consciousness.

original: ye shes kyi yul yin pas na phra ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul yin pas na phra ba'o //
translated: It is subtle because it is the object of intuition.

original: de kho na thams cad rtsa ba'i de kho nar bsdu bar dam bcas bas na /
analyzed: de kho na thams cad rtsa ba'i de kho nar bsdu bar dam bcas bas na /
translated: Since it was promised that all reality would be included in basic reality,üîΩtherefore it is asked: How should that be understood in basic reality?

original: de'i phyir de rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes dris te de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes dris te de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: brtags pa dang ni shes pa dang // de bzhin brjod pa rags pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: brtags pa dang ni shes pa dang // de bzhin brjod pa rags pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Imagination, intuition, and likewise expression, are gross.

original: brtags pa dang shes pa dang brjod pa rnams ni rags pa'i de kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang shes pa dang brjod pa rnams ni rags pa'i de kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: Imagination, intuition, and expression should be understood as the gross reality.üîΩIn order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: The superficial is threefold.

original: don med pa la gzugs dang bum pa dang snam bu zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob po //
analyzed: don med pa la gzugs dang bum pa dang snam bu zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob po //
translated: The superficial as imagination is the superficial reality that is established as form, pot, cloth, etc. in the absence of any object.

original: kha cig na re gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bye brag gi ming gis brjod pa ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob bo zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bye brag gi ming gis brjod pa ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob bo zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The expression by the names of the nature and the particular of form, feeling, perception, etc., is the imagined reality.

original: kha cig na re brjod pa la ltos nas gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya bar tha snyad 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob bo zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re brjod pa la ltos nas gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya bar tha snyad 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni brtags pa'i kun rdzob bo zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The conventional expression ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù etc., which is dependent on expression, is the imagined reality.üîΩIt is the imagined reality because it does not exist as it is imagined, like mind and mental factors.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the reality of consciousness.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du med pas na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du med pas na kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: shes pa'i kun rdzob ni rnam par rtog pa gang gis gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa snang ba las ;
analyzed: shes pa'i kun rdzob ni rnam par rtog pa gang gis gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa snang ba las ;
translated: The reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: pha rol na med kyang phyi rol na yod pa bzhin du ji ltar rnam par gnas pa ltar dngos po'i ngo bor mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni shes pa'i kun rdzob po //üîΩbrjod pa yang kun rdzob po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol na med kyang phyi rol na yod pa bzhin du ji ltar rnam par gnas pa ltar dngos po'i ngo bor mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni shes pa'i kun rdzob po //üîΩbrjod pa yang kun rdzob po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reality of consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.üîΩThe reality of consciousness is the

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu bar bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu bar bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúinclusion.‚ÄùüîΩThe consummate is beyond thought and expression, but it is taught by synonyms such as emptiness, suchness, with stains, and stainless, and so on.üîΩThe consummate is the ultimate truth.üîΩThe consummate is the ultimate truth.üîΩThe consummate is the ultimate truth.

original: yongs su grub pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang brjod pa las 'das kyang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs kyis bstan pa ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang brjod pa las 'das kyang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs kyis bstan pa ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob bo //
translated: The consummate is the ultimate truth.üîΩThe consummate is the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob rnam pa gsum po des kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid de /üîΩrtsa ba'i de kho nar @250a * //üîΩgo rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob rnam pa gsum po des kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid de / rtsa ba'i de kho nar @250a * // go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The consummate is the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob ni tha snyad do //üîΩbtags pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni tha snyad do // btags pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa ste /

original: de bas na don med pa'i phyir btags pa'i kun rdzob kyis kun brtags pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na don med pa'i phyir btags pa'i kun rdzob kyis kun brtags pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The consummate is the ultimate truth.üîΩThe consummate is

original: don med bzhin du don du mngon par zhen nas shes pa des tha snyad 'dogs pa de ni shes pa'i kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: don med bzhin du don du mngon par zhen nas shes pa des tha snyad 'dogs pa de ni shes pa'i kun rdzob ste /
translated: The conventional of consciousness is the designation of a conventional by a consciousness that, although unreal, is manifestly attached to an object.

original: de ni mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of manifest attachment.

original: de bas na shes pa'i kun rdzob kyi gzhan gyi dbang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'i kun rdzob kyi gzhan gyi dbang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the dependent, which is the conventional of consciousness, is the conventional truth.üîΩThe conventional of expression is that which is expressed by the words such as reality, etc.,

original: chos kyi dbyings brjod du med pa la de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa gang yin pa de ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings brjod du med pa la de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa gang yin pa de ni brjod pa ste /
translated: with regard to the inexpressible realm of truth.

original: des chos kyi dbyings la tha snyad 'dogs pa ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: des chos kyi dbyings la tha snyad 'dogs pa ni brjod pa'i kun rdzob bo //
translated: The conventional of expression is the designation of the realm of truth by that expression.

original: de bas na brjod pa'i kun rdzob kyis yongs su grub pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na brjod pa'i kun rdzob kyis yongs su grub pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the perfected, which is the conventional of expression, is the conventional truth.

original: de la brtags pa dang brjod pa'i kun rdzob gnyis ni skabs su bsdus nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de la brtags pa dang brjod pa'i kun rdzob gnyis ni skabs su bsdus nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'i /
translated: The two, the conventional of imputation and the conventional of expression, should be understood as being posited as included in the context,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as being by nature.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad zin to //
translated: The conventional truth has been explained.

original: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa brjod par bya ste /üîΩde'i phyir / dam pa'i don ni gcig pu'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa brjod par bya ste / de'i phyir / dam pa'i don ni gcig pu'o //
translated: That is to be stated as the ultimate truth.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The ultimate is one.

original: brtags pa dang ni gzhan dbang gnyis ni don dam par mi srid pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang ni gzhan dbang gnyis ni don dam par mi srid pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pur rig par bya'o //
translated: Because the imagined and the other-dependent are impossible in the ultimate, the ultimate truth should be understood as the one reality of the perfected.

original: yongs su grub pa de yang ci'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa de yang ci'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that perfected called the ultimate?

original: de'i phyir / don dang thob dang sgrub pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / don dang thob dang sgrub pa ni //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: don dam rnam pa gsum du 'dod //üîΩces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam rnam pa gsum du 'dod // ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The ultimate is considered to be threefold:

original: don dam pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The ultimate is threefold:

original: don dam pa dang / thob par bya ba don dam pa dang / sgrub pa don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / thob par bya ba don dam pa dang / sgrub pa don dam pa'o //
translated: the ultimate itself, the ultimate as attainment, and the ultimate as spiritual practice.

original: de la don dam pa de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de la don dam pa de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Among them, the ultimate itself is thusness.

original: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The ultimate is the supramundane wisdom.

original: de'i yul yin pas don te /
analyzed: de'i yul yin pas don te /
translated: It is the object of that, so it is the ultimate.

original: dbang po rnams kyi don bzhin du //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi don bzhin du //
translated: Like the object of the senses.

original: de bzhin nyid ni dam pa'i don //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni dam pa'i don //
translated: Reality is the ultimate.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ye shes dam pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ye shes dam pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, because it is the ultimate of intuition.

original: dmigs pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because it is established as the object of intuition.

original: ye shes dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i @250b tshe dmigs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ye shes dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i @250b tshe dmigs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: At that time, it is not an object of intuition because it is not different from intuition.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam snang ba bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam snang ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like the appearance of mere representation.

original: dper na gang dag rnam par rig pa tsam du bzod pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa rnam par rig pa tsam ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gang dag rnam par rig pa tsam du bzod pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa rnam par rig pa tsam ma gtogs par gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, those who accept mere representation do not have the appearance of form, etc. apart from the mere representation of form, etc.

original: thob par bya ba don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: thob par bya ba don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The ultimate to be attained is nirvana,

original: shin tu dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: which is characterized by the transformation of reality that is utterly stainless.

original: ji ltar na don dam pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na don dam pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it called the ultimate?

original: de'i phyir don gyi dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ultimate object.

original: de ni dam pa yang yin la don yang yin pas na don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dam pa yang yin la don yang yin pas na don dam pa ste /
translated: It is the ultimate and also an object, thus it is the ultimate object.

original: de 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mchog yin pas dam pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mchog yin pas dam pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate because it is the highest of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: lam gyi dgos pa yin pas na don to //
analyzed: lam gyi dgos pa yin pas na don to //
translated: It is an object because it is the purpose of the path.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba ni lam gyi dgos pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba ni lam gyi dgos pa ste /
translated: Thus, the attainment of nirvana is the purpose of the path.

original: gnod pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni don to //
analyzed: gnod pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni don to //
translated: Nirvana is the object because it is free from all the faults of harm.

original: 'di ltar nyes pa dang bcas pa la ni don med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyes pa dang bcas pa la ni don med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which has faults is called ‚Äúmeaningless.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa don dam pa ni lam ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa don dam pa ni lam ste /
translated: The ultimate establishment is the path.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i don ni dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don ni dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its object is the ultimate.

original: don ni yul lam dgos pa ste /
analyzed: don ni yul lam dgos pa ste /
translated: An object is a domain or purpose.

original: yul ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yul ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The domain is thusness.

original: dgos pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The purpose is nirvana.

original: yul gyi sgo nas dam pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: yul gyi sgo nas dam pa zhes bya na /
translated: If it is called ultimate from the point of view of the domain,

original: ji ltar na gcig la gcig brten par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig la gcig brten par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could they not be mutually dependent?

original: gcig la gcig brten par gyur na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten par gyur na ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with their being mutually dependent?

original: gtan la bab pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan la bab pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not be established.

original: gcig la gcig brten du zin kyang de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten du zin kyang de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they were mutually dependent, that would not be so,

original: seng ge dang nags bzhin no //
analyzed: seng ge dang nags bzhin no //
translated: like a lion and a forest.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan la /
translated: Ultimate truth is taught to be the perfected nature.

original: lam la ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i cha med pa ma yin pas yongs su grub par mi rung ste /
analyzed: lam la ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i cha med pa ma yin pas yongs su grub par mi rung ste /
translated: But since the path does not have a prior and subsequent part, it is not suitable as perfected.

original: de bas na lam ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na lam ni don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the path is not ultimate truth.

original: yongs su ma grub pas kyang don dam pa'i bden par bsdur mi rung na 'dus ma byas dang 'dus byas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji skad brjod ce na /
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pas kyang don dam pa'i bden par bsdur mi rung na 'dus ma byas dang 'dus byas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji skad brjod ce na /
translated: But if it is not perfected, it is not suitable to include it in ultimate truth. So how can the unconditioned and conditioned be described as the perfected nature?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / 'gyur med phyin ci ma log pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gyur med phyin ci ma log pa //
translated: The unconditioned and the conditioned

original: yongs su grub pa rnam pa gnyis //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa rnam pa gnyis //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Are the two kinds of perfected nature.

original: yang na yongs su grub pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: yang na yongs su grub pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Or else, the consummate is thusness.

original: de yang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral ba nyid pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam gnyis @251a * //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral ba nyid pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam gnyis @251a * //
translated: Since that is free from the two characteristics of the dependent, it is the two, nirvana and the path.

original: yongs su grub pa nyid du mi rung na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas dang / lam zhes bya ba 'dus byas gnyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa nyid du mi rung na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas dang / lam zhes bya ba 'dus byas gnyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: If the consummate is not suitable as nirvana and the path, then how could the unconditioned called nirvana and the conditioned called the path be the consummate nature?

original: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ste /
translated: This is not a proper objection.

original: 'di ltar de la gnyis po med pa ni yongs su grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la gnyis po med pa ni yongs su grub pa nyid de /
translated: Thus the absence of duality in that is the consummate.

original: gnyis po med pa nyid yongs su grub pa zhes de las gzhan dgag par mi byed de /
analyzed: gnyis po med pa nyid yongs su grub pa zhes de las gzhan dgag par mi byed de /
translated: The absence of duality itself is the consummate, and it is not denied that it is other than that.

original: de bas na de las gzhan yang ste /
analyzed: de bas na de las gzhan yang ste /
translated: Therefore, it is also other than that.

original: 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa gnyis kyang yongs su grub pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa gnyis kyang yongs su grub pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The two, unchanging and unmistaken, are also called the consummate.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The unconditioned is nirvana and thusness.

original: 'dus ma byas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med par yongs su 'grub pas yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med par yongs su 'grub pas yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is fully established because it is fully established as unchanging, since it does not change into something else.

original: 'dus byas ni lam gyis bsdus pa la bya'i gzhan la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni lam gyis bsdus pa la bya'i gzhan la ma yin te /
translated: The conditioned is included in the path, not in the others,

original: phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because it is fully established as unmistaken.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir / shes bya'i dngos po la phyin ci log med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes bya'i dngos po la phyin ci log med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says: because there is no error regarding the thing that is to be known.

original: gang gi phyir shes par bya ba la phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir lam yongs su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes par bya ba la phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir lam yongs su grub pa yin te /
translated: Because there is no error regarding the thing that is to be known, therefore the path is fully established.

original: de bas na bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyi ga yang yongs su grub pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyi ga yang yongs su grub pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because both the conditioned and the unconditioned are fully established, there is no contradiction, since they have different intentions.üîΩIn this regard,

original: de la / gcig gis 'jig rten grags pa ste //
analyzed: de la / gcig gis 'jig rten grags pa ste //
translated: one is known in the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du med pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te /üîΩde gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du med pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te / de gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because the imagined nature does not exist as it is described, but the other two natures do exist.üîΩThe imagined nature does not exist in the way it is imagined, but the other two natures do exist.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since the nature of the latter is not understood,

original: dngos po gang la zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so ;
analyzed: dngos po gang la zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so ;
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúIn regard to any entity . . . ‚Äù

original: / brda ni ming dang ming can 'brel par shes pa'o //
analyzed: / brda ni ming dang ming can 'brel par shes pa'o //
translated: A ‚Äúconventional symbol‚Äù is the understanding of the relationship between a name and the object that bears that name.

original: 'dris pa ni de la yang dang yang du sbyor zhing lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa ni de la yang dang yang du sbyor zhing lta ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFamiliarity‚Äù is the repeated application of that understanding and the observation of the object.

original: de la rjes su zhugs pa'i blo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rjes su zhugs pa'i blo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe mind that engages in that . . .‚Äù

original: brda la 'dris pa'i rjes la zhugs pa'i blo gang zhe na /
analyzed: brda la 'dris pa'i rjes la zhugs pa'i blo gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that engages in the familiarity with a conventional symbol?

original: de dag dran pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dran pa ste /
translated: It is the memory of those . . .

original: de ni 'di skad du brda la 'dris pa'i dran pa'i rjes su song ba'i blos 'jig rten pa bstan bcos shes pa dang / de mi shes pa thams cad kyis tha snyad du btags pa'i dngos po gang la la 'di ni sa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba mthun pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du brda la 'dris pa'i dran pa'i rjes su song ba'i blos 'jig rten pa bstan bcos shes pa dang / de mi shes pa thams cad kyis tha snyad du btags pa'i dngos po gang la la 'di ni sa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba mthun pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being said: the world, whether it consists of those who know the treatises or those who do not, has a consensus about the things that are designated conventionally, in terms of the cognition that accords with the memory of the impressions of those things.

original: de ni de kho na bzhin du 'jig rten du grags pa'i phyir @251b de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //üîΩgsum gyis rigs pa'i grags pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de kho na bzhin du 'jig rten du grags pa'i phyir @251b de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o // gsum gyis rigs pa'i grags pa'o //
translated: This is called the reality that is renowned in the world, because it is renowned in the world just as it is.üîΩThe reality that is renowned through reasoning is threefold.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad de rigs pa zhes bya bas na de'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum gyis rigs pa'i grags pa'i de kho nar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad de rigs pa zhes bya bas na de'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum gyis rigs pa'i grags pa'i de kho nar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The reality that is renowned through reasoning is presented as threefold, in terms of the three natures.

original: de yang mi shes te /
analyzed: de yang mi shes te /
translated: This is not understood,

original: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: therefore, in order to teach it,üîΩhe says:

original: gang zag dam pa rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zag dam pa rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe holy persons who are skilled in the meaning of reasoning‚Äù refers to the first two of these four types of persons.

original: de la dam pa dag ni gang dag rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa dag go //
analyzed: de la dam pa dag ni gang dag rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa dag go //
translated: The holy persons are those who are skilled in the meaning of reasoning.

original: rtog ge pa dag ni gang dag dpyod pa can dag ste /
analyzed: rtog ge pa dag ni gang dag dpyod pa can dag ste /
translated: The logicians are those who are skilled in the methods of analysis.

original: snga ma bshad par bsams nas tshig phyi ma brjod do //
analyzed: snga ma bshad par bsams nas tshig phyi ma brjod do //
translated: The author of the treatise intends to explain the first of these two types of persons and therefore mentions the second.

original: yang na dam pa dag ni dge ba ci zhes tshol ba can dag go //
analyzed: yang na dam pa dag ni dge ba ci zhes tshol ba can dag go //
translated: Alternatively, the holy persons are those who seek what is virtuous.

original: rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa dag ni ltos pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang / 'thad pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa bzhi dang mi 'gal ba'i don la mkhas pa dag go //
analyzed: rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa dag ni ltos pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang / 'thad pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa bzhi dang mi 'gal ba'i don la mkhas pa dag go //
translated: They are skilled in the meaning of reasoning because they are skilled in the meaning that is not contradicted by the four principles of reason: dependence, efficacy, logical possibility, and nature.

original: rtog ge ba dag ni rtog pa dang sel nus pa dag dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab la brten nas bstan bcos phyin ci ma log par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ge ba dag ni rtog pa dang sel nus pa dag dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab la brten nas bstan bcos phyin ci ma log par byed pa'o //
translated: The logicians are those who are skilled in the methods of analysis and who, on the basis of the scriptures of the TathƒÅgata, compose treatises that are free of error.

original: dpyod pa can dag ni bdag dang gzhan gyi bstan bcos la mkhas par gyur pa dang / legs pa dang nyes pa dpyod pa dag go //üîΩkha cig las ni dpyod pa can //
analyzed: dpyod pa can dag ni bdag dang gzhan gyi bstan bcos la mkhas par gyur pa dang / legs pa dang nyes pa dpyod pa dag go // kha cig las ni dpyod pa can //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas are those who are skilled in the treatises of themselves and others and who analyze what is good and bad.

original: zhes mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes mi 'byung ste /
translated: Some do not mention the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du /
translated: They say:

original: dam pa zhes brjod pa'i dam pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa zhes brjod pa'i dam pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the highest that is referred to as ‚Äúhighest‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir / rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa dag / ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rigs pa'i don la mkhas pa dag / ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthose skilled in the meaning of reasoning.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang rtog ge pa'i sa dang / bsgom pa'i sa la gnas pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rtog ge pa'i sa dang / bsgom pa'i sa la gnas pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are also of two types because they abide in the stage of logic and the stage of meditation.

original: de'i phyir rtog ge pa dag ces bya ba smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog ge pa dag ces bya ba smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it mentions ‚Äúlogicians.‚Äù

original: de dag las kyang kha cig ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i rjes su 'brang bas na /
analyzed: de dag las kyang kha cig ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa'i rjes su 'brang bas na /
translated: Some of them follow what is renowned in the world.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gsum la brten nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gsum la brten nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbased on the three valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: tshad ma gsum dang mi 'gal bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum dang mi 'gal bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúnot in contradiction with the three valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: tshad ma gsum ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung ngo  //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung ngo  //
translated: The three means of valid knowledge are perception, inference, and scriptural testimony.

original: de la mngon sum ni dbang po lnga las skyes pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa myong ba'i yid do //
analyzed: de la mngon sum ni dbang po lnga las skyes pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa myong ba'i yid do //
translated: Among them, perception is that which arises from the five sense faculties and the mind that experiences pleasure, pain, etc.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don la shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don la shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Inference is the knowledge of an object to be inferred through a reason having the three modes.

original: yid ches bas bstan pa ni lung ste /üîΩyid ches pas ni brdzun @252a * //
analyzed: yid ches bas bstan pa ni lung ste / yid ches pas ni brdzun @252a * //
translated: Scriptural testimony is that which is taught by a trustworthy person.

original: du smra ba'i rgyu dang mi ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: du smra ba'i rgyu dang mi ldan pa dag go //
translated: A trustworthy person is one who is not possessed of the causes of lying.

original: yang na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gis rab tu grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpes bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa de nyid gzhan la sgrub par byed pas tshad ma gsum la brten nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gis rab tu grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpes bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa de nyid gzhan la sgrub par byed pas tshad ma gsum la brten nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Or else, the three means of valid knowledge are perception, inference, and scriptural testimony. The reason that establishes through an example the probandum is that very means of valid knowledge that establishes for another. Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbased on the three means of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas grags pa'i dngos po'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas grags pa'i dngos po'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reason that establishes through reasoning is a well-known entity.

original: 'thad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par byed pa'i thabs yin pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'thad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par byed pa'i thabs yin pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
translated: A proof is a means of understanding what is to be established, and so it is a reason that has the three modes.
