original: 'thad pa'i sgrub pa ni 'thad pa sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: 'thad pa'i sgrub pa ni 'thad pa sgrub pa ste /
translated: A proof of a proof is the establishment of a proof.

original: des rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa'o //
analyzed: des rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa'o //
translated: Because it is to be understood, the three modes of a reason are stated.

original: rigs pa ni thabs te /
analyzed: rigs pa ni thabs te /
translated: Reason is a means.

original: sbyor ba nges pa gang gi rtags kyi tshul gsum brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nges pa gang gi rtags kyi tshul gsum brjod pa'o //
translated: It is a definite application, because the three modes of a reason are stated.

original: yang na 'thad pa ni gzhan du mi srid pa'o //üîΩsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni cha'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'thad pa ni gzhan du mi srid pa'o // sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni cha'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, a proof is an impossibility elsewhere.üîΩThe reasoning of proof is the application of parts.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'o //
translated: The reasoning that establishes a proof is the reasoning that establishes a proof.

original: yang na 'thad pa nyid sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'thad pa nyid sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the reasoning that establishes a proof is to be applied to the sentence.

original: sgrub pa'i rigs pa gzhan dag las dbye ba'i phyir 'thad pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rigs pa gzhan dag las dbye ba'i phyir 'thad pa smos te /
translated: A proof is stated in order to distinguish it from other reasonings.

original: de ltar na tshad ma gsum la brten nas 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas gang grags pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid gsum gyi nang nas gang yang rung ba ste rigs pas grags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshad ma gsum la brten nas 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas gang grags pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid gsum gyi nang nas gang yang rung ba ste rigs pas grags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Any one of them is renowned to reasoning.

original: grags pa'i de kho na bshad zin to //
analyzed: grags pa'i de kho na bshad zin to //
translated: The reality that is renowned has been explained.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul brjod dgos te /
translated: After that, the domain of purity must be stated.

original: de'i phyir / rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe reality of the domain of purity is twofold.‚Äù

original: de yang ji ltar rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is twofold, it says,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe domain of the wisdom that is pure of the obscurations of affliction and the domain of the wisdom that is pure of the obscurations to omniscience.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa ste /
translated: The purity of the obscurations of affliction is the elimination of the obscurations of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The wisdom that purifies the afflictive obstructions or

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed pa'i ye shes ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed pa'i ye shes ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: the wisdom that purifies the afflictive obstructions is the wisdom that purifies the afflictive obstructions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya bar dgos pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya bar dgos pa'am /
translated: The purpose of purifying the afflictive obstructions or

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the cause of that is what is meant.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes de'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni yul zhes pa'i tha @252b tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes de'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni yul zhes pa'i tha @252b tshig go //
translated: The domain of that wisdom that purifies the afflictive obstructions is what is meant by ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the domain of the wisdom that purifies the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad do //
translated: Therein, the afflictive obstructions are all the afflictions and subsidiary afflictions that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: de bas na mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang de dang nye bar spyod pa'i ye shes kyi yul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi de kho na gang yin pa sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams kyi bden pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang de dang nye bar spyod pa'i ye shes kyi yul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi de kho na gang yin pa sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams kyi bden pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the object of the wisdom of seeing, cultivation, and enjoyment is the reality of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, which is called the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: That is the domain of the wisdom that purifies the afflictive obstructions.

original: shes par bya ba ni shes bya ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ba ni shes bya ste /
translated: The knowable is that which is to be known.

original: de ni mdor na rig pa'i gnas lnga dag go //
analyzed: de ni mdor na rig pa'i gnas lnga dag go //
translated: In brief, it is the five sciences.

original: de dag ni nang dang / brda sprod pa dang / gtan tshigs dang / gso ba dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas zhes bya ba thams cad do //
analyzed: de dag ni nang dang / brda sprod pa dang / gtan tshigs dang / gso ba dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas zhes bya ba thams cad do //
translated: They are all called the inner science, grammar, logic, medicine, and arts and crafts.

original: de la ye shes kyi gegs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi gegs su gyur pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Among them, the non-afflicted ignorance that is an obstruction to wisdom is the obstruction to omniscience.

original: de rnam par sbyong ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sar bsdus pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu gcig tu bsdus pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de rnam par sbyong ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sar bsdus pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu gcig tu bsdus pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Its purification is included in the stage of devoted engagement through the faith that conforms to supramundane transcendent wisdom, it is included in the eleven stages such as the Joyous, and it is the transcendent wisdom that is attained subsequently to that.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi rgyud la mnga' ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is present in the mindstreams of bodhisattvas and tathagatas.

original: de ni kun du 'gro ba'i don la sogs pa'i sgo nas de bzhin nyid la dmigs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni kun du 'gro ba'i don la sogs pa'i sgo nas de bzhin nyid la dmigs pas de'i phyir /
translated: And since it is focused on suchness through the universal object and so on,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: suchness is the object of the transcendent wisdom that is the purification of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na bshad pa dang / phra ba'i de kho na bshad pas rnam bar dag pa'i spyod yul rnam pa gnyis kyang bshad zin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na bshad pa dang / phra ba'i de kho na bshad pas rnam bar dag pa'i spyod yul rnam pa gnyis kyang bshad zin na /
translated: Since the two kinds of objects of purified transcendent wisdom have already been explained the suchness of result and cause and the suchness of the subtle,üîΩisn't this statement redundant?

original: 'di brjod pa don med par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /üîΩdon med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di brjod pa don med par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /üîΩdon med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not redundant.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na dang phra ba'i de kho na ni dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na dang phra ba'i de kho na ni dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: Thus, the reality of effect and cause and the subtle reality are explained in order to establish entities.

original: 'dir ni sgrib pa ji ltar rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni sgrib pa ji ltar rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Here, how does obscuration become purified?

original: de'i phyir de skad bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de skad bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught in this way.

original: rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul 'di rnam pa gnyis ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pus brjod de /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul 'di rnam pa gnyis ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pus brjod de /
translated: This twofold domain of purification is expressed by the one perfected nature alone.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned:

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan ni rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi spyod yul ma yin no @253a * //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan ni rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi spyod yul ma yin no @253a * // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other natures are not the domain of the twofold purified knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni gnas ngan len gyi dri ma gnyis kyis dri ma can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni gnas ngan len gyi dri ma gnyis kyis dri ma can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the reason? Because the imagination of what is unreal is defiled by the two defilements of the residues.

original: kun brtags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagined is not, because it does not exist.

original: ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi yul ni chos nyid yin pas rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na ni yongs su grub pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi yul ni chos nyid yin pas rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na ni yongs su grub pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since the object of the two kinds of intuition is reality, the reality of the domain of purity is established by the perfected nature.

original: rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na bshad zin to //
translated: The reality of the domain of purity has been explained.

original: de'i 'og tu bsdu ba'i de kho na brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsdu ba'i de kho na brjod dgos te /
translated: Thereafter, the reality of inclusion should be mentioned,

original: de'i phyir rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba'i de kho na ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes dris pa dang / rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba'i de kho na 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba'i de kho na ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes dris pa dang / rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba'i de kho na 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: so, in order to demonstrate the reality of inclusion in the three basic realities, it is asked, How should the reality of inclusion be understood in the three basic realities?üîΩThe reality of inclusion is taught in the following verse:

original: rgyu dang rnam par rtog pa dang // ming ni rnam pa gnyis su bsdu //üîΩzhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rnam par rtog pa dang // ming ni rnam pa gnyis su bsdu // zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: The causal and the imaginatively constructed are included in the two.

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang kun brtags pa gnyis su bsdu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang kun brtags pa gnyis su bsdu'o //
translated: The dependent and the imagined are included in the two.

original: de la bsdu ba'i de kho na ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni gar 'os par rtsa ba'i de kho nar dngos po lnga dag 'dus par rig par bya ba'i go rims bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bsdu ba'i de kho na ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni gar 'os par rtsa ba'i de kho nar dngos po lnga dag 'dus par rig par bya ba'i go rims bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe reality of inclusion should be applied as appropriate‚Äù means that the five things are included in the basic reality in whatever way is suitable, but not necessarily in the order in which they are listed.

original: dngos po lnga ni rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: dngos po lnga ni rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The five things are the causal-sign, name, conceptualization, suchness, and correct direct-discernment.

original: shes par bya ba thams cad dngos po rnam pa lnga po 'dir bsdu ba'i phyir dngos po rnam pa 'di lnga la bsdu ba'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba thams cad dngos po rnam pa lnga po 'dir bsdu ba'i phyir dngos po rnam pa 'di lnga la bsdu ba'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Because all that is to be known is included in these five things, these five things are called the reality of inclusion.

original: kha cig na re de la rgyu mtshan ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de la rgyu mtshan ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: Some say that the causal-sign in this context is the store consciousness, the defiled mind, and the active forms of consciousness.

original: phan tshun rgyu'i dngos po yin pas rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu'i dngos po yin pas rgyu mtshan no //
translated: They are causal-signs because they are mutually causal.

original: ming ni rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de nyid brjod du med du zin kyang mig brda bzhin du go bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de nyid brjod du med du zin kyang mig brda bzhin du go bar brjod pa'o //
translated: Name is the expression of the very same reason, even though inexpressible, like a wink of the eye.

original: ji skad du smras pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rang bzhin dang bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa khams gsum pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rang bzhin dang bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa khams gsum pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptual differentiation is the mind and mental activities associated with the three realms of existence, which are the nature and the particulars of the reasons as they have been described.

original: stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: Correct direct intuition is supramundane,

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: and it has suchness for its objective support.üîΩTheir order is as follows: since it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.

original: de dag gi go rims ni de la kun nas nyon mongs par gdags pa'i dngos po yin pas na dang por rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni de la kun nas nyon mongs par gdags pa'i dngos po yin pas na dang por rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Since it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes btags pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu ming ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes btags pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu ming ngo //
translated: Since it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.

original: ming ji lta ba @253b de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs par gdags pa'i dngos po la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ming ji lta ba @253b de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs par gdags pa'i dngos po la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Since it is the basis for the designation of the defilement aspect, the reason is mentioned first.üîΩSince it

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa de yang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis 'gag par 'gyur bas na de'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so zhe'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa de yang de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis 'gag par 'gyur bas na de'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so zhe'o //
translated: Since that defilement is stopped by suchness and right knowledge, after that there is suchness and right knowledge.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni 'khrul pa ste //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni 'khrul pa ste //
translated: The cause of error is error,

original: de yi rgyu ni gnas ngan len //
analyzed: de yi rgyu ni gnas ngan len //
translated: and its cause is negative reflexüîΩaction.

original: de bas 'khrul pa de yi rgyu //
analyzed: de bas 'khrul pa de yi rgyu //
translated: Therefore, that error has a cause,

original: rang bzhin zhi bde shes pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhi bde shes pa //
translated: and its nature is peace.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dngos po lnga'i don to zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dngos po lnga'i don to zhe'o //
translated: This verse explains the meaning of the five things.

original: de la nang gi mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs par bsdus pa'i 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs par bsdus pa'i 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Therein, the cause of error of the internal consciousnesses such as eye consciousness is the error included in external form, etc., and the eye, etc.

original: phyi nang gi 'khrul pa de dag gi rgyu ni gnas ngan len te /
analyzed: phyi nang gi 'khrul pa de dag gi rgyu ni gnas ngan len te /
translated: The cause of that internal and external error is negative reflex action,

original: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags so //
translated: and that is the instinct in the store consciousness.

original: bag chags de'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi 'khrul pa de nyid do //
analyzed: bag chags de'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi 'khrul pa de nyid do //
translated: The cause of that latent impression is that very internal and external error.

original: de lta bas na de la brjod pa 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta bas na de la brjod pa 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, the expression is applied to it.

original: brjod pa'i dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags gnas so //
analyzed: brjod pa'i dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags gnas so //
translated: By the power of the expression, the latent impression abides in the store consciousness.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The statement ‚Äúnaturally peaceful‚Äù refers to thusness.

original: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the dharma-realm because it is naturally free from affliction.

original: de shes pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa lam du gtogs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa lam du gtogs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe knowledge of that‚Äù refers to the knowledge that is included in the path and that has thusness as its object.

original: de la rgyu dang rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //
translated: Among those, the two‚Äîcause and conceptualization‚Äîare included in the other-dependent because they are produced by causes and conditions.

original: ming ni kun brtags par zhes bya ba la ming ji lta ba bzhin du don med pas ming ni kun brtags par bsdu'o //
analyzed: ming ni kun brtags par zhes bya ba la ming ji lta ba bzhin du don med pas ming ni kun brtags par bsdu'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúname is the imagined‚Äù means that name is included in the imagined because the object does not exist as it is expressed in the name.

original: de ltar na skabs yin pa'i phyir kun brtags par ming bsdus kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na skabs yin pa'i phyir kun brtags par ming bsdus kyi /
translated: Thus, name is included in the imagined because it is the occasion for that.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not included in the essential nature.

original: ngo bo nyid med par grub pa las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyu la sogs pa dngos po lngas ma bsdus so zhes gang bshad pa dang 'gal ba med do /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par grub pa las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyu la sogs pa dngos po lngas ma bsdus so zhes gang bshad pa dang 'gal ba med do /
translated: This does not contradict the explanation in the Establishment of the Absence of Nature that the imagined nature is not included in the five things such as cause because the imagined nature is not included in the essential nature.

original: der ni ngo bo nyid bsdu bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der ni ngo bo nyid bsdu bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is asserted that the essential nature is included in the essential nature.

original: yang dag ye shes rab kho na //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag ye shes rab kho na // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reality of the perfect is just perfect wisdom.

original: rtag tu'am mdzes pa'i de kho na ste de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rtag tu'am mdzes pa'i de kho na ste de bzhin nyid do //
translated: This is the reality of the permanent or the beautiful, that is, suchness.

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //üîΩde bzhin nyid dang yang dag @254a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so // de bzhin nyid dang yang dag @254a * //
translated: The nondual wisdom that focuses on emptiness and the pure mundane wisdom that is attained subsequently are perfect wisdom.

original: pa'i ye shes de gnyis ni 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci log med pa'i yongs su grub pas go rims bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pus bsdus so //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes de gnyis ni 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci log med pa'i yongs su grub pas go rims bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig pus bsdus so //
translated: These two, suchness and perfect wisdom, are the perfect nature because they are the perfect nature that is unchanging and nonerroneous, respectively.

original: bsdu ba'i de kho na bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i de kho na bshad zin to //
translated: The reality of compilation has been explained.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na la rnam pa du ma yod pa dang / de rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar bsdu ba mi shes nas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na la rnam pa du ma yod pa dang / de rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar bsdu ba mi shes nas de'i phyir /
translated: One does not understand the manifold aspects of the reality of differentiation and how it is included in basic reality, therefore,

original: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes dris pa dang de'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes dris pa dang de'i phyir /
translated: one asks: How should the reality of differentiation be understood in basic reality?

original: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says: The reality of differentiation is sevenfold.

original: gang zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What are they? Therefore, he says:

original: 'jug pa'i de kho na dang mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i de kho na dang mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
translated: The reality of engagement, the reality of characteristics, etc.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid nas yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bar du de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bka' stsal pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir 'jug pa'i de kho na nas /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid nas yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bar du de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun bka' stsal pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir 'jug pa'i de kho na nas /
translated: The seven kinds of suchness taught in the Samdhinirmocana Sutra, from the suchness of engagement to the suchness of correct practice, are the reality of engagement, etc.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na'i bar du rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na rnam pa bdun du bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na'i bar du rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na rnam pa bdun du bshad do //
translated: The reality of thorough accomplishment is explained as the seven kinds of reality of differentiation.

original: de la 'jug pa'i de kho na ni gang 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i de kho na ni gang 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The reality of engagement is the beginningless and endless cyclic existence.

original: de nyid 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: That itself is the reality of the suchness of engagement.

original: 'di ltar de ni nam yang thog ma dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni nam yang thog ma dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it never becomes endowed with a beginning.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de kho na ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de kho na ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: The reality of characteristics is the selflessness of persons and things.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: That itself is the reality of the suchness of characteristics because it does not change into something else.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de kho na ni chos rnams kyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do //üîΩkha cig na re rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sam /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de kho na ni chos rnams kyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do // kha cig na re rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sam /
translated: The reality of representation is the mere representation of things.

original: rnam par rig pa'i gnas 'di ni rnam par rig pa'i de kho na'o zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i gnas 'di ni rnam par rig pa'i de kho na'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the reality of representation is nonconceptual intuition or the basis of representation.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de kho na ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de kho na ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The reality of representation is called the thusness of representation because it does not change into something else.

original: gnas pa'i de kho na ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i de kho na ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The reality of abiding is the truth of suffering,

original: 'du byed rnam sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the compositional factors abide in suffering.

original: de nyid rtag par de bzhin pas na de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rtag par de bzhin pas na de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Since that very [suffering] is always just so, it is thusness.

original: log par sgrub pa'i de kho na ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i de kho na ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: The reality of wrong practice is the truth of origination,

original: de yang gang 'du byed de dag la yon tan du lta bas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gang 'du byed de dag la yon tan du lta bas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that [suffering] is produced by the view of the qualities of those compositional factors.

original: rnam par dag pa'i kho na ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i kho na ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The reality of purification is the purification of the afflictive obstructions,

original: de ni de bzhin nyid dang 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid dang 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: and that is the thusness and the truth of cessation.

original: kha cig na re gnas gyur pa'i bdag nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re gnas gyur pa'i bdag nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the truth of cessation itself is the reality of transformation.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na @254b ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na @254b ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The reality of right practice is the truth of the path.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par rig pa'i de kho na ni tshul bzhin du sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par rig pa'i de kho na ni tshul bzhin du sbyor ba ste /
translated: Others say: The reality of representation is correct application.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par rig pa'i de kho na yang lam gyi bden pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par rig pa'i de kho na yang lam gyi bden pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: The reality of correct achievement and the reality of representation are the truth of the path.

original: de kho na gsum po 'di dag kyang rtag tu de bzhin bas de bzhin nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na gsum po 'di dag kyang rtag tu de bzhin bas de bzhin nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since these three realities are always just as they are, they are called suchness.

original: de la 'jug pa de kho na rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa de kho na rnam pa gnyis /
translated: The reality of engagement is twofold.üîΩThe root reality should be known as the imagined and the reality of the other-dependent.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba de la 'jug pa ni tshe'i rgyun thog ma med pa can te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba de la 'jug pa ni tshe'i rgyun thog ma med pa can te /
translated: The reality of engagement is the beginningless continuum of life.

original: de ni med pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni med pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is the imagined nature.

original: rgyun de su dag gi yin pa de dag ni rgyus rab tu phye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rgyun de su dag gi yin pa de dag ni rgyus rab tu phye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Those who possess that continuum are the reality of the other-dependent because they are distinguished by cause.

original: de ltar gang dag gis yin pa dang / 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i de kho na zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang dag gis yin pa dang / 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i de kho na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that by which and that into which there is entry is taught to be the reality of entry.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe rnams kyi 'byung ba thog ma med pa can ni 'khor bar 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe rnams kyi 'byung ba thog ma med pa can ni 'khor bar 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the beginningless occurrence of the afflictions, karma, and life is called the entry into cyclic existence.

original: de yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: de yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: And that is distinguished by the adherence to the imagined reality.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / 'jug ste kho na rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jug ste kho na rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Entry is twofold.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The reality of the root is mentioned.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩgnas pa dang ni ngan par zhugs //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gnas pa dang ni ngan par zhugs //
translated: Similarly,üîΩAbiding and bad practice.

original: zhes bya ba la log par sgrub pa ni ngan par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la log par sgrub pa ni ngan par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Bad practice is wrong practice.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gnyis su'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis rgyu dang rkyen gyis rab tu phye ba dang / kun rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gnas pa dang / log par sgrub pa'i de kho na rnam pa gnyis su bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i de kho na rnam pa gnyis su'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis rgyu dang rkyen gyis rab tu phye ba dang / kun rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gnas pa dang / log par sgrub pa'i de kho na rnam pa gnyis su bsdu ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the two kinds of basic reality are included in the two kinds of reality of suffering and origination, which are distinguished by cause and condition, and in the two kinds of reality of misapprehension and wrong practice, because they are the objects of imagination.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par rig dang dag / yang dag sgrub pa gcig pu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par rig dang dag / yang dag sgrub pa gcig pu'o //
translated: The reality of characteristics, the reality of representation,üîΩthe reality of purification, and the reality of right practice.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / rnam par rig pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par dag pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / rnam par rig pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par dag pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na ste /
translated: The reality of characteristics, the reality of representation, the reality of purification, and the reality of right practice.

original: de kho na 'di bzhi ni rtsa ba'i de kho na gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: de kho na 'di bzhi ni rtsa ba'i de kho na gcig kho na ste /
translated: These four realities are just one basic reality,

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: because they are the perfected nature.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang rnam par dag pa'i de kho na gnyis ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang rnam par dag pa'i de kho na gnyis ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The reality of characteristic and the reality of purification are the perfected nature because they are fully accomplished without changing into something else.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na gnyis ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de kho na dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho na gnyis ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The reality of representation and the reality of right practice are the perfected nature because they are fully accomplished without error.

original: 'di la 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang / log par sgrub pa'i de kho na @255a * //
analyzed: 'di la 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang / log par sgrub pa'i de kho na @255a * //
translated: Here, the reality of engagement, the reality of abiding, and the reality of wrong practice

original: gsum gyis ni sems can rnams mnyam par bstan to //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni sems can rnams mnyam par bstan to //
translated: demonstrate the equality of sentient beings.

original: mtshan nyid dang rnam par rig pa'i de kho na gnyis kyis ni chos mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang rnam par rig pa'i de kho na gnyis kyis ni chos mnyam pa'o //
translated: The reality of characteristic and the reality of representation demonstrate the equality of phenomena.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de kho nas ni byang chub mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de kho nas ni byang chub mnyam pa'o //
translated: The reality of purification demonstrates the equality of enlightenment.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho nas ni shes rab mnyam par bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de kho nas ni shes rab mnyam par bstan to //
translated: The reality of right practice demonstrates the equality of wisdom.üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / sems can mnyam par gsum gyis brjod //
analyzed: smras pa / sems can mnyam par gsum gyis brjod //
translated: The equality of sentient beings is expressed in three ways.

original: chos rnams mnyam pa gnyis kyis te //
analyzed: chos rnams mnyam pa gnyis kyis te //
translated: The equality of phenomena is in two ways.

original: de ltar byang chub blo mnyam par //üîΩre re rab tu bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub blo mnyam par // re re rab tu bstan pa yin //
translated: Thus, the equality of enlightenment isüîΩtaught in each one.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na'i 'og tu mkhas pa'i de kho na bshad de /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na'i 'og tu mkhas pa'i de kho na bshad de /
translated: After the reality of differentiation, the reality of the expert is explained.

original: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that, it is said:

original: mkhas de kho na rnam bcu ni //
analyzed: mkhas de kho na rnam bcu ni //
translated: The reality of the expert is tenfold,

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'o //üîΩzhes gsungs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'o // zhes gsungs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the antidote to the view of self.

original: phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu lta ba rnam ba bcu po de yang ji lta bu yin pa de mi shes nas /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu lta ba rnam ba bcu po de yang ji lta bu yin pa de mi shes nas /
translated: Since it is not understood what the ten kinds of views of self are in regard to the aggregates, etc.,üîΩtherefore, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat are those ten kinds of views of self in regard to the aggregates, etc.?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu lta ba rnam pa bcu po de dag ji lta zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu lta ba rnam pa bcu po de dag ji lta zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, it is said:üîΩOne, cause, experiencer,üîΩdoer, controller,üîΩmaster, permanent,

original: gcig dang rgyu dang za ba dang // byed pa dang ni dbang sgyur dang // bdag po'i don dang rtag pa dang // nyon mongs pa dang dag pa'i gnas //
analyzed: gcig dang rgyu dang za ba dang // byed pa dang ni dbang sgyur dang // bdag po'i don dang rtag pa dang // nyon mongs pa dang dag pa'i gnas //
translated: abode of defilement and purity,

original: rnal 'byor can dang ma grol grol //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can dang ma grol grol //
translated: yogic practitioner, liberated and not liberated‚Äî

original: de dag la ni bdag tu lta //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag la ni bdag tu lta //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: those are the views of self.

original: phung po la sogs pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The aggregates, etc. are supplied.

original: bdag med pa la 'dzin pa rnam pa 'di bcu ni zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir med pa la 'dzin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag med pa la 'dzin pa rnam pa 'di bcu ni zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir med pa la 'dzin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: These ten kinds of grasping at the non-existent self are called the grasping at the non-existent self because of the non-existence of the self.

original: gal te bdag med na gzung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i 'dzin pa ji ltar yul med pa la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na gzung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i 'dzin pa ji ltar yul med pa la 'jug ce na /
translated: If there is no self, how can the grasping which is dependent on the other, the object, engage without an object?

original: 'di ni yul med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yul med pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not without an object.

original: phung po la sogs pa la 'jug go ;
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la 'jug go ;
translated: It engages the aggregates, etc.

original: / de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen por phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu bshad do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de dag gi gnyen por phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the ten kinds of skill in the aggregates, etc. are explained as the counteragents to those.

original: ji ltar na 'di phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu 'dzin gyi bdag ni yod pa ma yin par nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di phung po la sogs pa la bdag tu 'dzin gyi bdag ni yod pa ma yin par nges she na /
translated: How is it that one grasps the self in the aggregates, etc. and not that the self exists?

original: 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa ma gtogs bar bdag ces bya ba rigs pas yongs su brtags na dmigs su med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa ma gtogs bar bdag ces bya ba rigs pas yongs su brtags na dmigs su med do //
translated: Thus, when the so-called self is investigated logically, it is not perceived apart from the aggregates, etc.

original: bdag tu smra ba dag bdag gi bya ba dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang phung po la sogs pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag bdag gi bya ba dang rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang phung po la sogs pa la 'jug ste /
translated: All the activities and natures of the self are attributed to the aggregates, etc.

original: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin par mngon no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is evident that the aggregates, etc. are the bases of the self-habit.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa rnams ni rnam pa 'di bcus bdag tu @255b 'dzin pa 'byung gi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa rnams ni rnam pa 'di bcus bdag tu @255b 'dzin pa 'byung gi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: Those who cling to the self do so in ten ways, not in any other way.

original: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa thams cad kyi gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa thams cad kyi gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the expertise in the aggregates, etc. should be understood as the antidote to all self-habits.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gcig pur 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pur 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The habit of apprehending the one is the grasping of the five appropriated aggregates as a unitary self.

original: de'i gnyen por phung po la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por phung po la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The expertise in the aggregates is the antidote to that.

original: rgyur 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas bsgo ba'i phyir bdag la rgyur 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas bsgo ba'i phyir bdag la rgyur 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The habit of apprehending the cause is the grasping of the self as the cause because the five appropriated aggregates are directed by the self, like an army is directed by a general.

original: de'i gnyen por khams la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por khams la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The expertise in the elements is the antidote to that.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, the other views should be explained as discordant with their antidotes.

original: yang na bdag nyid las thams cad 'byung ngo snyam pa 'di ni rgyud 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid las thams cad 'byung ngo snyam pa 'di ni rgyud 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Or else, the view that everything arises from a self is the view that the self is the appropriator.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu tshe 'di la 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i rgyu bdag yin par sems pa ni rgyur 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu tshe 'di la 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i rgyu bdag yin par sems pa ni rgyur 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that the self is the cause of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is the view that the self is the cause.

original: za bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sems yin pa'i phyir bdag ni za ba'o //
analyzed: za bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sems yin pa'i phyir bdag ni za ba'o //
translated: The view that the self is the consumer is the mind, because the self is the consumer.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba ni sems med pa'i phyir bza' ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba ni sems med pa'i phyir bza' ba'o //
translated: The view that the self is the consumed is the body, because the body is consumed, since it is not conscious.

original: yang na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi bar du skye ba gang yin pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu la za bar byed do snyam pa ni za bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi bar du skye ba gang yin pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu la za bar byed do snyam pa ni za bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the view that the self is the consumer is the view that the self is the consumer of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma in the intermediate existence that arises between the two karmas.

original: byed par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i las rnams bdag nyid kyis byed par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byed par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i las rnams bdag nyid kyis byed par 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúapprehension of the agent‚Äù is the apprehension that the self is the agent of good and bad actions.

original: yang na byed pa dang ldan pa gang zhig bya ba de dang de dag byed pa ni bdag go zhes byed par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na byed pa dang ldan pa gang zhig bya ba de dang de dag byed pa ni bdag go zhes byed par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the apprehension of the agent is the apprehension that the self is the agent of this or that action, in the sense that it possesses the action.

original: rang dbang du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rang dgar dbang byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag go //üîΩdbang de bya ba gang yin pa de ni bdag go zhes bya bar 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rang dgar dbang byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag go // dbang de bya ba gang yin pa de ni bdag go zhes bya bar 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúapprehension of independence‚Äù is the apprehension that the self is the one that controls things as it wishes.üîΩOr else, the apprehension of independence is the apprehension that the self is the one that controls the action.

original: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu 'byung ba la dbang byed do snyam pa ni rang dbang du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu 'byung ba la dbang byed do snyam pa ni rang dbang du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the apprehension of independence is the thought that the self controls the arising of effects from their causes.

original: bdag por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang rje bo dang dbang phyug gang yin pa de ni bdag go snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: bdag por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang rje bo dang dbang phyug gang yin pa de ni bdag go snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúapprehension of ownership‚Äù is the thought that the self is the owner, the lord, the almighty.

original: yang na 'bras bu dang mthun par de la spyod pa'i bdag po ni bdag go snyam du sems pa ni bdag por 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu dang mthun par de la spyod pa'i bdag po ni bdag go snyam du sems pa ni bdag por 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the self is the master who experiences the results in accordance with the self.

original: rtag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa dngos po rnam pa lngas rnam par ma dag kyang bdag rtag pa kho na'o //üîΩgzhan du nam byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud zos pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa dang / so sor ngo shes pa yang med @256a * //
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa dngos po rnam pa lngas rnam par ma dag kyang bdag rtag pa kho na'o // gzhan du nam byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud zos pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa dang / so sor ngo shes pa yang med @256a * //
translated: The belief in permanence is the belief that the self is permanent, even though the cause and so on are impure in five ways.

original: par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no contact with what has been done, no loss of what has been done, and likewise no memory and no recognition.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnal 'byor can du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro // rnal 'byor can du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The belief in defilement and purification is the belief that the self is the basis of defilement and purification.üîΩThe belief in yoga is the belief that the self is the yogi.

original: bdag la yid 'dzin pa ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bdag la yid 'dzin pa ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The mind is the yogi, because it is the self that is applied to the mind.

original: yang na dbugs dang yid 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dbugs dang yid 'gog pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the cessation of the breath and the mind.

original: bdag dang yid sbyor ba'i khyad par ni rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: bdag dang yid sbyor ba'i khyad par ni rnal 'byor te /
translated: The difference between the self and the mind is yoga.

original: de la 'di yod pa ni rnal 'byor can no //
analyzed: de la 'di yod pa ni rnal 'byor can no //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ is one who has this.

original: ma grol ba dang grol ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag sngar bcings pa las grol lo snyam du rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma grol ba dang grol ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag sngar bcings pa las grol lo snyam du rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI was bound before and now I am liberated‚Äù is the conception of the bound and the liberated.

original: mkhas pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar 'du shes na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag rtsa ba'i de kho nar ji ltar 'du shes na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How are these ten types of expertise included in the three natures?

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa yin na /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa yin na /
translated: Expertise is expertise in the aggregates and so on.

original: de ngo bo nyid gsum po dag tu ji ltar 'dus te /
analyzed: de ngo bo nyid gsum po dag tu ji ltar 'dus te /
translated: How are they included in the three natures?

original: mi srid do snyam nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: mi srid do snyam nas dris pa'o //
translated: It is impossible, one might think, and so this is asked.

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid gsum du phung po lnga la sogs pa de dag 'dus so zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i yul la 'dir mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod kyi mkhas pa de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid gsum du phung po lnga la sogs pa de dag 'dus so zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i yul la 'dir mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod kyi mkhas pa de nyid ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates and so on are included in the three natures in the following way. Here the term expertise refers to the domain of expertise, not to the expertise itself.

original: de lta bas na mkhas pa'i de kho na skabs kyis der bsdu ba'i dngos po ni ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mkhas pa'i de kho na skabs kyis der bsdu ba'i dngos po ni ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, expertise should be understood as not being a thing that is included in reality.

original: 'di lta ste dper na 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na lam gyi bden pa gsum du 'dus par bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na lam gyi bden pa gsum du 'dus par bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the three realities of the path are explained as being included in the reality of result and cause.

original: de nyid ji lta 'dus pa'ang ma shes nas /
analyzed: de nyid ji lta 'dus pa'ang ma shes nas /
translated: Since it is not known how they are included,üîΩit is asked, ‚ÄúHow are they included?‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'dus shes na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus shes na zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: kun du rtog dang rnam rtog don //
analyzed: kun du rtog dang rnam rtog don //
translated: Imagination and the object of imagination

original: chos nyid don gyi de dag der //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos nyid don gyi de dag der // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are the reality of the object in that.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum du phung po la sogs pa de dag 'dus so zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum du phung po la sogs pa de dag 'dus so zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The meaning is that those aggregates, etc. are included in the three realities.

original: de la khams la sogs pa pas sngar bstan pa'i phyir phung po rnams thog mar bsdus la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la khams la sogs pa pas sngar bstan pa'i phyir phung po rnams thog mar bsdus la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Since the elements, etc. were taught previously, the aggregates should be explained first, and they are included in that.

original: de dag las kyang gzugs su bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las kyang gzugs su bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: And among them, form should be included.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therefore, form is threefold.

original: gang zhe na kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang ; rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: gang zhe na kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang ; rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
translated: What are the three? Imagined form, conceptually differentiated form, and the reality of form.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is imagined form?

original: gang gzugs kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni da'ang gang ming du dmigs pa ma gtogs par de la yul gyi ngo bo dngos por yongs su rtog pa @256b ste ;
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni da'ang gang ming du dmigs pa ma gtogs par de la yul gyi ngo bo dngos por yongs su rtog pa @256b ste ;
translated: The imagined nature of form is that which is imagined as the nature of an object, apart from the name that is apprehended.

original: de gtan med pa'i phyir kun brtags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gtan med pa'i phyir kun brtags zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it does not exist at all, it is called the imagined.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni gang gzugs ni gang gzugs gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la rag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni gang gzugs ni gang gzugs gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la rag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The discriminated form is that which is imagined as the dependent nature of form. It is dependent on causes and conditions.

original: ci'i phyir 'di rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the discriminated form?

original: de'i phyir de la gzugs su rnam par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gzugs su rnam par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one discriminates form in regard to it.

original: 'di ltar de kho na ma mthong ba rnams kyis yongs su ma shes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de kho na ma mthong ba rnams kyis yongs su ma shes te /
translated: Thus, those who do not see reality do not understand it.

original: gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la gzugs su 'du shes nas gzugs la mngon par zhen par byed de /
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la gzugs su 'du shes nas gzugs la mngon par zhen par byed de /
translated: Consciousness appears as form, and having the notion of form, one becomes attached to form.

original: dper na phung po la bdag tu 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phung po la bdag tu 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the self that is grasped in the aggregates.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi dbang la rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi dbang la rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the dependent is called ‚Äúimagined form.‚Äù

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni gang gzugs kyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang kun brtags pa'i gzugs de dag dang bral ba'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni gang gzugs kyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang kun brtags pa'i gzugs de dag dang bral ba'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The reality of form is the perfected nature of form. This is emptiness, the nature of the freedom from the imagined form and the dependent form.

original: gzugs ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gsum du phye ste ngo bo nyid gsum du bsdus pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang /
analyzed: gzugs ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gsum du phye ste ngo bo nyid gsum du bsdus pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang /
translated: Just as with form, the aggregates of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, and the elements, sense bases, and so on, should be applied in the same way.

original: khams dang ; skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / dus gsum dang / bden pa bzhi dang / theg pa gsum dang / 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: khams dang ; skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / dus gsum dang / bden pa bzhi dang / theg pa gsum dang / 'dus byas dang /
translated: the elements, the sense bases, the links of dependent origination, the possible and impossible, the faculties, the three times, the four truths, the three vehicles, the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas te tshor ba la sogs pa dang / khams la sogs pa de dag kyang kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas te tshor ba la sogs pa dang / khams la sogs pa de dag kyang kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum gsum du phye ste /
translated: and the unconditioned. These elements and so forth are also divided into three types by way of the imagined, the dependent, and the reality nature.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum du bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum du bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: They should be subsumed within the three natures.

original: de la gzugs su snang ba rnams la gzung ba'i dngos por rtog pa bzhin du tshor ba la sogs par snang ba de la /
analyzed: de la gzugs su snang ba rnams la gzung ba'i dngos por rtog pa bzhin du tshor ba la sogs par snang ba de la /
translated: With regard to that, just as there is the imagination of the entity of the apprehended in the appearance of form, so too in the appearance of feeling and so on,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po gtan med pa bzhin du yang kun rtog pa gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i tshor ba nas kun brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po gtan med pa bzhin du yang kun rtog pa gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i tshor ba nas kun brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Just as there is no such thing as the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, so too, all the conceptualizations are the imagined feeling, up to the imagined consciousness.

original: gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog par byed pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i tshor ba @257a * //
analyzed: gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog par byed pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i tshor ba @257a * //
translated: The discriminated feeling, up to the discriminated consciousness, are those which are discriminated as the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: nas rnam par brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nas rnam par brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The ultimate feeling, up to the ultimate consciousness, are those which are the object of the ultimate wisdom.

original: chos nyid kyi tshor ba ni gang tshor ba'i yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi tshor ba ni gang tshor ba'i yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The reality-realm feeling is that which is the perfected nature of feeling.

original: chos nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The reality-realm consciousness should be similarly described.

original: de bzhin du khams dang skye mched rnams la yang ci rigs par rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang skye mched rnams la yang ci rigs par rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The elements and sense bases should be similarly described in detail, as is appropriate.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba nas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar du ming gis brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba nas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar du ming gis brjod par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever things are expressed by names, from form and feeling up to the compounded and the uncompounded, should be understood as the imagined, the relative, and the perfect.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'o //üîΩgdags pa'i gnas kyi dngos po yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'o // gdags pa'i gnas kyi dngos po yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The imagined is so called because form, etc., are imagined to be essences.üîΩThe relative is so called because it is the basis of designation.

original: de nyid rkyen gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is dependent on other conditions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dang gtan dang bral ba nyid yongs su grub pa'o ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dang gtan dang bral ba nyid yongs su grub pa'o ;
translated: The perfect is so called because it is the complete absence of the entity of form, etc.

original: / gzhan gyi dbang nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por ming du brjod kyi kun brtags pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por ming du brjod kyi kun brtags pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: The relative is called by the name of the entity of form, etc., but not the imagined.

original: kun brtags par rnam par rtog pa don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags par rnam par rtog pa don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But is not the imagination of what is unreal pointless?

original: don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not pointless.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because form and so on are imputed to be their nature.

original: ji lta ji lta bur don la ming 'jug pa de lta de lta bur med mod kyi byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: ji lta ji lta bur don la ming 'jug pa de lta de lta bur med mod kyi byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen to //
translated: As names are applied to objects, they do not exist in that way, but fools are attached to their nature.

original: de'ang log par mngon par zhen pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i don du ma yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang log par mngon par zhen pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i don du ma yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow do you know that is a mistaken attachment and not the correct meaning?‚Äù

original: mthun nam mi mthun yang rung ste /
analyzed: mthun nam mi mthun yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is similar or not,

original: ming dang don gnyis kyis brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i dngos po ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang don gnyis kyis brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa'i dngos po ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the object that is expressed and the expression, the name, are stopped.

original: gal te shing la sogs pa'i sgra dang de dag gi don rnams tha dad pa'i ngo bo ma yin du zin na /
analyzed: gal te shing la sogs pa'i sgra dang de dag gi don rnams tha dad pa'i ngo bo ma yin du zin na /
translated: If the words such as ‚Äútree‚Äù and their meanings were not different in nature,

original: de lta na ni ming dang de dag gi don gyi ngo bo tha mi dad pa'i phyir don bzhin du brjod pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ming dang de dag gi don gyi ngo bo tha mi dad pa'i phyir don bzhin du brjod pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because the name and their meanings would not be different in nature, the expression would be stopped, just like the object.

original: don kyang ming gi ngo bo dang tha mi dad na brjod par bya ba las nyams par 'gyur te nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don kyang ming gi ngo bo dang tha mi dad na brjod par bya ba las nyams par 'gyur te nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the meaning is not different from the nature of the name, then it would be devoid of the object of expression, because there would be no cause for certainty.

original: yang na ming gis brjod pa yang gzhan la don gyi brjod par bya ba yang gzhan du 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ming gis brjod pa yang gzhan la don gyi brjod par bya ba yang gzhan du 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, if the expression by the name is one thing and the object of expression by the meaning is another, there would be an infinite regress.

original: don gcig la ming mang po'am /
analyzed: don gcig la ming mang po'am /
translated: If there are many names for one meaning,

original: ming gcig la yang don mang por gyur na @257b du ma'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming gcig la yang don mang por gyur na @257b du ma'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: or if there is one name for many meanings, there would be a multiplicity of natures.

original: gcig ni du ma'i ngo bor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig ni du ma'i ngo bor mi rung ngo //
translated: One cannot be the nature of many.

original: dngos po med pa'i brjod pa dag kyang don bzhin du med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i brjod pa dag kyang don bzhin du med par 'gyur te /
translated: Expressions of non-entities would also be non-existent, like their meaning.

original: de'i don dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their meaning is non-existent.

original: yang na ming yod pa'i phyir de'i don kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ming yod pa'i phyir de'i don kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, because the name exists, its meaning would also exist.

original: mi mthun pa yang sgra dang mthun par don shes pa med de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa yang sgra dang mthun par don shes pa med de /
translated: And there is no cognition of meaning in accordance with the sound, even if it is discordant.

original: de la shing ni sgra nyid de don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la shing ni sgra nyid de don ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the sound itself is the tree, not the meaning.

original: don ni shing yang ma yin shing ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni shing yang ma yin shing ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is neither a tree nor not a tree.

original: de'i phyir shing gi sgra'i don ni shing zhes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing gi sgra'i don ni shing zhes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word tree would not be the object tree,

original: de'i don ni shing gi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don ni shing gi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its meaning would not be the nature of a tree.

original: de ltar sgra dang don gnyis rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po las ldog go //
analyzed: de ltar sgra dang don gnyis rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po las ldog go //
translated: Thus, the two, the word and the meaning, are excluded from the relationship of the expressed and the expresser.

original: mi mthun na yang nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun na yang nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if they are not in agreement, there would be no cause for certainty, and so there would be no certainty in the expressed and the expresser.

original: ming gis don bskyed dam gsal bar byed grang na /
analyzed: ming gis don bskyed dam gsal bar byed grang na /
translated: If one asks whether a name generates or reveals an object,

original: de la skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it does not generate it,

original: skyes zin pa'i don la ming 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i don la ming 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a name is given to an object that has already arisen.

original: yang dang yang ming 'dogs pas skyes zin pa yang yang dang yang bskyed dgos par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang ming 'dogs pas skyes zin pa yang yang dang yang bskyed dgos par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow, absurdly, that what has already arisen would have to be generated again and again, because the name is given again and again.

original: gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It also does not reveal it,

original: 'di ltar don rtogs nas ming 'dogs na rtogs zin pa la ni gsal bar bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar don rtogs nas ming 'dogs na rtogs zin pa la ni gsal bar bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: because if a name is given after the object is understood, then it is not correct to say that what has already been understood is being revealed.

original: ming de nyid kyis don de nyid yin par su de mi shes pa gzhan dag gis ni mi rtogs so //üîΩde nyid don de nyid gsal bar byed pa yang yin /
analyzed: ming de nyid kyis don de nyid yin par su de mi shes pa gzhan dag gis ni mi rtogs so // de nyid don de nyid gsal bar byed pa yang yin /
translated: But no one else, who does not know that this name applies to this object, understands it.

original: gsal bar mi byed pa yang yin zhes bya bar ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: gsal bar mi byed pa yang yin zhes bya bar ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible to say that the name both reveals and does not reveal the object.

original: gsal bar byed pa sgron ma la sogs pa dag ni gsal bar bya ba'i don shes pa la ltos nas gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa sgron ma la sogs pa dag ni gsal bar bya ba'i don shes pa la ltos nas gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For a lamp, etc., which reveal do not reveal the object to be revealed in dependence on the cognition of the object to be revealed.

original: gsal bar bya ba bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la gsal bar byed pa nges pa yang ma mthong bas don thams cad la ming thams cad kyis gsal bar byed par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la gsal bar byed pa nges pa yang ma mthong bas don thams cad la ming thams cad kyis gsal bar byed par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: And since it is not seen that a lamp, etc. definitely reveal a pot, cloth, etc. to be revealed, it is possible that all names would reveal all objects.

original: dri la sogs pas nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dri la sogs pas nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they definitely caused by smell, etc.

original: 'di ltar ste'u dang chu la sogs pa ni dri la sogs pa'i skyed pa por 'dod kyi gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ste'u dang chu la sogs pa ni dri la sogs pa'i skyed pa por 'dod kyi gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
