translated: For a pestle, water, etc. are accepted as the cause of the production of smell, etc. but not as the revealer.

original: de bas na rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa bzhin du don med pa nyid du mngon no //üîΩde ltar na ngo bo nyid gsum du phung po la sogs pa 'dus pa'i phyir mkhas @258a * //
analyzed: de bas na rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba la mngon par zhen pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa bzhin du don med pa nyid du mngon no // de ltar na ngo bo nyid gsum du phung po la sogs pa 'dus pa'i phyir mkhas @258a * //
translated: Therefore, the attachment to expression and the expressible is seen to be meaningless, just like the attachment to the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: pa'i de kho na rnam pa bcu ni rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: pa'i de kho na rnam pa bcu ni rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid du blta'o //
translated: Thus, because the aggregates, etc. are included in the three natures, the ten kinds of reality of the learned should be seen as the basic reality.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen por phung po la sogs pa'i don ni bshad de /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen por phung po la sogs pa'i don ni bshad de /
translated: The meaning of the aggregates, etc. is explained as the antidote to the view of the self.üîΩSince the meaning of the aggregates, etc. which is the antidote to the view of the self, the adverse factor of the skill in the aggregates, etc. has not been explained, that should be stated.üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:

original: don gang la phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag tu lta ba phung po la sogs pa'i don ni ma bshad pas de brjod par bya ste /üîΩthog mar du ma nyid dang ni //
analyzed: don gang la phung po la sogs pa la mkhas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag tu lta ba phung po la sogs pa'i don ni ma bshad pas de brjod par bya ste / thog mar du ma nyid dang ni //
translated: The meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:

original: bsdus dang yongs su phye ba'i don //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //üîΩthog mar zhes bya ba ni dang por brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsdus dang yongs su phye ba'i don //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //üîΩthog mar zhes bya ba ni dang por brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the aggregates, etc. is stated:üîΩThe

original: de la thog ma kho nar phung po bshad de /
analyzed: de la thog ma kho nar phung po bshad de /
translated: The aggregates are explained first.

original: de dag kyang don rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang don rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood in three ways:

original: du ma'i don ni gzugs gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: du ma'i don ni gzugs gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmany‚Äù is that any form whatsoever

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am nang gi'am phyi'i'am rags pa'am phra ba 'am ngan pa'am gya nom pa'am rgyang ring po'am thag nye ba de lta bu dag ni du ma'i don te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am nang gi'am phyi'i'am rags pa'am phra ba 'am ngan pa'am gya nom pa'am rgyang ring po'am thag nye ba de lta bu dag ni du ma'i don te /
translated: is past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or exalted, far or near.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rdzas mang po dag la phung po zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rdzas mang po dag la phung po zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Such is the meaning of ‚Äúmany,‚Äù because the term ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is used for many substances of the past, etc.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni phung po ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni phung po ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is that the aggregates are

original: bsdus nas gcig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus nas gcig tu byas pa'o //
translated: a collection, that is, a single unit.

original: yongs su phye ba'i don yang phung po zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yongs su phye ba'i don yang phung po zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is also connected with the term ‚Äúaggregate.‚Äù

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni du ma'i don dang bsdus pa'i don gnyis kyang bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni du ma'i don dang bsdus pa'i don gnyis kyang bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse indicates that the meaning of ‚Äúmany‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúcollection‚Äù are also the meaning of ‚Äúdistinction.‚Äù

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here the cause is mentioned:

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi phung po ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi phung po ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the form aggregate is established as distinct from the aggregates of feeling, etc.

original: tha dad pa yang yongs su phye ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang yongs su phye ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: and the distinction is a classification.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir na yan lag 'di gsum gyi phung po'i don rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir na yan lag 'di gsum gyi phung po'i don rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the three aspects of the aggregates established in this way?

original: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don te zhes bya bas na de'i phyir de ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don te zhes bya bas na de'i phyir de ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúheap,‚Äù and therefore they are established in this way.

original: 'jig rten na yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is also seen in the world.

original: de ltar 'jig rten na yang du ma dang bsdus pa dang yongs su phye ba gang yin pa de dag ni spungs pa zhes brjod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten na yang du ma dang bsdus pa dang yongs su phye ba gang yin pa de dag ni spungs pa zhes brjod par mthong ngo //
translated: In the world, whatever is multiple, collected, and classified is seen to be called a ‚Äúheap.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The aggregates of feeling, etc., should be understood in the same way as the form aggregate.

original: de la ji ltar byung ba gang yin pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni skyes bu yin no zhes bdag gcig pur 'dzin pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por ji nas phung po'i don la mkhas par bya @258büîΩba bshad de /
analyzed: de la ji ltar byung ba gang yin pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni skyes bu yin no zhes bdag gcig pur 'dzin pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por ji nas phung po'i don la mkhas par bya @258b ba bshad de /
translated: The antidote to the view that all of these things, whatever has occurred and whatever will occur, are a single self is the explanation of the meaning of the aggregates.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'das pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs par gcig tu bsdus pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs par gcig tu bsdus pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates are imputed to the various forms, etc., that are different in the past, etc., when they are combined into one.

original: de yang rmongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po phung po rnam gsum gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang rmongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po phung po rnam gsum gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, the three aggregates are posited as the antidote to the three kinds of delusion.

original: rmongs pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig tu rmongs pa dang / bzlum pa la rmongs pa dang / mtshan nyid 'dres pa la rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig tu rmongs pa dang / bzlum pa la rmongs pa dang / mtshan nyid 'dres pa la rmongs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of delusion are delusion about singularity, delusion about the round, and delusion about the confusion of characteristics.

original: phung po'i 'og tu khams rnams bstan te /
analyzed: phung po'i 'og tu khams rnams bstan te /
translated: The elements are taught after the aggregates.

original: de bas na phung po'i don gyi 'og tu khams kyi don gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na phung po'i don gyi 'og tu khams kyi don gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the elements is stated after the meaning of the aggregates.

original: 'dzin dang gzung dang de 'dzin pa //üîΩsa bon don de gzhan du 'dod //üîΩces bya ba'o //üîΩgzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khams nyid dang sbyar te phung po'i 'og tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir bshad pa byed pas kyang /üîΩgzhan gang zhe na /üîΩkhams so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dzin dang gzung dang de 'dzin pa // sa bon don de gzhan du 'dod // ces bya ba'o // gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khams nyid dang sbyar te phung po'i 'og tu bstan pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir bshad pa byed pas kyang / gzhan gang zhe na / khams so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The grasping, the grasped, and the grasper,üîΩthe seed, the object, and the other.üîΩüîΩThe word ‚Äúother‚Äù is connected with the element, because it is taught after the aggregates.üîΩTherefore, the commentator also says:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the other?üîΩThe element.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: sa bon gyi don ni khams kyi don te /
analyzed: sa bon gyi don ni khams kyi don te /
translated: The seed-meaning of the element is the meaning of the element.

original: dper na gser yod pa'i rdo rje la gser gyi khams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na gser yod pa'i rdo rje la gser gyi khams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For example, in a rock containing gold, it is said that the gold element exists.

original: gser gyi sa bon zhes bya bar mngon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gser gyi sa bon zhes bya bar mngon pa lta bu'o //
translated: The seed of gold is said to exist.

original: de yang 'bras bu tha dad pas rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu tha dad pas rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: That is also divided into three types by way of the different results:

original: 'dzin pa'i khams dang / gzung ba'i khams dang / de 'dzin pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i khams dang / gzung ba'i khams dang / de 'dzin pa'i khams so //
translated: the element of grasping, the element of the grasped, and the element of the grasper.

original: de la 'dzin pa'i sa bon gyi don ni mig gi khams la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i sa bon gyi don ni mig gi khams la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The meaning of the seed of grasping is the eye element and so forth.üîΩThe meaning of the seed of the grasped is the form element and so forth.

original: gang dag mig gi khams nas yid kyi khams la thug gi bar gyi khams de dag mig gi khams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag mig gi khams nas yid kyi khams la thug gi bar gyi khams de dag mig gi khams la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elements from the eye element up to the mind element are the apprehending elements.

original: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yul 'dzin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yul 'dzin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dag go //
translated: They are called apprehending because they are the basis for apprehending objects such as form.

original: rigs mthun pa'i mig la sogs pa dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir khams rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i mig la sogs pa dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir khams rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called elements because they are the cause of similar eye, etc.

original: gzung ba'i sa bon gyi don gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa nas chos kyi khams la thug gi bar dag go //
analyzed: gzung ba'i sa bon gyi don gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa nas chos kyi khams la thug gi bar dag go //
translated: The meaning of the seeds of the apprehended is the elements from the form element up to the entity element.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzung ba dag go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzung ba dag go //
translated: They are called apprehended because they are the objects of the consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos po yin pas khams rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos po yin pas khams rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called elements because they are the cause of similar form, etc.

original: de 'dzin pa'i sa bon gyi don ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i sa bon gyi don ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the seeds of the apprehender is the eye consciousness element, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gzugs la sogs pa la 'dzin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa nas @259a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gzugs la sogs pa la 'dzin pa mig gi rnam par shes pa nas @259a * //
translated: Because form and so on are the entity of consciousness, the eye consciousness apprehending form and so on is the entity of form and so on.üîΩ

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la thug gi bar dag go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la thug gi bar dag go //
translated: The eye consciousness apprehending form, up to the mind consciousness are the nature of consciousness.

original: de dag kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mtshungs pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir khams rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mtshungs pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir khams rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called elements because they are the cause of similar eye consciousnesses, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar dag go //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar dag go //
translated: They are the eye-consciousness element, up to the mind-consciousness element.

original: kha cig na re mig la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i sa bon te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re mig la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i sa bon te go rims bzhin no //
translated: Some say: The storehouse consciousness perfumed by the latent karmic propensities of attachment to the eye, etc., is the seed of the eye, etc., in order.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sa bon te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sa bon te go rims bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the storehouse consciousness perfumed by the latent karmic propensities of attachment to form, etc., is the seed of form, etc., in order.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa'i las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen pa'i las kyi bag chags bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon te go rims bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, the store consciousness, perfumed by the impressions of karma that is attached to the consciousnesses of eye, etc., is the seed of the consciousness of eye, etc., respectively.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la khams zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la khams zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod kyi /
translated: Thus, the term element is applied to the store consciousness itself,

original: mig la sogs pa la ni mi bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la ni mi bya'o zhes te /
translated: and not to the eye, etc.

original: 'di ni bsam dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam dgos pa'o //
translated: This is the point that must be contemplated.

original: byed pa dang bya ba dang / las rnams la rmongs pa ldog par bya ba'i phyir sa bon gyi don rnam pa gsum la khams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: byed pa dang bya ba dang / las rnams la rmongs pa ldog par bya ba'i phyir sa bon gyi don rnam pa gsum la khams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The three kinds of seeds are established in order to counteract the confusion of beings in regard to action, agent, and process.

original: 'di la mig la sogs pa snga ma ni mig la sogs pa phyi ma dag gi rgyur gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la mig la sogs pa snga ma ni mig la sogs pa phyi ma dag gi rgyur gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: In this context, the former eye, etc., are the cause of the latter eye, etc.

original: 'di la rgyu bdag ces bya ba gzhan gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu bdag ces bya ba gzhan gang yang med do //
translated: There is no other so-called cause apart from this.

original: de ltar na khams la mkhas na bdag la rgyur 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na khams la mkhas na bdag la rgyur 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one is skilled in the elements, one turns away from grasping the self as a cause.

original: khams kyi don gyi 'og tu skye mched rnams kyi don brjod par bya ste /üîΩde'i phyir / tshor dang don rnams yongs gcod kyi //üîΩnyer spyod 'byung sgo gzhan yin no //
analyzed: khams kyi don gyi 'og tu skye mched rnams kyi don brjod par bya ste / de'i phyir / tshor dang don rnams yongs gcod kyi // nyer spyod 'byung sgo gzhan yin no //
translated: After the meaning of the elements, the meaning of the sense bases should be stated.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe sense bases are the doors of arising for the experience of objects.

original: khams rnams las gzhan pa ni skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa mang zhig kyang yod la /
analyzed: khams rnams las gzhan pa ni skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa mang zhig kyang yod la /
translated: Apart from the elements, there are many other things such as the sense bases and dependent origination.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spyir brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni spyir brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù is used in a general sense.

original: gzhan gang yin zhes dris pa dang / khams rnams kyi 'og tu bshad pa'i phyir don gyis na skye mched rnams las gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gang yin zhes dris pa dang / khams rnams kyi 'og tu bshad pa'i phyir don gyis na skye mched rnams las gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di gnas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is asked ‚ÄúWhat is other?‚Äù and explained after the elements, the word ‚Äúother‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúapart from the elements‚Äù is used to indicate the sense bases.

original: skye mched do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skye mched do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThe sense bases.‚Äù

original: de la nang gi skye mched drug @259b po dag ni tshor ba'i nye bar spyod pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nang gi skye mched drug @259b po dag ni tshor ba'i nye bar spyod pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the six internal sense bases are the doors for the arising of the experience of feeling.

original: phyi'i drug po dag ni don yongs su gcod pa'i nye bar spyod pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyi'i drug po dag ni don yongs su gcod pa'i nye bar spyod pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The six external ones are the doors for the arising of the experience of the complete acquisition of objects.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don to //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdoor for the arising‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúsense-field.‚Äù

original: skye ba ni 'byung ba ste tshor ba dang don yongs su gcod pa'i nye bar spyod pa gnyis kyi skye ba de mched par byed pas skye mched do //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'byung ba ste tshor ba dang don yongs su gcod pa'i nye bar spyod pa gnyis kyi skye ba de mched par byed pas skye mched do //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù means ‚Äúappearance,‚Äù and since it causes the arising of the two experiences of sensation and the complete acquisition of objects, it is a sense-field.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes kyi nye bar spyod pa skye ba'i sgo'i bye brag gis phyi dang nang du dbye ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes kyi nye bar spyod pa skye ba'i sgo'i bye brag gis phyi dang nang du dbye ste /
translated: The internal and external are distinguished by the difference in the doors for the arising of the experiences of sensation and ideation.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Sensation is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de nyid nye bar spyod pas na nye bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid nye bar spyod pas na nye bar spyod pa ste /
translated: Since it is the experience of that, it is an experience.

original: myong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with ‚Äúfeeling.‚Äù

original: nang gi skye mched rnams ni tshor ba'i nye bar spyod pa de skye ba'i sgor bshad do //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams ni tshor ba'i nye bar spyod pa de skye ba'i sgor bshad do //
translated: The internal sense-fields are explained as the doors for the arising of that experience of sensation.

original: yul rnams kyang de skye ba'i sgo yin mod kyi gnas mig la sogs pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa dang / de la yang rab tu shes pa dang / thun mong ma yin pas gnas su gyur pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa yod na de'i sgo nas tshor ba las spyod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yul rnams kyang de skye ba'i sgo yin mod kyi gnas mig la sogs pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa dang / de la yang rab tu shes pa dang / thun mong ma yin pas gnas su gyur pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa yod na de'i sgo nas tshor ba las spyod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The sense objects are indeed the door for the arising of the sense faculties, but the sense faculties such as the eye are the basis because they are the benefactors and the harm-doers, and because they are the basis for the knowledge of those objects and for the uncommon experience of them.

original: med na ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the sense faculties such as the eye exist, one experiences objects through them, but not when they do not exist.

original: don yongs su gcod pa ni 'du shes te /
analyzed: don yongs su gcod pa ni 'du shes te /
translated: Discernment is the determination of the object,

original: don la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of apprehending the sign of the object.

original: de nyid don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yul rnams la nyer bar spyod do //
analyzed: de nyid don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yul rnams la nyer bar spyod do //
translated: It experiences objects because it has the nature of understanding the object.

original: de skye ba'i sngos po'i sgo yin pas ni phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams bshad kyi /
analyzed: de skye ba'i sngos po'i sgo yin pas ni phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams bshad kyi /
translated: The external sense bases are explained as the door for the arising of the sense faculties,

original: nang gi rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nang gi rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the internal sense bases.

original: sgye ba'i sgo yin du zin kyang 'di ltar yul gyi dngos po med na nang gi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yod kyang don yongs su gcod pa la nye bar spyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgye ba'i sgo yin du zin kyang 'di ltar yul gyi dngos po med na nang gi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yod kyang don yongs su gcod pa la nye bar spyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the eye is the door of seeing, if the object does not exist, then even though the internal sense-fields of the eye, etc. exist, the function of determining the object is absent.

original: tshor ba dang don yongs su gcod pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag skye ba'i sgo'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir skye mched 'di dag rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang don yongs su gcod pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag skye ba'i sgo'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir skye mched 'di dag rig par bya ste /
translated: The sense-fields should be understood as the basis of the arising of feeling and the determination of the object, together with their associates, because they are the basis of the arising of the determination of the object.

original: gtso bor ni gnyis gzung ngo //
analyzed: gtso bor ni gnyis gzung ngo //
translated: The principal ones are grasped as two.

original: gtso bor gzung ba ni las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / don yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bor gzung ba ni las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / don yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The principal ones are grasped as two, because they are the basis of the experience of the result of action and the determination of the object.

original: tshor ba dang don yongs su gcod pa la nye bar spyod pa'i sgo nas za ba por rnam par rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang don yongs su gcod pa la nye bar spyod pa'i sgo nas za ba por rnam par rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: The imagination of the self as the experiencer arises on the basis of the experience of feeling and the determination of the object.

original: de'i phyir don gnyis kyis skye mched rnam par gzhag pa byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gnyis kyis skye mched rnam par gzhag pa byas so //
translated: Therefore, the sense-fields are established on the basis of these two.

original: de ltar skye mched la mkhas pa za ba po ni nang gi skye @260a * //
analyzed: de ltar skye mched la mkhas pa za ba po ni nang gi skye @260a * //
translated: Thus, the one who is skilled in the sense-fields imagines the experiencer as the internal sense-fields.

original: mched rnams yin la /
analyzed: mched rnams yin la /
translated: The aggregates are the brothers.

original: bza' bar bya ba ni phyi'i rnams yin te /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba ni phyi'i rnams yin te /
translated: The external ones are the food.

original: za ba po'i bdag med do snyam nas bdag za pa por 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za ba po'i bdag med do snyam nas bdag za pa por 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thinking that the self, the experiencer, does not exist, one stops the grasping of the self as the experiencer.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la phan pa dang / gnod pa'i phyir de'i gnas nyid za ba por tha snyad btags so zhes gang bshad pa de mi rigs te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la phan pa dang / gnod pa'i phyir de'i gnas nyid za ba por tha snyad btags so zhes gang bshad pa de mi rigs te /
translated: The self is designated as the experiencer because it is the basis of the sense bases such as the eye, since it is benefited and harmed by them.

original: gzugs bkag pa'i phyir bdag bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs bkag pa'i phyir bdag bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is not correct, because, like the self, the sense bases such as the eye do not exist, since form is refuted.

original: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ste /
translated: This is not a proper objection.

original: 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzugs kho na 'dir dgag par bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzugs kho na 'dir dgag par bya'i /
translated: Thus, only imagined form is to be refuted here,

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the form that is discriminated.

original: de la mig la sogs par spros pas bsgos pa'i las kyis 'phags pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba'i khyad par rnyed pa ni nang gi skye mched do //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs par spros pas bsgos pa'i las kyis 'phags pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba'i khyad par rnyed pa ni nang gi skye mched do //
translated: The internal sense bases are the ƒÅlaya consciousness of the ƒÅryas, which acquires a special transformation through the karma that is infused by the conceptualization of the eye, etc.

original: rgyu de las byung ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la gzugs la sog par snang ba ni phyi'i skye mched do //
analyzed: rgyu de las byung ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la gzugs la sog par snang ba ni phyi'i skye mched do //
translated: The appearance of form, etc. to the evolving consciousnesses that arise from that cause is the external base.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thun mong gi don du snang ba gang yin pa dang / sems can du snang ba gang yin pa de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir phyi'i skye mched ces bya'i /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thun mong gi don du snang ba gang yin pa dang / sems can du snang ba gang yin pa de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir phyi'i skye mched ces bya'i /
translated: The appearance of the store consciousness as the common objective field and as sentient beings is called the external base because it is the dominant condition for the arising of the evolving consciousnesses that appear as the grasped and grasper.

original: de yul du gyur pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yul du gyur pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it is their object.

original: de ltar na go mdo sde las gnyis la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba dang mi 'gal lam /
analyzed: de ltar na go mdo sde las gnyis la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba dang mi 'gal lam /
translated: In that case, is it not contradictory to the sutra that states, ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness, etc. arise in dependence on two?

original: gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa las tha dad na de nyid skye ba'i rkyen du de nyid 'gyur bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa las tha dad na de nyid skye ba'i rkyen du de nyid 'gyur bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: If the appearance as form, etc. were different from consciousness, it would be illogical for it to be the condition for the arising of that consciousness,

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i dus na yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i dus na yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would exist and not exist at the time of the arising and nonarising of that consciousness.

original: bdag nyid la 'jug pa 'gal ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la 'jug pa 'gal ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for it to engage itself.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa snang ba las tha dad par gyur pa gzugs la sogs par khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar rnam par shes pa snang ba las tha dad par gyur pa gzugs la sogs par khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, one must certainly accept that form, etc., are different from the appearance of consciousness.

original: 'di yang klan kar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yang klan kar mi rung ste /
translated: This is also not a proper objection.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la bag chags 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la bag chags 'jog go //
translated: In this way, the consciousness of the appearance of form, etc., is the condition for the production of a similar consciousness, and the latent impressions are deposited in consciousness by the conditions.

original: bag chags yongs su gyur nas yang gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: bag chags yongs su gyur nas yang gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: When the latent impressions are transformed, the consciousness that appears as form, etc., is produced.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i bdag @260b nyid kyi bag chags bskyed pa rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin par bshad pas na mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i bdag @260b nyid kyi bag chags bskyed pa rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin par bshad pas na mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Thus, it is explained that consciousness is the condition for the production of the latent impressions that have the nature of the appearance of form, etc., in consciousness. Therefore, there is no contradiction with the sutra.

original: de ltar na rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sgos par snang ba ni dmigs pa'i don du 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sgos par snang ba ni dmigs pa'i don du 'thad do //
translated: Thus, because it is the condition of consciousness appearing as form, the appearance of form as external is tenable as the object of observation.

original: yang na ji ltar phyi'i don du smra ba dag gis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa po lta bur med kyang de yod pa dang med pa las rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar phyi'i don du smra ba dag gis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa po lta bur med kyang de yod pa dang med pa las rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Or, just as the Proponents of External Objects posit that consciousness exists and does not exist due to the existence and nonexistence of objects, even though there is no object that is the object of generation and the generator,

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'jog pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba dang skyed pa po'i dngos por med kyang de yod pa dang med pa las rnamüîΩpar shes pa yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir rkyen dang rkyen can du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'jog pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba dang skyed pa po'i dngos por med kyang de yod pa dang med pa las rnamüîΩpar shes pa yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir rkyen dang rkyen can du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: in the same way, here also, even though the appearance of form and so on does not exist as the object of generation and the generator of consciousness that appears as form and so on, consciousness exists and does not exist due to the existence and nonexistence of that appearance.üîΩTherefore, the presentation of the appearance of form and so on as the object of observation and the presentation of consciousness as the object of observation are similar.

original: gzugs su snang ba dang rnam par shes pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir /üîΩdpe dang dngos su mi 'dre'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba dang rnam par shes pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir / dpe dang dngos su mi 'dre'o zhe na /
translated: Because the appearance as form and consciousness are not different.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: tha dad par gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are designated as different.

original: dper na rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa don dam par tha mi dad mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa don dam par tha mi dad mod kyi /
translated: For example, although consciousness in a dream, an illusion, a city of gandharvas, etc. is ultimately not different,üîΩbecause it is the basis of the conception of apprehended object and apprehending subject, it is observed as if it were different in the conventional sense of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par tha snyad kyi tha dad pa lta bur dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du gzhan la 'gal ba med
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par tha snyad kyi tha dad pa lta bur dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du gzhan la 'gal ba med
translated: Just as it is posited as the thing that is observed and the observer, so it is not contradictory for others.

original: do // gzhan yang dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po ni thams cad du yang gdags pa nyid du zad kyi dngos su med de /
analyzed: do // gzhan yang dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po ni thams cad du yang gdags pa nyid du zad kyi dngos su med de /
translated: Moreover, the thing that is observed and the observer are only imputed in all cases, but they do not exist in fact.

original: rnam par shes pa ni skyes pa'am ma skyes pas kyang yul la dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni skyes pa'am ma skyes pas kyang yul la dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Consciousness does not observe an object that has arisen or not arisen.

original: skyes ma thag tu zhig pa'i phyir dmigs par byed pa'i tshe mi sdod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu zhig pa'i phyir dmigs par byed pa'i tshe mi sdod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is destroyed immediately upon arising, it does not endure at the time of observing and it does not exist.

original: yul yang skyes pa dang ma skyes pa gnyis ka la yang dmigs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: yul yang skyes pa dang ma skyes pa gnyis ka la yang dmigs su mi rung ste /
translated: Also, an object that has arisen or not arisen is not suitable to be observed.

original: skyes pa ni gnas pa med pa dang / ma skyes pa ni med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes pa ni gnas pa med pa dang / ma skyes pa ni med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that which has arisen does not endure and that which has not arisen does not exist.

original: gzhi med pa la ni dmigs par byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhi med pa la ni dmigs par byar mi rung ngo //
translated: That which is nonexistent is not suitable to be observed.

original: gang gi ltar yod pa tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de nyid dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed par 'jog pa de'i ltar na yang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni don med par 'gyur te /üîΩde'i @261a * //üîΩbdag nyid du grub zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskye ba'i tshe'ang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi ltar yod pa tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de nyid dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed par 'jog pa de'i ltar na yang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni don med par 'gyur te / de'i @261a * // bdag nyid du grub zin pa'i phyir ro // skye ba'i tshe'ang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Even according to those who posit the state of cause and effect merely through existence as the observed object and the observer, the object of the present consciousness would be nonexistent because it is already established as its nature.

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, at the time of arising, it would be nonexistent because it does not exist.

original: skye ba'i tshe don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When it arises, it is not purposeless,

original: 'di ltar yul gyi dngos po yod na rnam par shes pa der snang ba'i bdag nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi dngos po yod na rnam par shes pa der snang ba'i bdag nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because when the object exists, consciousness obtains the nature of appearing as that.

original: gal te yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu phyi rol gyi don yin te /
analyzed: gal te yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu phyi rol gyi don yin te /
translated: If the cause of the consciousness that appears as an object is an external object,

original: de lta na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then consciousness of the past, future, dreams, and so on would be devoid of aspects.

original: yang na de'i don med pas med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i don med pas med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, since its object would not exist, it would be nonexistent.

original: rkyen ma tshang ba ni 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba ni 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rung ste /
translated: An incomplete condition is not suitable to be a cause,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to the absurd conclusion that anything could be the cause of anything.

original: med pa ni rkyen du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med pa ni rkyen du mi rung ngo //
translated: And a nonexistent is not suitable to be a condition.

original: phyi'i don yang rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi'i don yang rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, an external object is not suitable to be the objective condition of consciousness,

original: de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises even when it does not exist.

original: de bas na rab rib can la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad phyi'i don dmigs pa la mi ltos pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o//
analyzed: de bas na rab rib can la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad phyi'i don dmigs pa la mi ltos pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o//
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that all consciousnesses of those with eye disease and so on do not depend on the observation of external objects.

original: skye mched kyi don gyi 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don brjod dgos te /
analyzed: skye mched kyi don gyi 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don brjod dgos te /
translated: After the meaning of the sense bases, the meaning of dependent origination must be stated.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of dependent origination isüîΩthe absence of superimposition and denial

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rtsol ba la //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rtsol ba la //
translated: with regard to cause, effect, and effort.

original: sgro 'dogs med cing skur 'debs med //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs med cing skur 'debs med //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the absence of superimposition and denial with regard to cause, effect, and effort.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said:üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination isüîΩthe absence of superimposition and denialüîΩwith regard to cause, effect, and effort.

original: g-yo ba med pa dang mi rtag pa dang nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa dang mi rtag pa dang nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of arising from conditions that are not moving, impermanent, and capable.

original: mdo sde las kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang 'di skad du /
translated: Also, a s≈´tra says:

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: Because this exists, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
translated: Because this is produced, that is produced.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said: ‚ÄúWith ignorance as a condition, there are formations.‚Äù

original: 'di yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang byed pa rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dgag par 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dang byed pa rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dgag par 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This also is stated in order to demonstrate the desire to refute superimposition and denial in regard to the cause, effect, and activity of dependent origination.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang byed pa rnams la sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang byed pa rnams la sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The meaning of non-superimposition and non-denial in regard to cause, effect, and activity is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: rtsol ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni byed par bshad do //
analyzed: rtsol ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni byed par bshad do //
translated: The term ‚Äúeffort‚Äù is explained as activity.

original: de la rgyu la sgro 'dogs pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa bor nas skyes bu dang dbang phyug dang bdag dang gtso bo la sogs pa la rgyu nyid du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu la sgro 'dogs pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa bor nas skyes bu dang dbang phyug dang bdag dang gtso bo la sogs pa la rgyu nyid du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, superimposition in regard to cause is the conception of a person, ƒ™≈õvara, self, or pradhƒÅna, etc., as the cause, having rejected ignorance, etc.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: 'du byed la sogs pa tha ma rga shi la thug pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i rgyu la rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa tha ma rga shi la thug pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i rgyu la rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because of the conception of an incompatible cause of the formations, etc., up to old age and death.

original: @261b 'du byed la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams kyi rgyu skyes bu la sogs pa rtag pa ni mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: @261b 'du byed la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams kyi rgyu skyes bu la sogs pa rtag pa ni mi mthun pa ste /
translated: The cause of impermanent things such as karma, etc., is a permanent person, etc., which is not in accord with them.

original: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot in accord‚Äù is ‚Äúnot similar.‚Äù

original: yang na rgyu'i rang bzhin 'gyur ba la ltos nas sa bon la sogs pa la myu gu la sogs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i rang bzhin 'gyur ba la ltos nas sa bon la sogs pa la myu gu la sogs pa mthong ste /
translated: Or else, the cause is seen in seeds, etc., in dependence on the transformation of the nature of the cause.

original: rang bzhin rtag pa la ni 'gyur ba med do //üîΩmi mthun pa'i rgyu nyid la rgyur rtog pa'i phyir rgyu la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtag pa la ni 'gyur ba med do // mi mthun pa'i rgyu nyid la rgyur rtog pa'i phyir rgyu la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: But in a permanent nature, there is no transformation.üîΩSince one imagines that a cause that is not in accord is a cause, one exaggerates the cause.üîΩOne deprecates the cause because one imagines that it is causeless.

original: rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa ni rgyu med pa can du rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa rgyu med par skye bar khas blangs pas 'du byed la sogs pa'i rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa ni rgyu med pa can du rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa rgyu med par skye bar khas blangs pas 'du byed la sogs pa'i rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: Since one accepts that things such as karma arise without a cause, the cause of things such as karma, such as ignorance, is not evident.

original: 'bras bu la sgro 'dogs pa ni bdag dang bcas pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las 'byung bar rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sgro 'dogs pa ni bdag dang bcas pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las 'byung bar rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The superimposition of effect is the conception that the formations, etc., together with a self arise from the conditions of ignorance, etc.

original: kha cig na re bdag yod na ni 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams las 'byung gi / med na ni ma yin no zhes 'bras bu 'du byed la sogs par bdag sgro 'dogs na 'bras bu la sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'oüîΩzhe'o // gzhan dag na re bdag gi rdzas dang ldan pas sam /
analyzed: kha cig na re bdag yod na ni 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams las 'byung gi / med na ni ma yin no zhes 'bras bu 'du byed la sogs par bdag sgro 'dogs na 'bras bu la sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o zhe'o // gzhan dag na re bdag gi rdzas dang ldan pas sam /
translated: Some say: If a self exists, the formations, etc., arise from the conditions of ignorance, etc., but if it does not exist, they do not. Thus, if a self is superimposed on the effect, the formations, etc., it is called the superimposition of effect.

original: de phan pa dang gnod pa byed pas bdag dang bcas pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las 'byung bar rtog pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phan pa dang gnod pa byed pas bdag dang bcas pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las 'byung bar rtog pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Others say: The superimposition of effect is the conception that the formations, etc., together with a self arise from the conditions of ignorance, etc., because they possess the substance of a self or because that self benefits or harms them.

original: 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba med par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa ni 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba med par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is like the statement of the nihilists who say:

original: legs par spyad pa yang med /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa yang med /
translated: There is no good conduct,

original: nyes par spyad pa yang med /
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa yang med /
translated: no bad conduct,üîΩand no world beyond.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang med do zhes med pa rnams legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa dang 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs par smra ba'o //üîΩbyed pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni 'du byed la sogs skye ba la ma rig pa la sogs pa byed par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'du byed la sogs pa skye ba la ma rig pa la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin don
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang med do zhes med pa rnams legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa dang 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs par smra ba'o // byed pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni 'du byed la sogs skye ba la ma rig pa la sogs pa byed par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'du byed la sogs pa skye ba la ma rig pa la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin don
translated: They deny good conduct, bad conduct, and the world beyond.üîΩSuperimposition of activity is the conception that ignorance, etc., are active in the production of formations, etc.üîΩThis is like the conception that ignorance, etc., are active in the production of formations, etc., and that they are entities that have a nature of their own, a nature that is not transformed into something else.

original: gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed par rtog pa de lta bu ni byed pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed par rtog pa de lta bu ni byed pa la sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Such is the superimposition of activity.

original: byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni nus pa med par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni nus pa med par rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Denial of function is the conception of the absence of efficacy.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis 'du byed la sogs pa @262a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis 'du byed la sogs pa @262a * //
translated: The mere existence of ignorance, etc. is the cause of the origination of the formative forces, etc.

original: skye bar nus pa yin yang nus pa med par rtog pa'i phyir byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar nus pa yin yang nus pa med par rtog pa'i phyir byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: But the conception of the absence of efficacy is denial of function.

original: de med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang byed pa rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa de med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang skur pa 'debsüîΩpa med par rig par bya'o //üîΩde ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'di ni ma rig pa las gzhan pa bdag gam gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang byed pa rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa de med pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa med par rig par bya'o // de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'di ni ma rig pa las gzhan pa bdag gam gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: It should be understood that there is no superimposition or denial in regard to cause, result and function because there is no superimposition or denial in regard to cause, result and function.

original: byed par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byed par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this skill in dependent origination should be understood as the counteragent to the apprehension of self or other as the agent in regard to that which is other than ignorance, etc.üîΩThus, this skill in dependent origination should be understood as the counteragent to the apprehension of self or other as the agent in regard to that which is other than ignorance, etc.

original: 'di la ma rig pa ma gtogs par dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams byed pa ni bdag gam gzhan yang rung ste med do //
analyzed: 'di la ma rig pa ma gtogs par dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams byed pa ni bdag gam gzhan yang rung ste med do //
translated: Apart from ignorance, there is no self or other that performs virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: 'du byed rnams ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa'i byed pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa'i byed pa gzhan med do //
translated: Apart from the formative forces, there is no activity of consciousness.

original: thams cad du yang ci rigs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad du yang ci rigs par brjod par bya ste /
translated: In all cases, the meaning should be understood in accordance with the above explanation.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa g-yo ba med pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa nus pa yod pa dag las 'du byed la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa g-yo ba med pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa nus pa yod pa dag las 'du byed la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The formative forces, etc., arise from ignorance, etc., which are devoid of movement, impermanent, and have the capacity to generate.üîΩThe Meaning of the Correct and Incorrect

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don gyi 'og tu gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i don brjod dgos te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don gyi 'og tu gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i don brjod dgos te /
translated: The meaning of the correct and incorrect should be mentioned immediately following the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩTherefore, he says:üîΩThe meaning of the other-dependent is not desired, desired, pure,üîΩarising together, controlling,üîΩattainment, and complete enjoyment.

original: de'i phyir / mi 'dod 'dod dang rnam dag dang // mnyam du 'byung dang dbang byed dang // 'thob dang kun du spyod pa dag / gzhan dbang nyid kyi don de gzhan //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi 'dod 'dod dang rnam dag dang // mnyam du 'byung dang dbang byed dang // 'thob dang kun du spyod pa dag / gzhan dbang nyid kyi don de gzhan //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the other-dependent is different.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid rnam pa bdun gyi don gyis rig par bya ste zhes bya ba de la gnas ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid rnam pa bdun gyi don gyis rig par bya ste zhes bya ba de la gnas ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The seven kinds of mastery are to be understood as the meaning of the sevenfold mastery over: (1) the possible and impossible, (2) karma, (3) meditative concentration, (4) faculties, (5) inclinations, (6) aspirations, and (7) the various elements.

original: gnas ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The possible is the cause, and the impossible is not the cause.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bden par smra zhing khro ba med //
analyzed: bden par smra zhing khro ba med //
translated: Speak the truth, be without anger,

original: slong la chung yang sbyin par bya //üîΩrnam pa 'di gsum gnas kyis ni //
analyzed: slong la chung yang sbyin par bya // rnam pa 'di gsum gnas kyis ni //
translated: and give even a little to the poor.

original: lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur //
translated: By these three you will be born among the gods.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba lta bu ste rgyu yin par mngon no //üîΩyang na gnas ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba lta bu ste rgyu yin par mngon no // yang na gnas ni srid pa'o //
translated: This verse shows that the possible is the cause.

original: gnas ma yin pa ni mi srid do //üîΩde la mkhas pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni mi srid do // de la mkhas pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Or, the possible is existence, and the impossible is non-existence.üîΩSkill in the possible and impossible is skill in the possible and impossible.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid de /
translated: Mastery over the possible and impossible is the mastery over the possible and impossible itself.

original: gzhan la rag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be dependent on others.

original: rnam pa de bdun yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang tshe'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid gsum du 'dus so //
analyzed: rnam pa de bdun yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang tshe'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid gsum du 'dus so //
translated: These seven kinds are included in the three masteries over karma, afflictions, and life.

original: de la mi 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni @262b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la mi 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni @262b zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other-powered that is not desired is stated as follows.

original: mi 'dod pa ni ngan 'gro rnams te /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni ngan 'gro rnams te /
translated: The undesirable refers to the miserable realms.

original: der 'gro ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der 'gro ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one goes there due to the other-powered,

original: nyes par spyod pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las su bsdus pa sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang mjug gis mi 'dod bzhin du yang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las su bsdus pa sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang mjug gis mi 'dod bzhin du yang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said: ‚Äúdue to the power of karma, one goes to the miserable realms without desiring to do so, due to the performance of misdeeds, such as taking life, and so on, which are included in the actions of body, speech, and mind, along with their preparation and conclusion.‚Äù

original: ngan 'gro dag ni sems can dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro dag ni sems can dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'o //
translated: The miserable realms are the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: de dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i phyir der 'gro 'dod pa ni su yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i phyir der 'gro 'dod pa ni su yang med mod kyi /
translated: Since these are extremely miserable, no one desires to go there.

original: las rnams stobs dang ldan la ngan 'gro'i rgyu yang yin pas nye bar spyod pa ni mi 'dod bzhin du las kyi dbang gis der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnams stobs dang ldan la ngan 'gro'i rgyu yang yin pas nye bar spyod pa ni mi 'dod bzhin du las kyi dbang gis der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, since karma is powerful and is the cause of the miserable realms, one goes there due to the power of karma without desiring to engage in such conduct.

original: 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni legs par spyad pas bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni legs par spyad pas bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other-dependent nature of the desire realm is the going to good destinies through good conduct.

original: 'dod pa ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'o //
translated: The desire realm is the going to good destinies.

original: bde 'gro ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: Good destinies are the gods and humans.

original: legs par spyod pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / 'jug pa rnams las log pa dang ; ston pa dang / bla ma dang yon tan dang ldan pa la sogs pa la sbyin pa dang rim gro dang bkur sti la sogs pa byed pa dang byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / 'jug pa rnams las log pa dang ; ston pa dang / bla ma dang yon tan dang ldan pa la sogs pa la sbyin pa dang rim gro dang bkur sti la sogs pa byed pa dang byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams so //
translated: Good conduct is the avoidance of taking life, etc., together with the preparation and aftermath, and it is the giving of gifts, the performance of service, the performance of honor, etc., to teachers, gurus, and those who possess good qualities, and it is the special qualities of love, compassion, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni legs par spyad pa med par gzhan gyis ni 'dod du zin kyang bde 'gror 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni legs par spyad pa med par gzhan gyis ni 'dod du zin kyang bde 'gror 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The other-dependent nature is the fact that one does not go to good destinies through the desire realm, even though one desires it, without good conduct.

original: bde 'gror skye ba ni legs par spyad pa la rag lus pa nyid do //
analyzed: bde 'gror skye ba ni legs par spyad pa la rag lus pa nyid do //
translated: Birth in good destinies is dependent on good conduct.

original: rnam par dag pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni ches rgya cher 'byung ba la rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni ches rgya cher 'byung ba la rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The other-dependent that is pure is the extensive arising.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang ; gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang ; gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: The five hindrances are: sensual desire, malice, torpor and sleep, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid gcig tu bsdus /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid gcig tu bsdus /
translated: Torpor and sleep are combined into one.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gcig tu bsdus te lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gcig tu bsdus te lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Restlessness and remorse are combined into one.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sgrib par bye brag med pas sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sgrib par bye brag med pas sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: They are called hindrances because they are not distinguished as to whether they are wholesome or unwholesome.

original: bye brag tu ni sgrib pa rnams zhes mngon par dga' ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las mi cha ba la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis legs par blangs pa la legs par sgrub pa dang / zhi gnas kyi dus na ma bying ba dang /
analyzed: bye brag tu ni sgrib pa rnams zhes mngon par dga' ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las mi cha ba la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis legs par blangs pa la legs par sgrub pa dang / zhi gnas kyi dus na ma bying ba dang /
translated: In particular, the hindrances are: delight in sensual pleasures, bodily and verbal actions that are not restrained, not accomplishing what one has undertaken with regard to one's fellow practitioners, not being free from torpor and sleep at the time of tranquility,

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na mi g-yeng ba dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dus na rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la rim pa bzhin du @263a * //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na mi g-yeng ba dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dus na rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la rim pa bzhin du @263a * //
translated: At the time of full attention, it is non-distraction; at the time of calm abiding and insight, it is automatic engagement.

original: bsgribs pas na sgrib pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pas na sgrib pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called obscurations because they obscure those.

original: de dag ma spangs lags zhes bya ba ni ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ma spangs lags zhes bya ba ni ma btang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not abandoned‚Äù means they are not relinquished.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi bar du ma bsgoms na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi bar du ma bsgoms na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe seven factors of awakening are not cultivated‚Äù means

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni mtha' brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni mtha' brjod pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúup to‚Äù refers to the end.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams kyang bsdu'o //
translated: It includes the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, and the five powers.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it does not bring about the end of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ni gang na sdug bsngal med pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ni gang na sdug bsngal med pa ste /
translated: The end of suffering is where there is no suffering.

original: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: That is nirvana.

original: de mi byed pa ni mi 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: de mi byed pa ni mi 'thob pa ste /
translated: Not bringing it about is not attaining it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one does not attain nirvana.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: Or, the end of suffering means not linking up with another suffering.

original: de ni sdug bsngal de lta bu dang mtshams sbyor bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal de lta bu dang mtshams sbyor bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: That is, one does not link up with that kind of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not make suffering.

original: sgrib pa lnga spangs pa la rag lus pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa gzhan gyi dbang nyid do //üîΩmnyam du 'byung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis gnyis snga phyi med par zhes bya ba ni lhan cig ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga spangs pa la rag lus pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa gzhan gyi dbang nyid do // mnyam du 'byung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis gnyis snga phyi med par zhes bya ba ni lhan cig ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it depends on the abandonment of the five obscurations, purity is dependent on another.üîΩSimultaneous dependence on another is that two Tathagatas or two Wheel-turning Kings do not appear simultaneously, that is, at the same time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dang 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dang 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Two Tathagatas or two Wheel-turning Kings do not appear in one world-system.

original: kha cig na re de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su mi 'byung bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su mi 'byung bar 'dod kyi /
translated: Some say: Two Tathagatas do not appear in one billion-world universe.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba ni gling bzhi par 'byung bar mi 'dod do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba ni gling bzhi par 'byung bar mi 'dod do zhe'o //
translated: But they do not assert that two universal monarchs appear in one four-continent world system.

original: gzhan dag na re de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis kyang gling bzhi pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis kyang gling bzhi pa nyid du mi 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: Two Tathagatas do not appear even in one four-continent world system.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi sku'i dbang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gling bzhi pa re rer yang sprul pa'i skus mngon par byang chub pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi sku'i dbang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gling bzhi pa re rer yang sprul pa'i skus mngon par byang chub pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang ston to //
translated: Because the Bhagavan Buddhas, by the power of the dharmakaya, manifest perfect enlightenment and parinirvana through their nirmanakaya in each of the four continents of a triple-thousand great thousand world system.

original: 'di ltar gling bzhi pa gcig tu dga' ldan dang / mi rnams kyi nang du yang tshe yongs su 'dzin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gling bzhi pa gcig tu dga' ldan dang / mi rnams kyi nang du yang tshe yongs su 'dzin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dgongs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is the intention of bodhisattvas to take birth in Tu·π£ita and among humans in one four-continent world system.

original: de ni gling bzhi pa gzhan du'ang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ni gling bzhi pa gzhan du'ang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true for the other three continents.

original: de lta bas na 'og min gyi gnas @263b nyid du bcom ldan 'das mngon par sangs rgyas nas sprul pa'i skus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gling bzhi pa re rer yang dga' ldan du skye ba dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'og min gyi gnas @263b nyid du bcom ldan 'das mngon par sangs rgyas nas sprul pa'i skus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gling bzhi pa re rer yang dga' ldan du skye ba dang /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, having attained enlightenment in the Akani·π£·π≠ha realm, manifests through his emanation body birth in Tu·π£ita,

original: 'chi 'pho dang / mi'i nang du tshe yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa thams cad ston to snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang / mi'i nang du tshe yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa thams cad ston to snyam du sems so //
translated: death, the taking up of life as a human, and so on, in each of the four continents that are included in the trichiliocosm.üîΩThis is the power of the Buddha, which is dependent on karma that is not shared, since it is not shared with other beings.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas dang 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni mnyam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i las la rag lus pas lhan cig tu skye bar 'gyur ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas dang 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni mnyam par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i las la rag lus pas lhan cig tu skye bar 'gyur ba gzhan gyi dbang nyid do //
translated: The appearance of a Buddha and a universal monarch is dependent on karma that is not shared, since it is not shared with other beings.

original: dbang byed pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni bud med 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni skyes pa'i lus kyis smin par nus te /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni bud med 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni skyes pa'i lus kyis smin par nus te /
translated: The karma that would mature as a universal monarch can mature in a male body,

original: bud med la ni bud med rin po che la spyod pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med la ni bud med rin po che la spyod pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but a woman does not have the power to enjoy the precious woman.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni brgya byin la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni brgya byin la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes Indra, etc.

original: 'thob pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni bud med kyis rang byang chub dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni bud med kyis rang byang chub dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other-dependence of attainment is because a woman cannot attain individual enlightenment or supreme enlightenment.

original: 'thob pa ni sangs rgyas dang rang byang chub nyid 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni sangs rgyas dang rang byang chub nyid 'thob pa'o //
translated: Attainment is the attainment of Buddhahood and individual enlightenment.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni skyes pas 'thob par 'gyur gyi bud med kyis 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni skyes pas 'thob par 'gyur gyi bud med kyis 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that, other-dependence is attained by a male, but not by a female.

original: de ni go rims bzhin du bse ru lta bur 'dre ba med pa dang / sa gsum gyi ston par mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni go rims bzhin du bse ru lta bur 'dre ba med pa dang / sa gsum gyi ston par mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are, respectively, like rhinoceroses, who have no companions, and because they are impossible as teachers on the three stages.

original: de'ang skye bo g-yon can thams cad kyi spyod yul yin pa dang / shes rab chung bas slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'ang skye bo g-yon can thams cad kyi spyod yul yin pa dang / shes rab chung bas slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
