translated: Moreover, they are the domain of all deceitful people, and they are not fit to be fully enlightened without a teacher, because their wisdom is small.

original: kun du spyod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni lta ba phun sum tshogs pa gsod pa la sogs pa kun du mi spyod la /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid ni lta ba phun sum tshogs pa gsod pa la sogs pa kun du mi spyod la /
translated: The other-dependency of conduct is that one who is perfect in view does not engage in conduct such as killing,üîΩbut the common person does.

original: so so'i skye bo ni kun du spyod pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba lta ba phun sum tshogs pa ni bden pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni kun du spyod pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba lta ba phun sum tshogs pa ni bden pa mthong ba'o //
translated: One who is perfect in view is one who has seen the truth.

original: gsod pa ni srog gcod pa yin ;
analyzed: gsod pa ni srog gcod pa yin ;
translated: Killing is the taking of life.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma byin par len pa la sogs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma byin par len pa la sogs pa bsdus te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes taking what is not given and so on.

original: gsod pa la sogs pa de dag ni lus dang ngag gi bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gsod pa la sogs pa de dag ni lus dang ngag gi bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: These actions of killing and so on are by nature the activities of body and speech.

original: mthong ba'i lam nyid kyi gsod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i phyir lta @264a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam nyid kyi gsod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i phyir lta @264a * //
translated: Because the path of insight eliminates the afflictions that instigate all evil conduct such as killing, etc.,

original: ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa ni kun du mi spyod do //
analyzed: ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa ni kun du mi spyod do //
translated: one who is endowed with the perfection of insight does not engage in evil conduct.

original: so so'i skye bo ni de ma spangs pa'i phyir kun du spyod do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni de ma spangs pa'i phyir kun du spyod do //
translated: The worldling does not eliminate them, and therefore engages in evil conduct.

original: de ma spangs pa yang de'i gnyen por lam ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar mi 'dod pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: de ma spangs pa yang de'i gnyen por lam ma skyes pa'i phyir ro // de ltar mi 'dod pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: He does not eliminate them because the path that is their antidote has not yet arisen.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni skyes bu dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa rang dbang can du 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa ni skyes bu dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa rang dbang can du 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Thus, the skill in the possible and the impossible is the antidote to the belief in the independence of God, etc.

original: gal te rang dbang can 'ga' zhig yod na ni nyes par spyad pa las ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang dbang can 'ga' zhig yod na ni nyes par spyad pa las ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were any independent being, then one would not go to an evil destiny from evil conduct.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i don bstan pa'i 'og tu dbang po rnams kyi don brjod dgos pas de'i phyir dbang po ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i don bstan pa'i 'og tu dbang po rnams kyi don brjod dgos pas de'i phyir dbang po ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning of the faculties should be stated immediately following the explanation of the meaning of the possible and the impossible. Therefore, it says: The faculties are of twenty-two kinds.

original: mig gi dbang po nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la thug gi bar du'o //
translated: They are the eye faculty up to the final one, the faculty of final knowledge.

original: de la dbang po'i don ni dbang byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i don ni dbang byed pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of faculty is the meaning of controlling power.

original: gang zhig gang la dbang byed pa de mi shes nas /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la dbang byed pa de mi shes nas /
translated: Since it is not known with regard to which object each faculty exercises controlling power,üîΩtherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / 'dzin dang gnas dang rgyun mi 'chad //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dzin dang gnas dang rgyun mi 'chad //
translated: For apprehending, for abiding, for the continuity,

original: spyod dang dag pa gnyis kyi phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod dang dag pa gnyis kyi phyir // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: for experience, and for the two purities.

original: 'di la gnyis pa dbang byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rigs pa las tshig le'ur byas pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi smos par blta'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis pa dbang byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rigs pa las tshig le'ur byas pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi smos par blta'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúcontrolling power‚Äù is not mentioned in the verse because it is to be understood from the prose commentary.

original: de bas na bshad pa byed pas /
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa byed pas /
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentaryüîΩsays:

original: de dag la de dbang byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag la de dbang byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because they control those.

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they grasp.

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir dgos pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir dgos pa yin par brjod de /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù here indicates the purpose.

original: 'dzin pa'i dgos pa ste ched yin la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dgos pa ste ched yin la /
translated: The purpose of grasping is the reason.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others as appropriate.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni don 'dzin pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni don 'dzin pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the grasping of objects, etc.

original: dbang byed ces bya ba ni lhag par dbang bas na dbang byed pa ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang byed ces bya ba ni lhag par dbang bas na dbang byed pa ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúControl‚Äù means to control by superior power. The meaning is ‚Äúcause.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa chos la thug pa dag ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa chos la thug pa dag ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
translated: Form, etc., up to phenomena are the objects such as form.

original: de dag la 'dzin pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'dzin pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The grasping of those is the eye consciousness, etc.

original: de la mig la sogs pa dbang po drug dbang byed pa ni mig ni gzugs kyi bye brag ma lus pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pas gzugs la sogs pa la lhag par dbang byed @264b pas na dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa dbang po drug dbang byed pa ni mig ni gzugs kyi bye brag ma lus pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pas gzugs la sogs pa la lhag par dbang byed @264b pas na dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: The six faculties of eye, etc., are dominant in the sense of controlling. The eye is called a faculty because it controls form, etc., since it is the basis for the consciousness of every aspect of form.

original: gzugs sngon po ni gzugs ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs sngon po ni gzugs ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Blue form is not the objective domain of the consciousness of yellow form, etc.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said in detail of the ear, etc., as appropriate.

original: gnas par bya ba la ni srog gi dbang po dbang byed de zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: gnas par bya ba la ni srog gi dbang po dbang byed de zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The faculty of life force is dominant in the sense of maintaining.

original: srog gi dbang po ni sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la bar du gcod pa'i rkyen med na skad cig snga mas 'dra ba'i skad cig phyi ma phyi ma rnams su mtshams sbyor ba'i mthu yod pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyis 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la bar du gcod pa'i rkyen med na skad cig snga mas 'dra ba'i skad cig phyi ma phyi ma rnams su mtshams sbyor ba'i mthu yod pa'o //
translated: The faculty of life force is the power to connect the subsequent moments of the stream of karmic maturation projected by the latent impressions of previous karma, if there is no condition that interrupts it.

original: gnas par bya ba la ni srog gi dbang po dbang byed ces bya ba la rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: gnas par bya ba la ni srog gi dbang po dbang byed ces bya ba la rgyu smos pa /
translated: The faculty of life force dominates in terms of remaining.

original: 'di'i dbang gis mi 'chi ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i dbang gis mi 'chi ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause is mentioned here because one does not die through its power.

original: mi 'chi ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs rigs mthun pa'i rjes su 'jug go //üîΩkha zas la sogs pa ni sems can gnas pa'i rgyu yin du zin kyang dbang po ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'chi ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs rigs mthun pa'i rjes su 'jug go // kha zas la sogs pa ni sems can gnas pa'i rgyu yin du zin kyang dbang po ma yin te /
translated: But not dying is projected by former karma and is the homogeneous cause of remaining.

original: de dag yod bzhin du tshe zad pa gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yod bzhin du tshe zad pa gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Food and so on are causes of the remaining of sentient beings, but they are not faculties because remaining is not possible when life force is exhausted, even though they exist.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na kham gyis za ba'i zas rnams med kyang srog gi dbang po nyid kyis gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na kham gyis za ba'i zas rnams med kyang srog gi dbang po nyid kyis gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the form and formless realms, the faculty of life force is the cause of remaining, because although there is no oral food, remaining exists there.

original: de na reg pa la sogs pa ni gnas par dbang byed par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de na reg pa la sogs pa ni gnas par dbang byed par mi rung ste /
translated: Contact and so on are not suitable to be the dominant condition of remaining,

original: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas dang 'du shes med pa dag la reg pa la sogs pa med kyang sems can rnams gnas par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas dang 'du shes med pa dag la reg pa la sogs pa med kyang sems can rnams gnas par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible for sentient beings to remain in the meditative attainment of cessation and in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, even though contact and so on do not exist there.

original: rigs 'tshob pa la pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs 'tshob pa la pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: The male and female faculties rule with regard to the continuation of the family.

original: bu byung na rigs rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur bas bu 'byung ba ni rigs 'tshob pa'o //
analyzed: bu byung na rigs rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur bas bu 'byung ba ni rigs 'tshob pa'o //
translated: The continuation of the family is the production of a child, because the family line is not broken when a child is born.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'byung bar dbang byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩlus kyi dbang po'i phyogs 'ga' nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'byung bar dbang byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / lus kyi dbang po'i phyogs 'ga' nyid de /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, it says, ‚Äúbecause they rule with regard to the production of the body.‚Äù

original: dbang byed pa'i bye brag gis pho dang mo'i dbang po zhes bya ba 'thob po //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i bye brag gis pho dang mo'i dbang po zhes bya ba 'thob po //
translated: A part of the body faculty is called the male and female faculties because of the distinction of ruling.

original: gang na pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po yod pa de na rigs rnam par gzhag pa yod de /
analyzed: gang na pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po yod pa de na rigs rnam par gzhag pa yod de /
translated: The classification of families exists where there is a male faculty and a female faculty.

original: de'i dbang gis rigs rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rigs rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: The family line is not broken because of their power.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la ni pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po yod pa la rigs rnam par gzhag gi med pa la ni ma yin no //üîΩdri za la sogs pa la dbang byed pa med de dri za la @265a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la ni pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po yod pa la rigs rnam par gzhag gi med pa la ni ma yin no // dri za la sogs pa la dbang byed pa med de dri za la @265a * //
translated: The classification of families exists among the gods who experience desire, where there is a male faculty and a female faculty, but not where they are absent.

original: sogs pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: sogs pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: The Gandharvas and so on do not rule, because the Gandharvas and so on exist even though they are not born.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po med pa ma ning la sogs pa la bu 'byung ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po med pa ma ning la sogs pa la bu 'byung ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, eunuchs and so on, who lack the male and female faculties, do not have the power to give birth.

original: zas la sogs pa ni dbang byed pa yin yang sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pas dbang po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: zas la sogs pa ni dbang byed pa yin yang sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pas dbang po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Although food and so on exercise controlling power, they are not called faculties because they are not included in the enumeration of sentient beings.

original: nye bar spyod pa la ni tshor ba'i dbang po rnams te zhes bya ba ni dbang byed ces bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa la ni tshor ba'i dbang po rnams te zhes bya ba ni dbang byed ces bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The faculties of feeling exercise controlling power with regard to the experience of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because they experience the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po ni lnga ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po ni lnga ste /
translated: The faculties of feeling are five:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: pleasure, pain, mental pleasure, mental pain, and equanimity.

original: de dag ni myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu spyod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu spyod kyi /
translated: They exercise controlling power with regard to the experience of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions because they have the nature of being experienced.

original: ming dang gzugs ni de la dbang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de la dbang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Name and form do not exercise controlling power with regard to that.

original: tshor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of feeling.

original: de'i rgyu'i dngos po ni tshor ba rnam par smin pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i dngos po ni tshor ba rnam par smin pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of being their cause is because feeling is the principal karmic maturation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang pa'o //
translated: Purification in the mundane sphere refers to the abandonment of the mundane defilements.

original: de la dad pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po dang lnga ste /
analyzed: de la dad pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang po dang lnga ste /
translated: Faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are the five faculties.

original: dbang byed ces bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: dbang byed ces bya bar snyegs so //
translated: They are called faculties because they dominate.

original: de dag ni ma dad pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni ma dad pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are antidotes to lack of faith, etc., and are distinguished by the mundane path.

original: gzhan na re thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan na re thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Others say that they are distinguished by being conducive to liberation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dbang byed do zhes bya bar snyegs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dbang byed do zhes bya bar snyegs te /
translated: The faculties of understanding what has not been understood, understanding, and complete understanding are the three pure faculties.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the defilements by the supramundane path is the supramundane purity.

original: de la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po gsum ni dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po gsum ni dbang byed pa ste /
translated: Among these, the three faculties of understanding all, having understood, and having understood all are the dominant faculties.

original: de dag mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam du rim pa bzhin du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam du rim pa bzhin du bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are included in the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no-more-learning, respectively.

original: de la dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / yid dang / bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i @265b bye brag gis ci rigs pa'i dbang du byas te /üîΩdbang po dgu ni mthong ba'i lam la ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / yid dang / bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i @265b bye brag gis ci rigs pa'i dbang du byas te / dbang po dgu ni mthong ba'i lam la ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Among them, the five beginning with faith, the mind, pleasure, mental dissatisfaction, and equanimity, are the nine faculties that are included in the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no-more-learning, respectively.üîΩThe faculty of understanding all is on the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of having understood is on the path of cultivation.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: On the path of no learning, it is called the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams ni gzhan du rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams ni gzhan du rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: YogacƒÅrins posit them differently.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po gnyis la ni dbang po bcu ste /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po gnyis la ni dbang po bcu ste /
translated: The faculty producing complete understanding and the faculty of complete understanding are the ten faculties,

original: sngar smos pa dgu'i nang du yid mi bde ba bsnan na bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar smos pa dgu'i nang du yid mi bde ba bsnan na bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: adding mental dissatisfaction to the nine previously mentioned.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la ni dgu nyid do //üîΩde la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bdag nyid sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam skad cig bco lnga dag la ni yid kyi dbang po dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i bye brag gis ci rigs par bde ba dang /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la ni dgu nyid do // de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bdag nyid sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam skad cig bco lnga dag la ni yid kyi dbang po dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i bye brag gis ci rigs par bde ba dang /
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge is definitely nine.

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: On the path of preparation, which is the nature of the factors conducive to penetrative insight and on the fifteen moments of the path of seeing, any of the faculties of mental satisfaction, pleasure, mental dissatisfaction and equanimity are possessed, since they are respectively possessed in dependence on the stage of unrestricted access concentration and so on.üîΩThe faculty of mental dissatisfaction is not possessed because it is not possessed on the path of seeing.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu thar pa mchog 'dod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu thar pa mchog 'dod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is definitely included in the desire for supreme liberation after the stage of heat in the path of preparation.

original: dbang po 'di bcu ni ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po 'di bcu ni ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: These ten faculties are to be applied as appropriate.

original: sngon kun mi shes pa'i de kho na kun shes par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon kun mi shes pa'i de kho na kun shes par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge is called the faculty producing complete knowledge of what was not previously known because it is engaged in order to completely know the reality that was not previously known.

original: mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du slob pa'i lam de la dbang po rnam pa bcu po de nyid kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du slob pa'i lam de la dbang po rnam pa bcu po de nyid kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge is the ten faculties that are the path of learning from the sixteen moments of the path of seeing up to the vajra like concentration.

original: sngon mi shes pa shes par byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon mi shes pa shes par byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the faculty of complete knowledge because there is nothing more to be known that was previously unknown.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma gtogs par lhag ma rnams kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i ming 'thob po //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma gtogs par lhag ma rnams kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'i ming 'thob po //
translated: On the path of no learning, the faculty of complete knowledge is called the faculty possessing complete knowledge, except for the faculty of mental dissatisfaction.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin pas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin pas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the faculty of one who has understood all because it is the faculty of one who has understood all.

original: de ltar na dbang po la mkhas pa ni skyes bu dang / mthu bo che dang sred med kyi bu la sogs pa la dbang por 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po la mkhas pa ni skyes bu dang / mthu bo che dang sred med kyi bu la sogs pa la dbang por 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who is skilled in the faculties will avoid grasping the great beings, the powerful, and Narayana, etc., as faculties.

original: dbang po'i don gyi 'og tu dus gsum gyi don brjod dgos pas /
analyzed: dbang po'i don gyi 'og tu dus gsum gyi don brjod dgos pas /
translated: The meaning of the three times should be stated immediately following the meaning of the faculties,üîΩthus he says:

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu rgyu rnams spyad zin dang // de bzhin ma spyad @266a * //üîΩgzhan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu rgyu rnams spyad zin dang // de bzhin ma spyad @266a * // gzhan yin no //
translated: The effect is the cause that has already operated,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and that which has not yet operated is different.

original: de la rgyu ni skye bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni skye bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Therein, cause means the cause that generates.

original: 'bras bu ni tshes pa sdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni tshes pa sdus pa'o //
translated: Effect means that which is to be generated.

original: rgyu spyad zin pa ni 'bras bu phyung zin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu spyad zin pa ni 'bras bu phyung zin pa'o //
translated: The cause that has already operated is the effect that has already arisen.

original: 'bras bu spyad zin pa ni myong nas yongs su zad pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu spyad zin pa ni myong nas yongs su zad pa ste /
translated: The effect that has already operated is that which has already been experienced and has completely ceased.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu dang de'i 'bras bu ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu dang de'i 'bras bu ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The cause and its effect that are of that kind are past.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang de'i rgyu spyad zin pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang de'i rgyu spyad zin pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus so //
translated: Therefore, the past time is when the effect and its cause have been used up.

original: rnam pa 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu dang / rgyu ma spyad pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di nyid kyi 'bras bu dang / rgyu ma spyad pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
translated: The future time is when the effect and its cause have not yet been used up.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus ni da ltar gyi tshe'i rgyus 'bras bu byin pa'i phyir rgyu spyad pa'i don dang de'i 'bras bu ni da ltar gyi tshe rjes su 'brang ba nyid de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus ni da ltar gyi tshe'i rgyus 'bras bu byin pa'i phyir rgyu spyad pa'i don dang de'i 'bras bu ni da ltar gyi tshe rjes su 'brang ba nyid de /
translated: The present time is when the cause has the meaning of being used up, because the effect is given by the present life, and its effect is the present life itself, because the effect has not yet been used up.

original: 'bras bu ma spyad pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i dus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma spyad pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i dus su rig par bya'o //
translated: The present time should be understood in this way.

original: dngos po rnams kyi skad cig so so ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pas skad cig nyid kyi dbang du byas te dus rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skad cig so so ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pas skad cig nyid kyi dbang du byas te dus rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The individual moments of things are the entities of cause and effect. Therefore, time should be understood as being established in terms of momentariness.

original: de la rgyu spyad zin pa ni rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu spyad zin pa ni rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the cause has been used up because it has generated its effect.

original: 'bras bu spyad zin pa ni 'bras bu skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu spyad zin pa ni 'bras bu skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect has been used up because it is destroyed immediately after it arises.

original: de ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu ma spyad pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu dang rgyu ma spyad pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus te /
translated: Thus, the future time is not experienced as effect and cause.

original: dgos pa ma bskyed pa dang ma skyes pa la zhig pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu ma spyad par rig par bya'o //üîΩrgyu spyad la 'bras bu ma spyad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu spyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ma bskyed pa dang ma skyes pa la zhig pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu ma spyad par rig par bya'o // rgyu spyad la 'bras bu ma spyad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu spyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the future time is not experienced as effect and cause because the effect has not yet been produced and the cause has not yet arisen, since what has not been produced and what has not arisen do not yet exist.üîΩThe past time is not experienced as cause, but is experienced as effect.üîΩThe present time is experienced as both cause and effect.üîΩThe past time is experienced as cause, but not as effect, because the cause has already produced its effect.

original: dgos pa ma zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma spyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ma zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma spyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The present time is experienced as both cause and effect, because the cause has already produced its effect, and the effect has not yet ceased.

original: de ltar dus la mkhas pa ni dus ma gtogs par gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir bdag rtag par 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dus la mkhas pa ni dus ma gtogs par gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir bdag rtag par 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who is skilled in the times does not conceive of a self that is permanent, because one does not observe anything other than the times.

original: dus gsum gyi don gyi 'og tu bden pa bzhi'i don brjod dgos pas /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi don gyi 'og tu bden pa bzhi'i don brjod dgos pas /
translated: The meaning of the four noble truths should be mentioned after the meaning of the three times.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa'i don //
analyzed: de'i phyir / tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa'i don //
translated: The meaning of feeling and its cause,

original: de yi rgyu ni sgrub pa yin //üîΩzhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de yi rgyu ni sgrub pa yin // zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: and the cause of that cause.üîΩThe meaning of feeling and its cause is the truth of suffering.

original: tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes 'jig rten na grags so //
analyzed: tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes 'jig rten na grags so //
translated: The cause of that cause is the truth of origination.

original: bstan bcos las kyang gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge also states:

original: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhe'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhe'o //
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering here.

original: bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i don yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa byed @266b pas kyang /
analyzed: bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i don yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa byed @266b pas kyang /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the classification of the four truths is the meaning of the truth of suffering, which includes all contaminated feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain, together with their causes, the author of the commentary states:

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa'i don zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa'i don zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The truth of suffering is the meaning of feeling and its causes.

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin par ci mngon zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin par ci mngon zhe na / de'i phyir gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it known that all feelings are suffering?‚Äù

original: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúBecause it is said, ‚ÄòWhatever is felt is suffering here.‚Äô‚Äù

original: tshor ba de dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams su ji ltar mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: tshor ba de dag kyang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams su ji ltar mthun du sbyar te /
translated: These feelings are to be connected with the three kinds of suffering, as is appropriate: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: They are suffering.

original: yang na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Or, they are suffering because of the suffering of the formative forces.

original: tshor ba'i rgyu ni tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyu ni tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The causes of feeling should be understood as the dharmas that are the basis of feeling.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni tshor ba'i gnas rnams so //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams ni tshor ba'i gnas rnams so //
translated: The dharmas that are the basis of feeling are those that are to be experienced as pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de ltar phung po lnga po dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden par bstan pa yin no //üîΩde'i rgyu ni sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga po dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden par bstan pa yin no // de'i rgyu ni sgrub pa yin /
translated: Thus, the five aggregates are taught as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe cause of that is the truth of origination.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause of that is the truth of origination.

original: de'i zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is to be connected with the truth of suffering.

original: sgrub pa gang gis sdug bsngal skyed pa ni bsgrub pa ste kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa gang gis sdug bsngal skyed pa ni bsgrub pa ste kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: That which is accomplished is the origin, because it generates suffering.

original: de yang tshor ba dang tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la sred pa'i rgyu sngon du song ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid rab tu g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang tshor ba dang tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la sred pa'i rgyu sngon du song ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid rab tu g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of the body, speech and mind to be agitated, preceded by craving for the feelings and the dharmas that are the basis of the feelings.

original: mdor na yang srid pa kun nas slong ba'i las ni kun 'byung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na yang srid pa kun nas slong ba'i las ni kun 'byung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, the origin is taught as the karma that instigates renewed existence.

original: de gnyis zhi ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis zhi ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The truth of cessation is for the sake of the pacification of those two.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gnyis so //
translated: Those two are the two truths of suffering and origin.

original: zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of pacification is for the sake of non-arising.

original: de ltar rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gog pa la rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gog pa la rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, cessation is taught as having two aspects because it has the characteristic of the non-arising of suffering together with its cause.

original: kun 'byung ba zhi ba'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba zhi ba'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is with a remainder of the aggregates for the sake of the pacification of the origin.

original: sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: and the absence of the remainder of the aggregates for the purpose of the pacification of suffering.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis kyi gnyen po'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni lam gyi bden pa'o //üîΩde ltar bden pa la mkhas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba tsam rtogs nas de @267a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis kyi gnyen po'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni lam gyi bden pa'o // de ltar bden pa la mkhas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba tsam rtogs nas de @267a * //
translated: The path that is the antidote to both suffering and its origin is the truth of the path, for the purpose of the cessation of suffering and its origin.

original: dag las gzhan pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dag las gzhan pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one who is skilled in the truths understands the mere afflicted and the pure, and then turns away from the apprehension of affliction and purification that are other than those.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: bden pa rnams kyi don gyi 'og tu theg pa gsum gyi don bstan par bya ste /üîΩde'i phyir / yon tan skyon dang rnam mi rtog / shes pas gzhan las bdag gis ni //üîΩnges par 'byung phyir gzhan zhes bya //
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi don gyi 'og tu theg pa gsum gyi don bstan par bya ste / de'i phyir / yon tan skyon dang rnam mi rtog / shes pas gzhan las bdag gis ni // nges par 'byung phyir gzhan zhes bya //
translated: After the meaning of the truths, the meaning of the three vehicles should be taught.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩOne should understand the three vehiclesüîΩthrough the distinctions of weak, medium, and greatüîΩin terms of lineage, aspiration,üîΩand the accomplishment of one‚Äôs own goal.üîΩOne should understand the three vehiclesüîΩthrough the distinctions of weak, medium, and greatüîΩin terms of lineage, aspiration,üîΩand the accomplishment of one‚Äôs own goal.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yon tan dang skyon shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba gnyis ka dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yon tan dang skyon shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba gnyis ka dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù should be applied to both ‚Äúknowledge of good qualities and faults‚Äù and ‚Äúnonconceptual wisdom.‚Äù

original: yang na bar du rnam par rtog / ces bya ba'i sgra zhig ma smos par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bar du rnam par rtog / ces bya ba'i sgra zhig ma smos par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúin between‚Äù should be viewed as unstated.

original: de la yon tan dang skyon shes pa ni gzhan las dang bdag gis zhes phye ste brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan dang skyon shes pa ni gzhan las dang bdag gis zhes phye ste brjod par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge of good qualities and faults‚Äù should be stated as ‚Äúfrom others‚Äù and ‚Äúfrom oneself.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ni bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ni bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúNonconceptual wisdom‚Äù is from oneself.

original: de bas na 'grel pa las ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na 'grel pa las ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the commentary states, ‚Äúas is appropriate.‚Äù

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba la yon tan dang skyon du shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba la yon tan dang skyon du shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge of good qualities and faults regarding nirvana and samsara‚Äù means

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir lam dang 'gog par gzung ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir lam dang 'gog par gzung ste /
translated: the term ‚Äúnirvana‚Äù here includes the path and cessation,

original: dper na rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the term ‚Äúpeace.‚Äù

original: de la 'gog pa la ni zhi ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa dang / lam la nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa la sogs par shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'gog pa la ni zhi ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa dang / lam la nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa la sogs par shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du shes pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, the knowledge of cessation as the aspects of peace, etc., and the knowledge of the path as the aspects of definite emergence, etc., is the knowledge of the virtues of nirvana.

original: 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid de //
translated: Samsara is the nature of suffering and origination.

original: de yang mi rtag pa dag sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa la sogs par shes pa ni 'khor ba la skyon du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa dag sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa la sogs par shes pa ni 'khor ba la skyon du shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the knowledge of impermanence as the aspects of suffering, etc., and the knowledge of origination as the aspects of conditions, etc., is the knowledge of the faults of samsara.

original: gzhan las thos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa las mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gnyis kyi yon tan dang skyon ji skad du smos pa thos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las thos zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa las mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba gnyis kyi yon tan dang skyon ji skad du smos pa thos pa'o //
translated: As it is heard from others means hearing from the Buddha, Bodhisattvas, etc. the virtues and faults of nirvana and samsara as mentioned.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of definite emergence means because of emerging from samsara.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The vehicle of the disciples is so called because one is liberated by relying on the words of another.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya bas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las bye brag tu ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya bas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las bye brag tu ston to //
translated: The vehicle of the disciples is distinguished from the vehicle of the solitary realizers by the word ‚Äúdisciples.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba gnyis la yon tan dang skyon du shes nas sangs @267b rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan las ma thos par bdag gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba gnyis la yon tan dang skyon du shes nas sangs @267b rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan las ma thos par bdag gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The vehicle of the solitary realizers is so called because one is liberated by oneself, without listening to the words of another, after having understood the virtues and faults of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: gzhan las ma thos par bdag gis shes par bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las bye brag tu bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan las ma thos par bdag gis shes par bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las bye brag tu bstan to //
translated: The vehicle of the disciples is distinguished by the phrase ‚Äúwithout listening to the words of another.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gnyis brjod du med par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gnyis brjod du med par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The vehicle of the bodhisattvas is so called because one is liberated by nonconceptual wisdom, which is the realization that the phenomena of cyclic existence and nirvana are inexpressible.

original: gzhan las ma thos par bdag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i //
analyzed: gzhan las ma thos par bdag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i //
translated: Because it is a vehicle that one goes forth by oneself, without hearing from another.

original: 'dir ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las ye shes kyis bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: 'dir ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las ye shes kyis bye brag tu byas so //
translated: Here, the Great Vehicle is distinguished from the Vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas by its knowledge.

original: gzhan dag na re gzhan las thos nas gang zag la bdag med pa'i yul can yon tan dang skyon du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis nges par 'byung ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzhan las thos nas gang zag la bdag med pa'i yul can yon tan dang skyon du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis nges par 'byung ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: Others say: The Vehicle of the Listeners is the vehicle that goes forth by means of the knowledge that has as its object the selflessness of the person, without discriminating between good qualities and faults, after having heard from another.

original: mnyam pa la mi ltos par bdag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa la mi ltos par bdag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The Vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas is the vehicle that goes forth by itself, without relying on another.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa chos la bdag med pa'i yul can rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa chos la bdag med pa'i yul can rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the vehicle that goes forth by means of the knowledge that has as its object the selflessness of dharmas, by means of the non-discriminating knowledge that brings about the attainment of the nirvana without remainder.

original: rnam par bshad pa 'di ni 'grel pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'di ni 'grel pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: This explanation contradicts the commentary.

original: de ltar theg pa gsum la mkhas pa ni rnal 'byor tsam du zad par mthong bas bdag rnal 'byor can du 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar theg pa gsum la mkhas pa ni rnal 'byor tsam du zad par mthong bas bdag rnal 'byor can du 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, seeing that expertise in the three vehicles is merely a yoga, the self-grasping of the yogi is reversed.

original: nga ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: I am now going to explain the meaning of the compounded and the uncompounded.üîΩThe nominal, the causal, the causal process,

original: btags bcas rgyur bcas rgyu mtshan dang // rab tu zhi ba don bcas ni //
analyzed: btags bcas rgyur bcas rgyu mtshan dang // rab tu zhi ba don bcas ni //
translated: the pacifying, the goal,

original: tha ma nyid du bshad pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: tha ma nyid du bshad pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: are explained as the last.

original: tha mar bshad pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha mar bshad pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is explained as the last?
